As a Scandinavian, it was a little extra fun to see that our part of the world was represented by Christmas trees and 'Santa's workshop' - but if it is Christmas then it is!

We were on a two night stop over and brought tickets from the hotel to this attraction . We travelled on the subway , which was extremely clean & much better than the tubes in London ( which I hate ) . From the subway the gardens are well signposted . The gardens are huge and unfortunately due to our jet lag and the heat we didn‚Äôt manage to see it all.

We did find the ticket situation confusing as you need to pay extra to see some parts . We had intended to stay until the evening so we could see the towers lit up but our tickets only gave access to 3:30 pm and then due to the Christmas show you had to buy additional tickets for access from 5 pm .

There are a couple of snack bars / cafes and a restaurant plus the usual MacDonalds (Yuk) . You could easily spend all day here especially if you like gardening but be aware of the heat

REVIEW_TITLE: Great indoor gardens with beautiful exhibits of plant arrangements and statues
REVIEW_BODY: You could easily spend a day here walking through the indoor exhibits. The gardens are meticulous manicured with beautiful sculptures and statues. Christmas time is a wonderful time to visit with all of the holiday themes. Relatively inexpensive at 20 Singapore dollars ($15 US) for one to visit the Flower dome.

Lots of ways to spend loads of money here! You could walk around for free but the beautiful domes are worth the visit. Take a jumper or cardigan as they are quite cool! So many tourists it‚Äôs hard to dodge the photos. Satay by the bay was a really cool food place! Plenty of room and Asian variety! Difficult for vegetarians but there are a couple of veggie/noodle choices. I need to come back here as one day wasn‚Äôt enough.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic and a Horticultural gem with outstanding displays in Domes.
REVIEW_BODY: This is a place I keep going back to as it is memorable. There is so much to see in the domes and whole area. The evening musical show was magical, A fabulous place for all ages and great right now with Xmas decorations.

‚Ä¶.AND PRICE DOESN‚ÄôT GET MUCH SMALLER THAN ZERO‚Ä¶.

‚Ä¶..which you can do seeing admission is free and there‚Äôs a lot to see without having to spend extra.
Of course you can spend extra once inside - on entry to the CLOUD FOREST or the OCBC SKYWAY, not to mention riding the shuttle across the gardens. Of these, we did the last immediately on mainly entry to orientate ourselves to the layout ‚Äì once aware, it was a relatively short and very scenic walk back via SUPERTREE GROVE to the entry near BAYFRONT MRT.
We gave the SKYWAY a miss on account a nearby rumbling electrical storm had entry temporarily suspended and time constraints forced us to miss the CLOUD FOREST. Next time.
Speaking of time ‚Äì if you decided to take in everything on offer I reckon you could spend most of the day here ‚Äì and certainly fill a full morning or afternoon. Our truncated but very satisfying dash thru the place took up abt 2 hours.

PRACTICALITIES ‚Äì no shortage of shaded seating, rest rooms and refreshment outlets.
- the entry to the GARDENS is well signposted from within BAYFRONT MRT ‚Äì you have abt a 300m walk from the platforms.

SUM UP: I won‚Äôt try to describe everything on view ‚Äì suffice to say that I‚Äôm not a garden person but found the whole place excellent. And there‚Äôs something: of my over 450 TRIPADVISOR reviews, I‚Äôve only rated abt half a dozen other venues EXCELLENT.
My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Gardens by the Bay - but the Cloud Forset was without a doubt the highlight. A wonderland designed to both enchant and to encourage conservation...
Amazing place with a bridge. You can walk around in the beautiful garden for free! Only for the bridge you need to purchase a ticket, but it worth it.

Had heard and read a lot about this attraction of Singapore, but never imagined that it could be so. It is a place to be seen to believe. Both the domes are excellent and very well kept. The exhibits are there of highest quality and have been beautifully and artistically presented. Once you enter this garden, you are transported to another world. It is very hard to say bye bye to this amazing garden.

Absolutely georgeous. There will naturally be a bunch of tourists so try to go early or late afternoon (but arrive no later than 4/5pm) and get the triple entry pass to see it all. It's all worth it... and afterwards you can go see the gardens' light show.

I am typically not fond of man made structures, so the lights held no appeal to me. The gardens are however very impressive, among the best I have seen. The plants growing up the sides of the artificial trees are a work of art, kudos to the botany team that created this and ensure that they thrive. A sizable part of the gardens is accessible for free, a real perk if one only has a few hours. Worth a visit and lovely for kids and adults alike.

apart from the rain it is an experience not to be missed.The 4D Flight of the Dragonfly in the theater was amazing,beautiful flowers, trees and cacti all over and the living trees are exeptional.it was such a shame we could not see the night show as video from a frien was great

We spent about 5 hours here from late afternoon to after dark. We enjoyed walking around the park, the space, different gardens which were free. We paid to enter the domes which I thought was worth the expense . There are sculptures throughout the gardens and interesting views. There are opportunities to rest, relax and take some refreshments.
The Christmas Fayre was on which was an additional expense which provided an additional level of interest to experience on our holiday.

I‚Äôve visited the Flower Dome several times with my teenagers. They both love Nature, have a thing for photography and welcome the occasional respite from the hot and humid tropical climate. It‚Äôs on TOP of my ‚Äòto do‚Äô list whenever family and friends visit.
Not only does one get to appreciate native flora form different climatic zones of the World but there are seasonal highlights to be enjoyed as well. For example Tulips, Cherry Blossoms and Roses, to mention a few. There‚Äôs also an interesting Rain Forest Dome. There a lot of science behind this too connected with Water filter action and management. There‚Äôs no way to get bored!
Lots of places to eat within the area( but outside the Domes and the usual facilities one can expect in Singapore.

Go there and enjoy in the garden. It is very clean and realy nice. Everyone are very helpfull. And The rain forest is also realy nice. But NOTE...it is realy coold inside- we been there in a rainy day.

REVIEW_TITLE: Iconic sight that has to be seen
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit albeit the pricing is a bit mad. Combinations of this and that sight but ultimately at c¬£20pp not bad. Our visit was impacted by a monsoon so could only do the Cloud forest and flower dome as inside. So missed Xmas wonderland and tree walk. The shuttle was useful especially as the weather was inclement. If you are dodgy with heights and suffer from vertigo then the cloud forest and tree walk in the special trees are a challenge!

Gardens by the Bay...A must for anyone visiting Singapore. I am a regular traveller to SG and bring friends here, always fascinated by the magnificence of this place and the extravaganza bi-monthly displays eplicable to the time of year..

When going to Singapore it a visit must. We saw it a few years ago it‚Äôs still clean tidy and entertaining however just a we were about leave lights erupted and a full scale Christmas display cane to life fabulous

I will limit this revue just to the Christmas wonderland lights.
The normally free tree extravaganza in the eves is ten Singapore dollars for entry during the winter wonderland. Their are plenty of stalls selling food, gifts etc. The ‚Äòsinging trees‚Äô were performing at 7.45 and 8.45pm. If you wished to go up to the tree walkway, this was an extra eight Singapore dollars - worth every penny and the long queue.
Due to heavy rain shortly after the end of the 8.45pm performance, I did not get chance to enjoy any of the other winter wonderland offerings, which was a big shame.
Must visit this place. Never seen like this anywhere before. Take good camera to take lots of pictures.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great time at gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Very good place to take the family or possible see yourself of with your partner. Nothing like you've experienced before so you have to see it first hand for yourself to see what all the fuss is about. Well worth the visit while staying in Singapore!
Not to be missed, a real feat of engineering and creativity. The indoor waterfall and rain Forrest‚Äôs were amazing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit, with some tips to help you
REVIEW_BODY:
I am sure everyone has heard how beautiful it is. I'll focus on a few details, so you can plan your visit better.
1. There is a free outdoor water park for kids. Swimsuits are not compulsory (but recommended) Remember to bring along a change of clothes so they can enjoy it!
2. The lunch options are not great, with limited places and a huge crowd forming long queues all the time. Pack some snacks for quick bites so the kids don't feel too hungry while you head over to nearby Marina Bay Sands with plenty of options. Or if you are there in the evening, you can bring a picnic mat and stroll over to nearby Marina barrage for a picnic!
3. If you visit at night, don't forget your mosquito repellent! In my experience, they get really hungry at night...
This venue is a must see for everyone who visits Singapore. Make sure you plan your visit for when they do the evening light show.
Must visit when in Singapore. The supertrees are so cool. Really lovely at night with all the lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place to visit, MUST DO in Singapore!!
REVIEW_BODY:
We booked to go to the Gardens by the Bay on a mid afternoon slot which we knew would lead into the early evening time - our idea was we would get the best of both, explore the indoor stuff and all the flowers etc in the light and then get the SuperTree show at nightfall! And we loved it!

A MUST DO whilst in Singapore really, was as reasonable priced as you could expect for Singapore and we spent roughly 3-4 hours there if I remember correctly. The flowers, trees and everything in the gardens are absolutely beautiful and as for the SuperTrees and the show it was absolutely spectacular, really was blown away by it! The views from the bay in general are just fantastic and very romantic!

A final note, we found it easy to get too by taxi or it looked like it was reasonable to get to by foot also.

100% recommended.

Marina Barrage is a must visit for a great glimpse of the Singapore skyline. Suitable place to workout or just take a stroll. If your new to Singapore. Take the opportunity to soak in the green and garden city which Singapore is modeled on. Conclude with a meal at Satay by the Bay.

This place is definitely out of this world, one of a kind. Worth a visit. There are a lot of attractions that are probably worth buying the combination passes. We bought a ticket to one attraction which was over quickly and not totally worth the money

We bought our tickets online and were able to go straight through the turnstiles. We had to get the Christmas Wonderland tickets as well to get to the Supertrees. Christmas Wonderland tickets had to be collected at the venue. I don‚Äôt feel like it is worth the extra money but we had to get it to get close to the Supertrees as well as the skywalk (separate ticket to be purchased onsite). The Cloud Forest was very impressive with a tall waterfall.
There is quite a bit of walking to get to the main lobby so put on your comfy shoes!
Loved the gardens n was immersed in this indoor activity. Busy due to peak times in Christmas enjoyable non the less.

REVIEW_TITLE: Obligatory visit if you go to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Perfectly designed, the best botanical garden I never see. Harmony and good taste in every detail. Thousand of plants well maintained, not miss to see this magic place

We had hoped to visit these gardens the night before and watch the light show with the music but jetlag got in the way.As we had a few hours to kill in the morning, we took a taxi from the hotel down to these gardens and had a wander round. Very pleasant. It was quite early in the morning and it was good to see that they are well used by local joggers and walkers. I only visited the botanic house. Which was decorated in a Christmas style at the time. It was interesting and air conditioned, which was welcome

We had visited the gardens on a previous trip to Singapore, but this time we went in the evening. There were very few people around which allowed a pleasant stroll through the gardens which were all illuminated and looked wonderful
This is really a horticultural museum and the set out allows a close look at the millions of plants on display.
I would really recommend a visit at night

I visit this place 1-3 times a year. Flower dome is always changing and there are new exhibits / themes to look out for each time. For people who would be keen to dine at Pollen Cafe or Fennel Cafe within the dome, pls note that dining at the cafe includes free entry to Flower Dome (after meal), I.e. enter from the outside entrance of the cafe, and exit into Flower Dome.

If you are a nature lover, specifically a flower lover, the "Tita-in-plant" self of yours will surely be satisfied. Its amazing how such a garden fit inside and how they were able to build a terrain of flowers inside. It gets crowded from time to time so strategize when you will visit so there will be less people. Bring a jacket as its cold inside.

Went to Flower Dome & Christmas Wonder Land.
Had fun at Gardens By the Bay. Will be nice to have more water dispenser places.

REVIEW_TITLE: A visit to Garden by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Nice n refreshing place to spent time with family members. There are many species n colourful flowers and plants for photo shoot.
A unique and nice place to explore flowers, trees etc. Should visit both the Dome. Children friendly too. Love the light show of the gigantic man made super trees. Excellent
Too many people inside the flower dome. And in every step of the way you'll feel sorry for obstructing others from taking selfie/photos.

It was so fun that my friend and I had a great time in Gardens By The Bay! We planned to get the tickets through online along with the Christmas bundle season. We are able to choose withing two dorms OR just one including with the Christmas Wonderland ticket since it is Christmas bundle. We managed to get the two dorms and Christmas Wonderland ticket online. It was so smooth and the staff are very welcoming. At 4pm itself, we left Cloud Forest and saw so many visitor queuing up to purchase the Christmas Wonderland ticket. To me, it's worth paying the tickets to get to visit the Gardens By the Bay as a holiday activity. I advised and highly recommend visitors to get their tickets online as it is much easier and minimum time of queuing.
Do not miss this experience. Besides being a very relaxing way to spend several hours, you will be amazed at the awesome variety. More than once I remarked how did they do this!

REVIEW_TITLE: Day then later, an evening visit to Gardens Bay the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is amazing ad the main gardens are free. Entrance to the two domes is not expensive and well worth seeing. An evening visit to music and light show in the gardens was free and absolutely fabulous.
So colourful and so so beautiful. Worth the visit! Highly recommended!!! Near to casino and huge shopping Malls. Taxi easily available

we were lucky enough to visit during december , and marvelled at the christmas displays in the flower dome , they were just stunning and well worth the entrance fee , then we went into the cloud dome and that just blew us away , the size and scale of the dome is staggering , you really must visit .

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to spend a few hours
REVIEW_BODY: I visited on a Sunday and so did many Singaporeans! The new floral display was a feast for the eyes and ended with a 10 minute Disney type experience in a theatre show where you had a dragonfly flight through the park. The two domes were interesting and again visually amazing. The grounds are well looked after and a very enjoyable way to while away a few hours. There is a walkway overlooking the park (extra surcharge of 8 SGP dollars) , a children‚Äôs wet play area and some nice ponds. Plenty of places to eat.

Visited this on stop over for just over a day. The gardens are lovely and well laid out but the jewels are the 2 domes- Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.
In Flower Dome we were amazed at the different gardens of the world- each awesome- for example -never realised there were so many different types of cactus.
The Cloud Forest with its huge waterfall and cascading plants and flowers were breathtaking. The range of beautiful orchid flowers was very impressive.
Would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore
Amazing!!!! A must see attraction!! Give it a full day to justify its creation . Start the day around 3, visit the outdoors area and visits the domes at dusk to feel the full impact

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice and beautiful place worth to visit!
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is a beautiful and full of garden artistry concept place with flowers and fauna. My visit was during this Christmas season which the bay all set with Christmas displays and decorations, worth to spend time to enjoy the nature of it!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice walk around this garden park
REVIEW_BODY: Love this area, free park area walking amongst the super tall man made trees. Amazing structures. There is a restaurant inside this vast area to cool off and have refreshments along the way. There are paid options to go up to the top of the trees as well. We did not visit at night when the lights were on but have heard they are stunning.
You can walk around at leisure or take a guide. Either way very enjoyable. Reclaimed land and exotic species vessel curated. Enjoy!

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous and a must see while in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: You must visit this iconic place, which is large, green, crowded at times, and simply breathtaking. Whether you like plants or not, you will love this tranquil place. It‚Äôs probably better on a weekday, but even the weekends are fine. The little cafe is good, too.

The light show was just amazing and all the plants were just beautiful. Would liked to of see more but just ran out of time. Will go back and spends more time viewing ll the beautiful areas. I would recommend that you go and spend a day there, such a beautiful light show

I must confess to beings a bit underwhelmed by these gardens, mainly I think because the large artificial trees look just that, artificial. Stills,a pleasant area to visit and while away an hour or so.

This was the highlight of our visit to singapore. The gardens are in incredible domes. The flower dome had transformed into a winter wonderland. The waterfall in the cloud forest is spectacular
Both domes are brilliant.
The light show in the evening is sensational.

A beautiful concept, truly with a visit. Take your time and wander through picturesque paradise.
Our visit was during the day, as we were into flowers and fauna. However a night visit when all the lights turn is a totally different experience.
Do both!!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see if you're a gardener (or even if you are not)
REVIEW_BODY: We were absolutely mesmerized by the beauty of the this place. Saw our houseplants ten times bigger that they were at home.
Highly recommend that you take the time to visit this beautiful place. Albeit, there is enough to see an do for the whole day, you can easily absorb the beauty in a half day.
Gardens by the bay is all set to welcome Christmas to Singapore. Covered with decorations, xmas trees , Santas in the flower dome .

REVIEW_TITLE: A must-go for people visiting SG
REVIEW_BODY: One of the most popular places in Singapore for a reason. Not only a tourist trap. Both flower domes are fantastic. Especially the cloud forest. The skywalk is a bit underwhelming though. There is a lot to see for free just walking around in the area. The tickets for the domes and skywalk are a bit pricy, but I guess needed for crowd control.
Superb views from the Gardens by the bay. We like the nature of the garden and the bridge which gives you a panoramic view of Singapore!

This place is a must see and do be prepared to walk a lot but you will not be disappointed I recommend you buy the package bundle which allows you 3 x park entry and a shuttle bus ride all the parks are reasonably close

‚ÄúGardens‚Äù does not do this place justice. It is 100 hectares of lush tropical forest with walkways and water features. There are play parks for kids and designated picnic areas but the main event is the pay to enter attractions namely the misty mountain and floral garden both of which are a must see and worth the entrance fee. In the mountain walk you can see meat eating plants and walk through a corridor of orchids. There a huge waterfall and tropical plants and trees from all around the world. Inside, it is a riot of colors and smells wonderful.
In the floral gardens they already had a Christmas theme set up so you can walk through pine trees to Santa‚Äôs cabin and all the rest of it. Needles to say, it wears packed full of super happy kids!
Inside or out (even in the rain!), this is a beautifully maintained well laid out forest-garden-park walk.
A must see.
Tip: the giant steel flowers. Walk (climb). Them only if you are fit and active as it is a tiring climb just to see the trees from above but most importantly. Time your visit here so that you can see these trees at night. The subtle light show is truly lovely and you cannot come to singapore and miss this night time attraction

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay light show
REVIEW_BODY: Just a wonderful green space and evening light show. A must see. The flower dome was great as was the waterfall dome. You have to visit this free garden.

Cannot believe the quality of plants on display. The attention to detail is fantastic. Surprised to
See the Australian bottle trees. I have never seen them look so good. The plants are thriving

If you enjoy gardens & nature then a visit to this wonderful place is a must. It is also a fantastic man made development & the 2 massive domes that house the special exhibitions are sensational structures. We enjoyed everything we saw & did. The gardens are magnificent & nothing like anything I have seen before. An added bonus for us was all the Christmas displays & decorations . It is a place not to be rushed. We spent 6 hours.
A place where you can relax... good for a short nature getaway. Very cooling and refreshing environment. People are very accommodating

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see whilst in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens you can wander through for free. wonderful experience in the biomes, You can pay for a ticket for both biomes and the skywalk. Well worth a visit at night for the light display.

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning, Amazing, well worth the price
REVIEW_BODY:
If you love plants and nature, if you'd like a break from the heat, and if you know the excellence that most everything in Singapore comes with then this is a place to visit and enjoy.
The whole complex is amazing and overwhelming in the variety and complexity of what is on display. It's not inexpensive to visit but it is worth the expense. The waterfall garden is a wonderful walk through the humid coolness of the massive greenhouse, and when you go to the Arborium and see the huge specimens collected from around the world, well I was amazed and wondering how they transported these massive palms and baobab trees to this site. It is by far the best collection I have ever seen

The creative person who has designed the Garden must really be a God gifted individual. The passages are broad. Flowers to be seen are plenty. The greenery is beyond imagination. The passages are lined on both sides with exquisite flowers. The succulent section has many varieties. The small flowers and the 'Alice in Wonderland' area is a thought that brought out old memories. Pretty decent and a must to see.

this is already my 4th time visiting gardens by the bay, and if i may say, it will get boring sometime if you dont know what the flower theme will be. to me, i really love christmas and its wonderful decoration, so seeing Poinsettia and christmas trees every year is not a big of a deal.

Spent 4 hours here from 5pm to 9pm .2 excellant domes full of christmas plants, flowers and trees also gigantic indoor waterfall. At 9 pm the park comes alive with illuminations and Classical music. Was told at the hotel this was the best time to visit this attraction ...they were right.

Amazing place, one of a kind in the world. A must go visit during your stay in Singapore, with friends, family or even solo. A place to spend some time there contemplating the garden and the great job done there

A proud Singapore icon. Never tired of it as they changed the setting every few months. Love the domes, love the cool inside and the lovely decor and plenty of seats for you to rest and enjoy the view! A must go for everyone

Great concept. We have wonderful experience there. Buy 2 bundling tickets for flower dome & cloud forrest. There are free area around the dome which so great too. Definetely a must visit when you go to Singapore.
Christmas at the gardens was spectacular. Worth yhd visit. Eben if not lit for Christmas it would be spectacular.

This was a very beautiful afternoon. It took us around 4 hours and we still did not do or see all.
The cloud garden was my favourite amongst two ticketed parts. However, there is so much to see - a vast park area can be visited without a ticket - if we‚Äôd known that we wouldn‚Äôt have bothered buying a ticket.
Take at least 4-5 hours.

There is no charge to enter the gardens so dont be sold a ticket unless you want to go inside the domes or walk the aerial walk between the man made trees.
Very nice at dusk when the light show begins. We did the aerialk walk and the cloud dome. Both were experiences that once done dont need to be repeated in my opinion. The gardens are very pleasant to walk around though

Great experience. Exotic . Awesome .amazing .it's really very beautiful and colourful place .the weather plays a big part at evening . Play a music from flowers and plants. Take me to another world. If you like to visit Singapore. U must visit garden's by the bay at evening time. ü•∞

The domes were amazing. Especially the cloud dome.
The walkway was interesting but visiting early december made it a christmas visit, so loads of plinky plonky carols.
Come here to be inspired by the wonderful colours of the flora in the flower dome. Don't forget to enjoy the refreshing breeze from Cloud Forest's waterfall!

A great place to visit both day and night. I initially visited during the day lovely and peaceful even though busy lovely scenery great photo opportunities. I visited again at night as I wanted to see the lights and music show as it is Christmas show at the moment it costs to get in but normally it‚Äôs free. You can still see and hear from the outside so if you are trying to budget it can still be done. The area is quite busy at night but loads to see and the area is so different at night with all the lights

Gardens by the bay were one of my favourite things to do in Singapore. The flowers and displays are beautiful and very creative. It‚Äôs a great place to spend a few hours or the whole day! There‚Äôs lots to do and see and great for the whole family and friends! Definitely recommend!!

Spent a couple of hours walking around, which is magical. Christmas wonderland was open. We paid $20 each to walk the botanical glass houses which were lovely well stocked and professionally planted. My beef was the price as this money didnt include the bridge walk or access to lazer lights. Few places to eat, including McDonalds and good toilets around. Mostly flat walking good paths

The gardens are truly amazing. We had intended not to stay long but once we were there we ended up staying all afternoon and into the evening to watch the Garden Rhapsody. The Cloud Forest dome was amazing and was nice and cool after the heat outside, the Flower Dome was not as good.
Definitely recommend a wonder round but watch the clock if you‚Äôre on a tight schedule as the time flys by.
What a place to visit. We got on a hop on hop off bus, got to Gardens by the Bay and took the tour.. So inexpensive and so informative. The plants and flowers are incredible.

Was a little bit disappointment we had to pay to get right in under the trees for the light show because of the Christmas Wonderland display, but it was well worth it, both the light show and the Christmas display were amazing.
Book online before you go though as it is almost twice the price at the gate.

Gardens by the Bay is totally amazing. No where else in the world will you find such a beautiful and educational experience. The tallest indoor waterfall in the world. Awesome.
Very senior friendly...seats everywhere.

REVIEW_TITLE: large park and lots to see
REVIEW_BODY: We spent time wandering around this park and stayed for the evening show of lights and music in the trees. Well worth the visit.
Amazing both day and night but night is extra special! you can easily spend a few hours walking around the giant glowing trees as well as cloud forest. Really something different than anything else.

It's gorgeous, it's amazing. We were lucky enough to watch the light show at night from the skyway, up there. It was an amazing experience... breathtaking! I don't understand how someone cannot give it 5 stars, I swear!!! We were there and went to all domes during the whole day. Then we went back at night to enjoy a different feeling. Best part of my trip!!!

This garden keeps getting better. Don't just visit the 3 domes. The rest of the garden are equally charming and on a nice weather, you can find a place to sit and just enjoy being amongst the beautiful greenery and scenery.
I was surprised how much fun this visit was.. it is done SUPER well and you will not regret the visit...
Excellent. Different types of plants in Cloud forest and flowers in Flower Dome are a pleasing sight.
Visited this very nice green garden where you can see the famous Supertree . Recomended to bring hats as it is very hot during sunny day. Do take a lot photos here at the garden

It was a wonderful experience, Exploring Gardens by the Bay is free but you will enjoy it more if you will be exploring the OCBC Sky walk,Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. If you love sceneries I suggest you head to OCBC Skywalk in the morning and take beautiful pictures of the MBS behind you and the supertree. If you love the wild you‚Äôll also love the cool mystical cloud forest with all its wild flower species and man made waterfalls.For flower lovers out there you‚Äôll definitely feast your eyes with different kinds of flowers from all over the world inside the flowerdome.

Availing klook was definitely worth it because of the experience. I suggest you bring your family and friends in here too.
This place will blow your mind. It is spectacular. If you like flowers, nature and cool design, it‚Äôs all there. Could have easily spent more time there exploring every nook and cranny.

Used the mrt to get here which was easy to do, when we arrived you have got a couple of options to choose, we chose all we went into the cloud walk which was fabulous quite high up there is lifts and escalator for anyone who can't do steps. The gardens were lovely and informative. We went into the flower room which was ok just all Christmas things and the other fantasy room was amazing. We could not do the sky walk as we had torrential rain so they had to close it, good place to visit while in Singapore it was busy but great for kids as well as adults and a look at dragonfly lake is fab

REVIEW_TITLE: WOW - another great area to visit whilst in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: It's an area you can wander through without paying anything. (You have to pay for the attractions such as the big glass domes - Cloud Forest and Gardens Dome). The massive "trees" light up during the evening with a light and sound spectacle which shouldn't be missed.
Gardens By the bay.It's excellent nice greenery. Indoors waterfall. Skyway. You have to pay extra $8 but it‚Äôs worth it

REVIEW_TITLE: Christmas light show and tree top walk
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful Christmas light display and gorgeous view on the tree top walk to the city and the city gardens.

The gardens are remarkable! Well worth the cost of admission. The various ecosystems of flora and fauna fascinating. There were so many varieties of flowers in bloom. The sculptures were excellent as well. So clean!

when in singapore make it a point to visit the gardens
i enjoyed every bit of it been there twice cant get over it
Jogging in the morning and walk around at night, both so enjoyable... The soundings are just beautiful

Absolutely wonderful gardens to visit. We took the shuttle from the entrance to the domes because we arrived in the heat of the day.

Lots to see and photograph. Would highly recommend

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By The Bay Are Must See!
REVIEW_BODY: My husband, friends, and I only had one day in Singapore after our cruise. At the urging of one our friend, we chose to spend at least two hours of our day here. We are sooooo glad we did! This place is truly remarkable. Some of the flowers or themes change for season. We visited each of the zones, including the Cloud Walk.. Our only regret was of course that we couldn‚Äôt stay even longer. GBB is definitely one of those ‚ÄúYou gotta go there!‚Äù places

The Gardens by the Bay is a must visit in Singapore. There have may different plant species and walks along the water. There is also a sky walk that gives you elevated views of the gardens as well as great views of the Marina Bay Sands and Singapore. They also have two domes with various plant species, but you must pay to enter these.

If you like taking pictures for social media, this is the place to go.

Otherwise, I got bored pretty easily.

To make the trip worth it, get ready to do a lit of walking so check the weather forecast amd make sure it will not rain that day

Payed 28$ for Cloud and flowers dome + 8 for the tree top walk, to pay in another thicket place. Tree top is 200m at 20m hight. You get a great view of sand bay hotel, that's all. Flower dome is useless and cloud not much more. On one hour you can have finished. If it's raining , since it's covered, could be an option.

This was s great place to seek some sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city. The gardens are stunning with some excellent views and at night it‚Äôs attractively lit up. The is a food hall and loos and also some quiet corners if you look.

We had been told by everyone that we knew that had been to Singapore not to miss the Gardens by the Bay. The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are must sees and on the day we went which was terribly hot and humid, were a welcome relief from the heat. We were also lucky to see the Christmas displays. Didn't disappoint.
Lived up to expectations. Skywalk good as were both domes. Take time to walk around the general gardens.

A man made wonder of the world. On first entering and seeing the waterfall that Eminates from the mountain,to the amazement of the sky walk makes this experience worthwhile. Fully enclosed from the outside elements makes you look in awe at what has been created.
Large area with small representations of areas of the world. Much better actually going there but if you can't this is ok
Had lunch with my wife and friends here, buffet had a great selection, roast beef was delicious, laksa was even better, loved the local deserts, definitely recommended
WOW, missed this last year and so glad we were able to visit this year. Totally stunning and well worth the visit

All I can say is ‚ÄúWow‚Äù about this place. You will not find another experience like this anywhere in the world. It is the perfect blend of nature and technology! Plan to spend at least a half-day here to take in the many wonderful areas. Whether you visit at day or night you won‚Äôt be disappointed that you put this on your list of places to see while in Singapore.

Gardens by the Bay is such a large are and the facilities are truly impressive! Specifically the two indoor conservatories are some of the most impressive structures I have ever seen. It‚Äôs pretty awesome how they were able to create such elaborate climate controlled environments.

The only downside here is the crowds. It feels a bit like a theme park at times with thousands of people being herded like sheep and everyone trying to get the perfect picture. It‚Äôs a little annoying but definitely still worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Never get tired visiting this garden many times
REVIEW_BODY: This has been my nth visit and I never get tired enjoying the beauty of this garden. Even if how many times I already visited this place one day still really not enough to enjoy.

We went to garden by the bay and many wonderful places in Singapore last October 2019 to celebrate our youngest daughter's 7th birthday.. It was our first time in Singapore... And it was an awesome experience! The lights are so nice, the flowers are beautiful! Actually our Singapore experience are totally awesome üòçüá∏üá¨we will surely come back!
A must when visiting Singapore I could have spent days there just amazing loved it and I am not even a gardener .Children will love the Xmas display and the waterfall is just beautiful .

Helping me to find back my daughter‚Äôs Hp,
really grateful to u! Applause for all the staff especially Zanila or Janila!
Allow a good half day to view the gardens externally. Didn‚Äôt go into the halls, thought they were rather expensive
Had a fabulous time in the Gardens. Beautifully decorated in the flower dome for Christmas. The cloud forest was amazing. The super trees stunning. Loved it all.

An absolute must if you are spending any time in Singapore. The best free entertainment you will ever experience.. Fabulous light and sound show. No tickets to purchase - just turn up for either the 7.45 or 8.45 performances!!

Best Visited at night with Plenty of visitors.
Nice light show and it‚Äôs free to just walk around the garden.
Fabulous light show which we enhanced on this visit with Winter Wonderland tickets, the music selected enhanced the light show experience.

A must do when in Singapore. Fantastic for any age. Tickets are purchased in the garden and there is a trolley ride to the domes if needed, nice to avoid a bit of the heat. It is always busy, night and day so be prepared for crowds.
Fantastic light display and totally free beautiful gardens and lots to see lovely views of the harbour too

We come at the morninh just before our concert time. The place is amazing..but i think if we come at night will be more amazing. I got prove that even Bono himself and Adam quitely came there one day before the 1st day of their show...took photo bout the beauty of this place without being noticed by other people...
Absolutely loved the gardens by the bay, highly recommend you visit. My favorite part of Singapore üá∏üá¨ and head to Pollen for an incredible meal

Night visit to their show. Marvellous trip. Enjoyed the spectacular music. Many people showed up. You must come and watch the show. Words can't describe the feeling. Come and experience it if you are nearby.

REVIEW_TITLE: The one "must see" attraction in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautifully designed gardens and helpful staff.Spent a few hours there as after awhile all plants start to look the same!

Definately worth a visit and not expensive.

I had an amazing experience with the people working in the agency. Very competent and they take great care of their clients finding the perfect itinerary, accommodation and activities. Would definitely recommend to book with traavnow holidays @traavnow
Thanks Vimal Dolka sir for helping me book my package without any issue. Overall my trip was fantastic.

It is just like a Japanese movie for Raputa
So nice to be there but some hours or wether, could not look so perfect
Need luck

No need to spend the whole day there. We spend half an hour walking around. Lots of thing to see. Refused to pay go to and walk on the bridge. It was raining a bit but did still good view.

We went there on a day time. Apparently the night time was much better.

Worthwhile visiting this splendid city garden with its flower dome and cloud forest. Fascinating displays and information on orchids, highland plants, as well Mediterranean and sub tropical plants. An interesting array of varied colours of the Christmas poinsettia were also on display for Christmas.
Cloud Forest is always my favourite esp the man-made water fall. The theme changes every quarter. This winterland theme one at Flower Dome is not impressive. The team behind it needs to step up

We were visiting Singapore for a few days on our way home and we had to visit the beautiful Gardens by the Bay. We took the transit system to them which is very easy to use. We went through the day to visit the 2 domes which are full of different flowers trees and floral displays from all around the world. We were lucky enough to see the Poinsettia Display which was amazing centred around the Poinsettia flowers all different colours associated with Christmas as well as different displays including Santa‚Äôs workshop as well as Santa and Rudolph and the other reindeers and of course Santa‚Äôs little helpers the Elves.
All displays were well thought out and easy enough to get around. Plenty places to stop and have a break including coffee shops and restaurants. You have to pay to get into the 2 domes but other areas you can walk around for free. Prices to get in were reasonable and there are a few different options and offers so you can get the most out of the visit.
We returned at night time to see the Light show. This starts at 7.45 and 8.45 for approx 15 mins. I would recommend getting there at least 30 mins before hand as it gets very busy. The show was amazing with the big trees lighting up to music. This is a must if you are visiting Singapore.
Great experience, I can‚Äôt believe so much wonderful place! Spectacular gardens this is first world! Don‚Äôt miss opportunity for visiting

The gardens are unbelievable and beautiful. Easy to get around and so much variety and to do. Lots of people to help with getting around or just to answer questions about flowers or the place. The night time lights and music is another experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: A great garden to be in
REVIEW_BODY: A fantastic collection of flora from all parts of the world. Rhododendron collections are awesome. It has a great collection of orchids and bonsai too.

Very nice experience in a very special place, with amazing architecture, engineering masterpieces and many many interesting trees, flowers and other plants. It's not an usual botanical garden and this is clearly visible during the day and, especially, during the night when the large metal trees are lighten.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and a must visit place in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: An awesome experience... Both Flower Dome and Cloud forest are really nice. Keep your cameras ready for clicking loads of pics. Ensure to carry a jacket while visiting cloud forest dome as it becomes a little cold because of the waterfall at the entrance
Walked to watch the light show and was not disappointed for making the effort to go. Trees are huge plenty of space so you don‚Äôt feel crowded.
fascinating and fantastic and beautifully planted and landscapes. The views are amazing and the various 'greenhouses' are terrific. MUCH recommended for a day out in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice free show in the evening
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is an interesting experience. The backdrop of the bay is a view of the Marina Bay hotel across the bay and in the evening the Gardens Come Alive queued to music. This month was music of Opera‚Äôs. Nice lights and music. I got a chance to re-listen to a few operas including Puccini‚Äôs Turandot. A crowd of nearly 350 of my new acquaintances sat around the pavement and base of the trees to watch the show along with probably another hundred on the catwalk. Afterwards a walk through the gardens before an exit across the dragon bridge to the marina bay hotel. Nice time and the kids enjoyed it. Bring a cold beverage and enjoy the lights and sounds.

We were hosted a faculty dinner at this place.
We all reached there an hour earlier and went round the garden.
At first sight it looks artificial , but it is so deceptive especially with the artificial light, it indeed is natural only very well maintained. The cactus garden is very nice so also the rest of the floral areas - a delight to any photographer. The dining area was also well laid out and we were very well taken care of.

The gardens are simply beautiful. There are so many unique pieces to see, plants and arts pieces. You can see that the shape of some plants were artificially altered to gain the wanted affect, but still, very beautiful. Took us about 2 hours for the gardens, and 2 hours for the waterfall.
I‚Äôm mad for anything to do with gardens and trees, so I can‚Äôt get enough of this place. It‚Äôs just so lovely.
it‚Äôs absolutely stunning and captivated the eyes of everyone. The colorful light in the dark makes such a perfect combination.
Absolutely stunning. I really enjoyed walking around the gardens. The two domes are totally worth the money. S$28 for both. You won't be disappointed.
This is a must see place when in Singapore. Really need atleast 3 hours of daylight time to see everything and take beautiful pictures prior to amazing night show and views.

The light displays is every good show. We also visit the garden and went through the water fall and go all the way up to the top of the garden. It's very interesting to see the garden of variety of plan.

My wife and I visited the Gardens by the Bay in Singapore earlier this month and have to say that the whole experience, from the flower dome to the supertree garden, was amazing and a must see if you are in Singapore.
I visited it in 2017 and 2019. Loved the Garden Rhapsody show the most. The supertrees really come to life in the evening.

Everything about this place shows vision, clever design and construct faithful to the desire of environment protection. The walk through is as easy or in depth as you would choose. We loved the botanical array, the architecture, the views and the cool retreat from the humid day. I did get a little annoyed at one grumpy photographer who wanted to photograph blooms but kept telling people to move out of the way! I would say just respect everyone there and allow others to enjoy it!

We did the 2 domes. You can easily access from MRT, just get off at Bay Front MRT then it is a 5 - 10 mins walk. Always use your mastercard / visa card for MRT travel as it is cheaper and convenient than buying single ticket.

We visited in Nov and in the flower dome there are a lot of christmas themed display.
Just remember to bring a light jacket as it will get cold after an hour.

Also if you do decide to take a taxi from Garden by the bay, there is a S$3 surcharge for journey starting from there.

You can find various flower from a worldwide. Kids corner available to avoid children boredom. Beautiful flower and waterfalls. The area equipped with Children Playgound with Water Fountain then please bring clothes.

Visited with my adult son. The outside gardens were lovely but the main features are the two enclosed domes - one for flowers, the other a rain forest. Both are cool and comfortable. The engineering skills to design and build this iconic feature are very high indeed.
Kim W, Gippsland, Australia

Great place for garden lovers. Beautiful flowers and decor in this state of the art modern gardens. Flowers dome is excellent with cool air conditioning in hot Singapore. The Cloud Forest is a great place to visit and go up the trail, enjoying highlands plants. It's water fall is spectacular as you enter the dome.

This really was an Amazing experience. You need more than a half a day to cover the entire area. It is better to take the Golf cart Ride first. Then you would be able to locate the places you want to vist.

However we felt that the ticket issue for the Garden Rhapsody at the super tree grove would have been organised in a better and a efficient manner. But it was an unforgettable experience to be on the top of all those man made super trees which illuminates to the music.
This was beautiful especially the domes and the wonderful Christmas poinsettia display. Easy to get around on the audio tour
Im happy and satisfied to came in garden by the bay in singapore, its so beautiful and clean place,its worth it.so travelers do'nt miss these place if you come in sg.

One of the top tourists sight seeing in Singapore. We visited flower dome and forest dome both are beautifully designed and well maintained with wide range of flowers to gardens from all over the world. Light show in evening was mind blowing and cynosure of all eyes. Excellent place to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must Visit - Gardens by the way
REVIEW_BODY: It is the best place to visit when in an Island country. The place is well maintained and completely Air Conditioned. itis the house of so many different varieties of plants that are rarest of the rare. You can even see carnivorous plants. Different zones showcasing different areas on earth are very well displayed.. We visited when the city was getting ready for christmas so the decorations were amazing.
This Garden by the Bay has shown so many beautiful flowers species. Especially when visiting pre-X Mas, the place also decorated X-mas lighting and X-mas music. Very pleasant to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Light show in the evening is fantastic!
REVIEW_BODY:
The evening light show is truly magical and I would recommend anyone to go and check this out when visiting Singapore.

We paid entry for a couple of the domes, the flower dome and the cloud dome, and whilst they are fantasticly man made structures we weren't all that wowed by them. They were too busy and in my opinion not worth the money.

The tree top walk however was very good and I'd highly recommend anyone try that out for fantastic views.
This place was great. They have really done well. A good place to spend a care free afternoon. Take the family.

REVIEW_TITLE: Night or day an amazing experience!
REVIEW_BODY: Visited twice, during the afternoon and again at night, both offer a truly unique experience! A great place to visit for free if you do not want to enter the attractions. A must have if you are visiting Singapore or are in transit. It‚Äôs a long walk, nevertheless, be sure to try ‚ÄúSatay by the Bay‚Äù for some amazingly authentic local Sate!

We came as a trio (my brother and his colleague) and each bought a combined ticket to both the Cloud Forest & Flower Domes for $28 (SGD).

Gardens by the Bay is a wonderful and totally unique attraction and the two conservatories are (in my view) the standouts. The Cloud Forest replicates the rainforest conditions found in tropical mountain regions and has a huge 35m man made waterfall which you can get to the top of via elevator and slowly descend down via an elevated walkway. It‚Äôs stunningly beautiful with some beautiful plant life on display including different types of ferns and orchids.

The Flower Dome is actually the largest conservatory in the world and houses plant life from Mediterranean and semi-arid regions (there are some excellent cacti and succulent plants on display). It is larger than Cloud Dome but does not have multiple levels and a sky walk like the Cloud Dome.

Both conservatories are cooled and eco-friendly with rainwater collected and circulated throughout.

Tip - you can buy individual tickets to each dome separately for the same price. The Cloud Forest Dome has a lot more to see and do than the Flower Dome in my opinion (including 2 excellent short films on climate change in the Cloud Dome Theatre) so if you are pressed for time I would choose Cloud Forest. Tickets are also cheaper if you book online the day before (save $5).

This was my second trip to GBTB and it was great to be back. There are some other attractions such as OCBC Skyway and Floral Fantasy that you can check out (both require tickets) or you can stroll through the outdoor section with the towering Supertree Grove ‚Äútrees‚Äù which light up at night - this is free to enter.

I brought friends from Perth Australia. We started at Flower Dome and the" Wows" and "amazing" was all I heard. They enjoyed the Cloud Forest and the Light show at the Big Trees. videos and photos were uploaded on Facebook and lots more Aussies are coming for the Christmas Show. It made me "proud" to be a Singaporean. Thank You! I visit gardens by the bay at least 6 to 8 times a year,

Such a unique experience and interesting concept. Many varieties of plants id never seen before. You could spend hours trawling the grounds and features of this place. We took about 2 hours all up. Enjoyable and interesting - highly recommend!

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful Gardens in a superb setting!!
REVIEW_BODY: Another great attraction in my favourite world city! Leave yourself lots of time particularly if you enjoy gardening. I spent the morning there and could have stayed longer but was meeting friends. There are several places to sit and have a cool drink . Good value!
Great Rhapsody. Fantastic and peaceful. Great night out. Regretfully the restaurant is under construction.

The flower dome is definately worth a visit. The flower display is quite spectacular. There is also the cloud forest which has a beautiful waterfall. I would definately recommend going to Gardens the Bay. If you walk about 5min from the main entrance there is also a food market 'Satay by the bay' which has a great choice of food to try. Whether you have a few hours or a few days in Singapore, go check it out.
I really enjoyed the gardens and cloud dome , the forest walk way provided great views of the city and walking through the meadow is very relaxing.
How wonderful that garden is, it's breathtaking and i couldn't stop taking photos of it. I'm looking forward to coming back.

REVIEW_TITLE: What nature left out Singapore put in!
REVIEW_BODY:
Singapore does not have the dramatic and diverse scenery of Hong Kong, but it has made up for that with human creativity and nowhere is this better demonstrated than the Gardens by the Bay.

Spectacular? You bet! and a great place to escape the heat of the afternoon.

What they've managed to achieve is amazing. Even if you're not into plants, or gardens you'll be amazed by this place. The 2 green houses are Huge, and just full of the most amazing displays. One currently has a xmas theme, which is great. Don't worry about the heat either. They're both air conditioned. The tree top walk is also a must. Highly recommend.
Hats off to the minds that created this place, and to the hands that maintain it. One just didn't want to leave and go homeüëª
I was really surprised of how beautiful and big this place was. I recommend you do the florar fantasy, cloud forest and flower dome

Huge domes held amazing displays of plants, trees and huge indoor waterfall, and exciting walkways. The huge outdoor gardens and the fantastic lighted tree show are all free and are a once in a lifetime must see experience. Took your breath away.
Many flowers inside for snapping photos. Cool temperature inside. Do spend whole day there if to visit all.

The plants & flowers are all in a natural setting & amazing to see. Inspires you to go home & see what you can do in your garden. BUT,
the site is not mobility friendly! they have a few wheelchairs but there are many hills to traverse. I recommend they buy electric 3 wheel scooters which can be used by the mobility impaired like they do in many shopping malls these days. Surely such a Hi-Tech place like Singapore could organise this easily?

I have wanted to see this amazing place for ever and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed!
To see this place in all its wonder it‚Äôs best to go in the afternoon so you see some of it in daylight and then you can see the sun go down and see it at night. There‚Äôs also a beautiful show of music and lights at from the trees at 7.45 pm
Worth watching !
We were lucky to see a very large kimono dragon swimming up the river.

What a great location, what a great show.
Lights, music, the whole picture its just taking everytime your breathe away.
A must see and do in Singapore
Unique experience!

REVIEW_TITLE: Extra two stars for the skywalk Opera
REVIEW_BODY: A magnificent show off lights and sounds which can enthrall anyone ranging from 2-100 years easily, and no amounts of visits can make you have enough of the experience you'd get. A must must must visit when in Singapore.
Amazing light show at 7:45 and again at 8:45. Well worth wondering around in the dark to see Singapore skyline

Gardens by the Bay provides you a beautiful view of the Nature.
Things to cover:
1. Flower Dome (Tickets)
2. Cloud Forest (Tickets)
3. OCBC Skyway (Tickets)
4. SuperGrove Tree LightShow (Free For all) Two shows
everyday

Went to the Gardens By the Bay for the second time in October 2019. Stayed for the light show at night. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Absolutely fantastic and well worth the money. You can even use you flight boarding pass if you flew Singapore Airlines to get a reduction in the admission price. A site not to be missed!

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful place for one day entertainment
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing places to see onsite. Amazing flowers, water falls inside. Just get ready with a stroller for child & energy to roam around. Also, it‚Äôs very safe & secured place .

We visited during the day and then returned at night for the lights
Truly spectacular!
A must visit to anyone going to Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Went for the night tour and...
REVIEW_BODY:
It was amazing, please if you are debating the Big Bus night tour, don't!

It's truly as marvel to behold, and every bit as beautiful as you see it in the movies. My only regret was not doing the observation deck due to thunderstorms. :-(

The gardens are lovely but do yourself a favour and make sure you see the Garden Rhapsody . The opera music and light show is simply stunning. It goes for 15 minutes and the time flies as it is so beautiful.
Beautiful garden! Saw the light show and was in complete awe! Lots of people there so get to the trees at least 15min before showtime to get a great view.
A must see attraction in Singapore. Buy tickets for both conservatories. Even if you are not a lover of plants it's going to impress you. Easy to get about.
I went to the show in the evening two days in a road. It was so amazing. Tonight I'm going again. If you come in Singapore, this is must see

I was seeking a place to stroll around in nature, and while the Gardens are beautifully crafted, I found them too man made, not wild and natural enough. Everything seemed to be manicured or turned into an attraction. I still enjoyed walking around but it took me a while to find the quiet areas, by the Indian garden and down by the water and the lily pond. There were some nice views of Singapore on the bay side as well. Maybe it's nicer in the evening with the lights - it wasn't really my kind of thing.

REVIEW_TITLE: FANTASTIC VISIT AT GARDENS BY THE BAY
REVIEW_BODY: This is an AMAZING place in lots of ways. The Gardens are free to walk around and are themed eg. Cacti, Canyons etc. It takes a good 2 hours to walk around and explore but if you visit the indoor Consevatories (admission charges apply) allow for a half day/ full day. There is a brilliant light and musical show each night. We went to the 7.45pm one and were informed that the lawn was the best vantage point to see the show. They were SPOT ON as the view and experience was perfect. There were eateries providing food and drink and catered for all tastes and ranged from McDonalds to a more expensive Restaurant. The views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel (Iconic Boat on the top) were amazing. DON‚ÄôT miss this wonderful experience and most of it is FREE. BRILLIANT.
this is my second time here and it is still improving. love the place. love the plants and the flowers.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful beautiful gardens - a must see
REVIEW_BODY:
Try and visit late afternoon so you can see it both in the day light and then at night - both are equally spectacular.

It‚Äôs a large garden space so be prepared to walk a lot - or if you prefer, there is a mini shuttle service onsite that can move you quicker to the sites. You can easily spend the day here.
Very impressively well kept gardens. You can visit more than one time because of its beauty and variety of the specimens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice view and good area spent time in afternoon
REVIEW_BODY: Love the scenery and landscape! Having good afternoon with my baby boy. He likes much the situation. It is near by mall and a lot of place to be visited. Do not forget to bring your camera phone.
OMG!!! This place is amazing! You have to visit! Especially in the evening, lots of lights, light and music show...

The three enclosed gardens are the most amazing places and photos can never do them justice. The smells, the sounds, the sight of the beautiful flowers within. Just glorious.
I would recommend starting at the Flower dome, then the Cloud Forest dome then finishing with the smaller Flower atrium which words and photos cannot describe - I could have stayed there to absorb it all for hours.

Totally recommend...value for money,the evening show is very absolutely amazing.
you wont be disappointed

Lovely gardens by the bay in Singapore located next to the marina bay sands is a must see. With stunning gardens and 2 domes, 1 being the cloud forest with a huge waterfall and the other dome being a seasonal flower dome. You can pay to view both or just the one, i would recommend the cloud forest dome more so. The sky bridge is also a must do but was unfortunately closed when we went to due to weather conditions.
Work your way through the gardens before visiting the 2 amazing domes. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. If rain is forecast do these in the dry period

REVIEW_TITLE: Transfer from Hotel to Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
Very organised tour. Tour guide was excellent. Lots of walking involved so be prepared. Saw the light show the Gardens. Absolutely amazing and worth the walk. Tour guide was informative and helpful.
Would recommend, Travelled in May 2017

There is so much to see at the Gardens by the Bay. We spent most of our time walking around the paths and exploring the area. The evening show is very well done. Be sure to sit close to the super-trees so you can hear the music and fully experience the light show.

amazingly beautifull
go to ALL attractions : flowers, jungle, tempirary exhibits, show at 7.45 h
it is a must
yes, expensive as everything is in Singapore !
This is a must visit attraction. It has all the tropical plants in a fantastic setting and very educational.

Love the circumstance
Good place for eco friendly learning for children
Good for study kind of nature

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit only part of it, if you are short of time
REVIEW_BODY: To visit the whole garden would take more than a day. Start with the Heritage gardens (free) and the Supertree grove. You can wander around for hours. Great place!

Not ever been called one to be interested in plants and flowers but this was absolutely amazing to see, So varied and colourful it was an amazing experience. If you go to Singapore this is a must attraction. You will not be disappointed

It's a really nice visit. You can see that people have worked there with lots of passion and effort. It's an amazing visit that I totally recommend.

The information is very interesting, the plants are exotic and beautiful and they also have interesting expositions like the one that was there whilst I visited about climate change.

If I don't remember wrong, the price is around 20 pounds.

Worth it.

We visited Gardens by the Bay last week. I‚Äôve seen loads pictures of it in recent years and couldn‚Äôt wait to see it for myself when we visited Singapore. It didn‚Äôt disappoint, what an amazing spectacle a fusion of engineering and nature, the light and music show in the evening is breathtaking. Put this on your bucket list, it‚Äôs brilliant.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit destination.... even if your not a gardener !!!
REVIEW_BODY: This place is amazing. We visited here approx 4 years ago and to see how all the gardens have developed over the years is truly awe inspiring. It a great place to spend a few hours on a humid Singapore day in the cool domes looking at waterfalls and truly amazing gardens

Amazing what can be done when people put their minds to it. A lot of the area is free but you pay to go in the domes. It is so worth while though as the perfect growing conditions show just what can be achieved. Everyone would enjoy this venue.
Just amazing. I fell in love with the views and the atmosphere almost immediately. If you're travelling to Singapore, I highly recommend seeing this amazing place!
we booked a tour here with I Asia Singapore and you should see this at night as its truly a different experience. The lights and also the ambiance are so good
The night view is super nice. He like to play bubble there, enjoy the night view. We will not get bored there
Absolutely amazing and mesmerizing. Nothing like I've ever seen before. And the restaurant at the top of one of the Super Trees is awesome
Fantastic place to be at 8pm for music and light show performance. We loved it, a must see experience in Singapore

This is one of Singapore's main attractions, and for a reason. The variety of plants is impressive and the whole area is well laid out for tourists. It would be a shame to go to Singapore without seeing this iconic spot, however it wasn't my favorite thing on the island.

If you visit Singapore, every evening head to the Gardens by the Bay for the lightshow. The whole area is a spectacle. Everywhere you turn there us beauty.

The first lightshow starts at 7.45pm. You can walk right into the park to were the towers are. It's free but there's an option to go up to the walkway for a price. The show is just as spectacular from the ground.

So much fun with this place.
I love how they made an indoor waterfalls surrounded by flowers.
It is so refreshing.

REVIEW_TITLE: A walk at Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: With hot weather in Singapore, I felt Gardens by the Bay is a great place for family outing especially. The two Domes are enough for a full half day gathering.
We only experienced the night light show which was great. You need to be early when you want to experience the show for the best.

A must for all tourist to Singapore!
A long alle walk around the garden with thousands of flower all over.

this place is definitely recommend show in the evening there‚Äôs a beautiful light show with beautiful music and beautiful light effects would be there on time because there are a lot of tourists getting there and having a look!
It is very good hotel .. food is very good in taste location is fantastic..very convenience from city

We visited there on a short layover in Singapore. The gardens are immaculate and well kept. It is well light and beautiful at night. Very relaxing to walk through. Close to Marina Bay and the Singapore Flyer.

A really beautiful location in central Singapore. Really worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the country.

Went here with friends and we all thought it was worth looking at.

Amazing place to visit. There are magnificent plants and indoor gardens, with a massive waterfall feature inside for you to walk around to the top. Lots to see, too much to list on a quick review, had a great visit.

It's actually free to enter the gardens themselves. It only costs to view the 2 Domes and the Skywalk. I paid for both and they were cheap and worth the extra experience. There is a free light show every night at 745pm and 845pm. Operatic music behind the colour changings within the amazing trees.

We entered Gardens By The Bay via the Marina Bay Sands. We took a lift to a magnificent garden path that overlooks the gardens. We then went down another lift at the other end. The gardens are peaceful and hold a lot of interesting artful sculptures and plants.
There's a small train which doesn't charge much that will take you to the domes.
The gardens themselves are even more magnificent in the dark when the neon gardens light up.
As for the domes.
The Flower Dome had a large array of beautiful rhododendrons each flower prettier than the first, (we had missed the orchids flowing season) it also had gardens based on countries, and we were amused when a tour guide explained that the maleleuca was used to make maleleuca honey. We didn't correct him.
The Cloud Dome was even better. It has a waterfall inside. Walking along a path, when you reach the top of the dome it makes you feel like you are walking in the clouds using a specialised misting machine. The effect also assists in watering the mountain off plants that grow up the man made mountain inside the dome.
If you look hard you will see several sculptures that look like they've been made from driftwood and a lion carved from a tree.
There's also a plant in a glass case that is the last of its kind.
Views of the outside off the dome are also spectacular.

One should allow a whole day in order to see the place in the sun as well as lit up. Saw the supertree grove on photos and sadly did not stay till night falls to experience it live. The flower dome and cloud forest were both spectacular with great variety. Well done, Singaporeans.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you visit Singapore, this is a must visit.
REVIEW_BODY: If you are human and enjoy beauty with lots of fresh air, this garden will delight you. Everything is beautiful and detailed.

Very nice and clean park to walk around and take pictures.
You cannot miss the 15 minute light show, it's awesome! Totally worth it.
Diffucult to find transport to leave the park after as everyone leave at once.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nature in the middle of the city
REVIEW_BODY: Floral fantasy is the best. Loved the multitude of flora in this dome. flower & cloud dome is also great but can get crowded. Love that the domes are air-conditioned.

Amazingly decorated for Christmas in the Flower Dome. Cloud is also amazing. The show at night is stunningly. Got up the skybridge worth seeing the view especially at sunset or when the lights are all on.

Defiantly a nice experience in Singapore. Lots to see and really nice displays. However try to go at a time when it isn‚Äôt not overcrowded. Too many kids running around like crazy take away from it.

Besides that it‚Äôs a must see in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cloud Forest is a must visit!
REVIEW_BODY: Cloud Forest dome supposedly houses world's the tallest indoor waterfall. It looks so grand and beautiful on first sight. That itself is worth the money and time spent!

I Have been to this excellent venue a couple of times now over past few years and it never ceases to excite or amaze. It is best seen both day and evening during which time there are lights and music displays which play out twice each night. To enjoy the evening display it is best seen from the top of the flowered towers which are accessed by a relatively small charge of approx 8 dollars per person. If you spend a number of hours there, food and drink is available from many outlets. For visitors there is also the added attraction of the Marina Sands Hotel overlooking this venue which again can be accessed within walking distance where the views from the top are breathtaking.
Definitely worth a visit. Flower Fantasy was a fantasy. If you love plants - take your time, don't rush through it. There is little surprises under the plants which you can miss if you rush through.

I love the way they have designed this, when you enter, that very moment you feel its worth your money and time. I would just say that you shall witness the aura your self in Cloud forest, you will be loving it.
Well worth a visit to the Gardens by the bay. Eating places available and great to just chill out and enjoy the gardens. Highlight was watching the light show, just spectacular
Not as good as the first time for the light show but the Gardens were magnificent. Poinsetta display was incredible with so many colours. This place is a must see for every visit to Singapore.

We enjoyed our afternoon and evening at this great venue.
Highly recommended. Take your time to get the full benefit of your visit there.

We went at dusk to see the lights in the Gardens by the Bay. It was a delight to arrive by train & we could walk in with nothing to pay. We didn‚Äôt need to see the hot houses where you need to pay. The reflections of lights in the lakes were lovely. The light show was awesome, music was great & the atmosphere was quite romantic. Make sure when visiting Singapore to enjoy this treat
Going solo or with family you‚Äôll enjoy this great example of practical teaching about the environment. Recommend: Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.

We went in the morning on the weekend still very busy with lots of both locals and tourists. We took the metro to marina bay and then is is a quick underground walk to the gardens. Shuttles operate to take you to he gardens proper if you want, a little cost.

Great facilities and worth while seeing. Lots of places to sit and rest if required as still gets pretty hot if your not used to the heat.

REVIEW_TITLE: You‚Äôre 22 m above the park surrounded by Supertrees and around you there‚Äôs light, space and emptiness.
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay, Singapore

Review focuses on the Skyway & Supertree Grove

The Gardens by the Bay is Singapore at its best. The gardens come in three parts: Bay South, Bay East & Bay Central, of which Bay South is the largest (54 ha) and attracts the majority visitors ‚Äì for most, this is the park. It registered the 50th million visitor in 2018 just six years after opening. The park skirts Marina Bay on land reclaimed from the sea and exemplifies the vision of the government of the day for the development of a ‚Äòcity in a garden‚Äô ‚Äì raising the quality of urban life by emphasizing the aesthetic values that comes from access to and/or living in green space.
Walk around the park ‚Ä¶ slowly ‚Ä¶ and the visual elegance of the place comes across immediately. But there‚Äôs more beneath the galaxy of different green/floral gardens within the park - the sophistication of the conservatories (i.e. Cloud Forest & Flower Dome), fun for kids of all ages in the water-play garden and the Supertree Grove - there are the environmental messages/systems that simulate the reality of photosynthesis, water harvesting, energy capture, heat disposal and more. This is a playground with features that entertain and inform ‚Äì what you don‚Äôt see (unless you look for it) are layers beneath layers that underlie the complexity of the bioengineering required to support, nurture and sustain the botanical heritage that has been established.
Sit at a table outside the Supertree Food Hall facing the Supertree Grove (with the iconic Marine Sands Bay Building behind) and there‚Äôs this vista of green exuberance. The Supertrees are not real trees ‚Äì but tree-like structures 25-50 m high - that resemble trees in form and symmetry, and vegetation that has been established/grown to cover the underlying structure. In fact, the ‚Äòtrees‚Äô have a reinforced concrete core with external steel frame to which are attached planting panels ‚Äì that form the basis of vertical gardens. Of course you can see it‚Äôs not a real tree, but it feels like one when up close and, more so, when seen from a distance and/or when exploring the aerial walkway halfway up the trees.
It was a Sunday, and we‚Äôd taken the MRT to Marina South Pier (end of the line terminus station) that morning to explore the Singapore Maritime Gallery and, couple hours later, figured to walk through the Gardens by the Bay; the distances are comfortable on foot ‚Äì once you‚Äôre in the park ‚Äì the main challenge. We were not certain about crossing the Marina Coastal Expressway that skirts this part of the island and tends to cut the beach off from the hinterland. People whom we asked did not seem familiar with the ‚Äòwalking‚Äô aspect (and tended to discourage it ‚Äì ‚Äòtake a taxi‚Äô etc. crept into the discussion).
Well, by chance there was a 14-seater courtesy bus that ran the route on the half-hour ‚Äì nice touch; we had the bus to ourselves with a courteous driver who dropped us off just inside the park. What could have been more convenient - thanks to the friendly man at the Information Desk at Marina South Pier.
We‚Äôve been to the Gardens a number of times over the years ‚Äì always a good half-day wandering and exploring; always new things to see. Finding a convenient lunchtime coffee/snack opportunity, however, was a key priority. Lots of signposts/maps around and there‚Äôs no issue with finding your way. We crossed the Meadow heading into the centre of the park, skirted the Supertree Grove and then into the Food Hall, and out again (too noisy). Immediately outside was the caf√© that we were seeking. First impressions? Light, spacious, dominated by high pillars holding up the concrete road/footpath above, views into the Supertree Grove and, crucially, empty tables/seats ‚Äì great.
We had not originally intended to explore the OCBC Skyway, but it was there just a few metres away. Why not! Snack finished we headed off across the grove to catch the elevator that would take us up 22 m to the walkway that loops around three of the supertrees - to hang out over the edge and take time to explore the park, buildings and distant open water by eye.
Surprisingly there were relatively few people there. The kiosk is directly opposite the elevator (inside the ‚Äòtrunk‚Äô of the nearest Supertree). We paid S$8/each for our tickets and, five minutes later, we had the walkway largely to ourselves. Lots of deck space at either end of the walkway where you gain access and then, one circuit 128 m later, where you return to the ground.
In between there‚Äôs this ‚Äòin-the-sky‚Äô feel about things given the uncluttered design of the walkway, chest-high open/netted sides topped by a handrail over which you can lean, width that varies between 1.5-3 m and oval/semi-circular curve that continues to point you in a different direction as you walk. No, there‚Äôs no issue with ‚Äòheight, exposure, apprehension, etc.‚Äô you can‚Äôt for example, see through the deck beneath your feet.
That said, leaning over the rail we lost a hat to the wind - watched it float down into a flower garden at the base of one of the Supertrees ‚Äì good no one would see it there; they didn‚Äôt and 20 minutes later we rescued it.
In the distance you can see across Marina Bay towards the Bay East Gardens and, further towards the sea, there‚Äôs the Marina Barrage (where you can cross over to the other gardens). We were heading that way to visit the Sustainable Singapore Gallery (opened June 2018) and explore the development of water resources in the island.
