Key/final point ‚Äì there‚Äôs no entry fee into the park ‚Äì gardens, lakes, children‚Äôs play area too; you pay for entry into the specialized features ‚Äì conservatories, aerial walkway.

Peter Steele
10 November 2019
This place is unbelievable. It is beautiful and well maintained. It was worth the visit. It is a unique place to visit
We loved visiting gardens by the bay, the gardens were beautiful and the light show was lovely to watch! So stunning and a great vibe too!

These gardens are absolutely beautiful and there is plenty to do there. I‚Äôd recommend these gardens for those with families. The tree tops walks were lovely but not suitable for anyone with a fear of heights.
A must-see! The two conservatories are mind boggling and leaves you amazed and speechless! Easily accessible and the light show in the evening is a feast for the eyes.

I must say ‚ÄúGardens By The Bay‚Äù is such a relaxing and absolutely gorgeous place to visit. It honestly would be one of the most beautiful places to visit. The night lights when the super trees come to life is simply stunning and a must see when visiting Singapore üá∏üá¨
Loved, loved, loved it ! üòç
Trip to Singapore is incomplete without visiting Gardens by the Bay. Do take a walk on the OCBC skyway and then experience the evening light and music show

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting tourist attraction but not my type of thing
REVIEW_BODY:
It‚Äôs interesting for the evening light show. If you go on the canopy walk make sure to go in the evening when there is a light show. Otherwise you have to watch the light show from the ground.

I‚Äôm just not that interested in evening light shows or man made tourist attractions.

REVIEW_TITLE: Extraordinary range of plants and trees
REVIEW_BODY: Although I'm not much of a botanist, I found this to be an amazing exhibit. There was an enormous variety from all over the world all coexisting inside one single ecosystem. It was beautifully laid out and we found it to be a very nice way to spend an hour or two just strolling around among the flowers, trees, and primping duck-lipped young women taking countless Instagram selfies against the floral backgrounds.

A garden full of color, full with elegant plants. Aside from huge trees which make you surprised, there are two other attractions (Cloud Forest and Flower Dome) within the garden, but you must pay to get into. You may find the entrance prices a bit high. However the garden itself is for free and it is even more amazing at evening hours with the light shows. The best time to visit is the late afternoon hours tin order to spend time and extend the stay until evening hours at dark. You will like the exhibition.

REVIEW_TITLE: A night in the Garden by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: A quick visit to see the light show at Gardens by the Bay. Exceptionally beautiful, cannot wait to return during the day.

Garden by the Bay is a place where i bring my tourist friends.
It say most of it about Singapore, great infrastructure and designs. Singapore‚Äôs grand way of presenting their love for nature and an experience to think if nature is protected.

A full day is needed to see it all, if you‚Äôre planning to include all conservatories and the skywalk. The gardens are beautiful by day and by night. The conservatories are quite cool inside, I wished I had a light cardigan with me. A must visit if you‚Äôre in Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic experience in garden by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: Although i'm local and i have visited this place several times. Each visit brings me a whole new experience. Visit the flower dome and cloud forest to cool down in the hot weather.

our second visit and this place is still exceptional.
The Christmas decor was vibrant.
The cloud forest is still among my favorites with the spectacular glass and skywalk.
Always worth a visit when in Singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: Good idea - but not thought through
REVIEW_BODY:
First of all, we loved the waterfall, exhibition and documentation in the cloud forest. The trees and lightshow at night are also stunning. BUT:
They show you a documentary about climate change in the Cloud Forest, which makes you think about your own contribution to save the planet (great!) and at the same time you find a Mc Donald's (?!) in the middle of the park, a gift shop full of stuff wrapped in plastic with loads of unnecessary souvenirs and the Flower Dome is filled with christmas decorations out of plastic (artificial snow in between the flowers). It's ironic, sad, stupid and so much else... Who worked on this concept? In the end it's only about profit, entertainment and fullfilling the visitors needs to shop and make pictures. Would be so great, if they'd have taken their own concept serious and would support local businesses f.e. - keep their carbon footprint in mind. See for yourself. I am sure that this project had a big budget, so they should have been able to do better or should at least try to make it better in the future. Nice try, but try harder. I hope there will be some changes.

wow......is all I got really. This place is a must to visit if in Singapore.We arrived by ship and it was a quick $10 cab ride to the gardens. Wow again is all I got. leave your self plenty of time to explore we went after lunch and wish we had spent the whole day as we ran out of time to look at every thing.

I spent the most memorable nearly 6 hours here and could have stayed longer had it not been for the wet/thundery weather. The greenhouses are cool inside so bring a jacket/cardie just in case. They were just breathtaking. I visited Floral Fantasy, the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome, the heritage gardens, the sculpture garden. Even 'though both the Domes were busy, there was definitely a feeling of serenity.... and the smells are delicious! The cost of entry all up was S$46.00. There is shuttle that will take you from the entrance to the Domes, included in the price, although of course one can walk. The Super Trees were unfortunately closed due to the weather but they looked fantastic - I walked underneath them in the rain. There is a light show here, as I believe, twice every evening, but again because of the weather, I missed it. It is easy to arrive via the MTR, access similarly easy. Try not to get lost in the Marina Bay Sands shopping centre, but it must be said that there is plenty of clear signage.
The garden sits in the heart of the city and is a feature attraction it is free and at night there is an amazing light show over an amazing place

REVIEW_TITLE: Very good - go back at night for the free lightshow
REVIEW_BODY:
The large site is accessible by metro (don't try and wander through the mall - follow the signs from the metro station). Wandering the site is free, but the domes as chargeable and really quite different.
Around 7:45 in the evening there is a fifteen minute free light show which is free and worth checking out.

My wife and I visited here twice during our stay in Singapore. We only visited the ground, however, there was enough interest there to keep us occupied. The gardens are immaculately maintained. However, the gardens also serve as an excellent Nature Reserve. Several species of bird are relatively easy to see here - Lesser Whistling Duck, Black-crowned Night Heron, Yellow & Cinnamon Bittern, White-breasted Waterhen, Striated Heron, Asian Koel, Black-naped Oriole, Malaysian Pied Fantail, and Scaly-breasted Munia. Common Water Monitor and Red-eared Slider are easy to see. So a great place for nature lovers. Lots of places to eat, plenty of rest facilities too. Highly Recommended.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best horticulture world in the world (man made)
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the Gardens of the Bay in Singapore recently in November 2019. This is one of the best man made horticulture places and it contains two big glass domes, one for Green vegetation and another one for flowers. Both are beautifully designed magnificently and is covering huge landscapes. The time taken to visit these two is one hour each.
Each has entrance ticket to be purcahsed. Cloud Forest.

The first one that we saw was cloud forest. At the entrance, you are greeted with a huge man made waterfall which was very beautiful. The on the stretch you could see many trees grown in a thick forest like view and there is an elevator and escalator to its 17th floor. Here, we could take a breathtaking view of the horticulture grown inside the glass dome. You could alight down a spiral road which on the way gives luxurious sceneries.

Flower dome.

Next comes the flower dome. Here the same glass dome is prevalent but this time with more natural flowers that give colour to our life. Many unknown colourful flowers greet all the way and you will definitely get tired taking photos and selfies all along. There is another area where there is a floral fantasy world setup. You could enjoy the variety of flowers decorated all along. At the end there is a small 4d show, which has swinging seats according to the motion you see on the short movie.

Don't ever miss these two attractions.

On the southern bay, there is huge tree like iron structures called super trees which is due worsted with lighting. There is a light show, every day between 7:45 to 8:45 pm and this was really wonderful to see.

Other than these there are shops as usual which depicts the beauty. One thing I would like to mention here is the practice of taking group photos by the professionals, per family and if you are interested to have them, you have to pay and these photos are mounted on a frame with beautiful backgrounds to cherish your memory later.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not usual a fan of gardens
REVIEW_BODY: Not much to say about this place other than WOW! & visit at night time to see the spectacular light show
A perfect place to enjoy the vibrant colours of nature, great location, cool and calming great place to go

REVIEW_TITLE: A comfortable walk through this flower garden
REVIEW_BODY: This is a typical Singaporean way of enjoying flowers etc., covered halls and going out in a comfortable not to warm environment. The garden is very well organized as well as good infrastructual set up. The flower beds are beautiful and the place is good for an hour relaxed walking and enjoying the garden architecture.

What an amazing place. The displaying of natural beauty is breath taking. A head for heights is needed for some venues but plenty of warning signs. The Christmas season made the scenes even more colourful. Plants an flowers from around the world. 3 Ticketed areas cloud dome and flower dome plus the sky walk amongst the man made eco trees all different. Refreshments and souvenir places too. A great day out but lots of walking. A shuttle bus is available for less able customers.

This place is massive! Take your time and spend a day going through everything! There is so much to see! The Cloud Garden was our favorite - everything about it is impressive!

We also saw the new Floral Fantasy exhibit which was fantastic! It is worth visiting this spot. The ride is entertaining - a bit gimmicky but still entertaining. I won't say much about it so I don't ruin any of the surprises.

The Flower Dome was impressive in size - a bit difficult to navigate due to the size but spend time wandering around. The Christmas decorations were out while we were there which was fun to see. They had some really cute decorations.

The skywalk was a great view - doesn't take too long to go across but can still get some great views of the supertree grove.

There are several other gardens around worth exploring that are free to enter.

I bought a deal on Klook that provided a Singapore river cruise, cloud garden, flower dome, and the skywalk for a discounted price. I would recommend trying to find this deal if you plan on going. It was very easy to exchange for tickets (show them on your phone at the Red Dot Museum).

It's very well maintained throughout the whole garden and full of surprises!

Went here almost closing up, still so beautiful! Staffs are friendly! Absolutely stunning!

Make sure you visit every garden!
Wonderful experience- first class / spent hours there. Would go again. A feast for the eyes and senses and we took hundreds of photos. Extremely well run and very impressive.

REVIEW_TITLE: A MUST VISIT, EVEN BY THOSE not otherwise interested in Horticulture
REVIEW_BODY:
This is an outstanding tourist attraction, A MUST SEE and to know the History of Horticulture, Forestation, and very very rare Species of Trees of age and, dating to over 2000 Years.

It will require stamina to walk through, for may be about over 10,000 Steps, to get real feel of the Conservation efforts, in the Bay City/Country, but worth it almost Hundred Percent.

The Glass Domed Conservatory for Huge Collection, would be another Treat to the Eyes and the Heart.

Those who can not do any of these, and running short of time, They have an Audio conducted Tou, lasting some 2-0 minutes, of the various important parts of this Unique Tourist Attraction, on board Electric Driven Maxi Golf Car like Vehicle, ( at a cost of some TEN Singapore Dollars), with continuous Audio in English,describing various Facets of this Place, The Plants, The Tees ( Some of a height of some Hundreds of Feet, some Extremely Unique Collection of Trees with TWO/THREE Trunks, etc etc
This is just amazing. Ensure you allow plenty of time for The Dome. The light show for the trees is worth waiting for.
Great place a must do at night time especially the super trees. One if the highlights in Singapore in my opinion
Great fantastic place,must visit,you get lost in great greenery and upmarket ambience ,it is surprising how they could create a place like that

I love gardens because it's very relaxing. Knowing Singapore has this gardens by the way in the middle of the busy city is truly breathtaking and awesome. Best time to go here is in the afternoon so it's not too hot specially outside the dome.

This place was still under construction during my last visit. So my return was amazing.....what a place..Cloud Forrest was amazing. You need a lot of time here..The restaurant also served amazing food .

Loved Gardens by the Bay. We did the combined Dome & SkyWay ticket which was good value. It was too hot to spend much time exploring outside but the domes were lovely and cool and both very impressive, as was the View from the Skyway. We paid an additional $4 each for the audio and enjoyed the extra information given. We spent 2-3 hours so you could easily spend a whole day if doing the other attractions.... or come back another day and walk around the outside areas as there is no charge. We were unable to stay for the evening light show ... next time. Only gripe. The ticket office is not well sign posted and you have to go to different ticket offices to get the different tickets and audio... would be better if the tickets at least could all be bought at the same place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Gardens with a suprising lack of wildlife present.
REVIEW_BODY: Very well set up gardens. The Cloud forest and flower domes were stunning. I would imagine the whole place would be lovely in the evenings with the Light shows in the marina. No issues with insects which was a concern for my wife. I was suprised at the lack of birds present though.

A wonderfully green space in a very urbanised city/country. One of my ultimate favourite places anywhere in the world.
Offering a wealth of things to see, one would surely never get bored here - I have visited the Gardens (which are free of charge) many times and see something new every time. My personal favourite is the Supertree Grove. There is a light and music show every evening which is truly stunning - check the timings on the Garden‚Äôs official website before visiting.
Also in the Gardens is a Hawker Center ‚ÄúSatay By the Bay‚Äù with a vast array of food, and the best Satay I tried on the Island

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent garden in the CBD area
REVIEW_BODY: Beautifully constructed and various flowers all over the world. Cloud forest set up is excellent, must visit

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see in the evening at 8pm
REVIEW_BODY: Feel young and enchanted again and go at 8pm to see the sound and light show. Flower lovers return the next morning to see the trees and flowers during day light. A must do when in Singapore and a reason to go to Singapore.

What an amazing place and well worth a half day to explore and be amazed and delighted. Stunning architecture, and splendid planting. Huge time effort and money go into this and it shows. Non gardeners will enjoy this too!

It‚Äôs a nice place which can not be missed while you are visiting Singapore. There are many attractions: The cloud Forest and Flower Dome, 2 indoor gardens with air-con, skywalk and light show at night. Also, There is a food court where you can have your dinner. I would suggest you have lunch first before going to Garden by the bay. So, it won‚Äôt be too hot. You can visit the 2 indoor garden first, and then the other gardens. Follow by the dinner before going to the light show and skywalk. Please check the light show schedule before you go. Please bring a plastic map for the light show or you may need to lie down on the floor to watch the light show. However, if you have kids with you, they would like to visit the Children garden and play water. A full day will be needed.
Breathtaking gardens, domes very cold though, so take something warm to wear. Christmas display was being put together whilst we were there, and looked wonderful

REVIEW_TITLE: Clean, pretty place with so much greens
REVIEW_BODY: love coming here during the weekdays. less crowds and i can take my own time to walk around. Plenty of pretty flowers and plants to look at if you like flowers and plants . it just makes your day better
Excellent - plan to spend a day there. The cloud was closed but the flower garden was lovely. The restaurant, I believe was ‚Äòpollen‚Äô was rather pricey and not truly worth it.

I would recommend going in the early afternoon when they light is good for seeing the plants and good photos of them/oneself. Allow a minimum of three hours (personally would prefer five and would spend more in domes). Stay for the light show (free at 7:45 & 8:45pm, but could be quite a distance from the domes). For a good spot (eg. lying down) to see the show, you may want to be there early (I saw people started waiting one hour ahead).

The only complain I have is that the plant signs appear random and sporadic. The air-cond could be a bit much for some.

REVIEW_TITLE: I've never seen anything like this!
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay in Singapore is not to be missed! Such creative and stunning display of flowers and plants goes far beyond your standard botanical garden. Really amazing!

Went to gardens by the bay, spent about 5hours there, you pay to go into the 3 main parts of the gardens, but the rest of the park area is free to wander around the lakes and gardens. Well worth paying the entrance fee for the main attractions.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice But Not As Spectacular as Pictures
REVIEW_BODY: This was an interesting place. Lots of walking so wear comfy shoes. Honestly it looked better in the movie, but still worth a visit.

Nice place for a walk. I highly recommend it if you want to run away from the city life
There is a light show at 7.45 PM and it's crowded.
Complicating system to choose which ones to visit . We saw one of the flower domes and the cloud forest. Amazing what humans can build if there is enough heat and water.

REVIEW_TITLE: No where does it better than Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore does everything well. Twelve years since my last visit, so much has changed. An absolute must do and easy to spend hours here. By day or by night the experiences are wonderful and different. The Flower Dome was colourful and floral, The Cloud Forest an amazing array of orchids, pitcher plans and ferns, complete with a 35 metre high man made mountain and waterfall. The Skyway and Super Tree Grove gorgeous. Don't miss the attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: One the most beautiful places created by man.
REVIEW_BODY:
After a long day at work you want to spend an evening getting relaxed here. Or get a good stroll from the gardens to the bay and look at the stunning view or the Marina Bay Sands.
The trees in the garden look like you landed on Pandora from the movie Avatar üòÑ

REVIEW_TITLE: Where the 3 worlds of art/science and nature meet!
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay falls into the ‚Äòmust visit‚Äô category when visiting Singapore. We chose a taxi to get there but can be reached by train and a walk. However way you choose to get there it is a definite must. We spent about 4 hours there and could have spent more. The flower Dome was an amazing sight of colour, flowers and plants around the world- a delight to see. The domes themselves are engineered in a way that is not hindered by support piers to intrude on the visual impact of such beauty!
The second dome ‚Äò
The ‚ÄòCloud Forest‚Äô is just that a rainforest in a dome that boosts an amazing waterfall and winding path that meanders up alongside the waterfall. The waterfall surrounded by many tropical plants, way too much to do justice to the gardens.
It would be amazing to see the Gardens by the Bay at night. Indeed a speculative show. A must do for our next visit.
The Domes are air conditioned and very comfortable to spend time in. Though the gardens are free the Domes have a cost.
A train ride and commentary will assist in orienting visitors around the gardens surrounding the domes. A small cost for train is involved. If walking signs are clear and workers happy to advise.
Sculptures in the gardens are interesting and are well placed in the garden areas. A must see is the large sculpture by Marc Quinn known as the floating baby and that‚Äôs just how it looks!
Well worth visiting, food available as you enter the gardens and in the gardens.

We enjoyed walking around the gardens day and night the man made trees and domes are amazing. There are 2 light shows on an evening, 7.45pm & 8.45pm. It‚Äôs definitely worth a visit loads to see! There are coffee shops, toilets and taxis are easy to find near the entrances. You can access the gardens via Marina Bay Sands hotel as well, as other areas of the gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: A little cheesy, but worth seeing
REVIEW_BODY:
Of the two facilities, Flower dome and Cloud Forest, the Cloud Forest was spectacular. The waterfall was amazing, and the elevated/suspended walkways gave great views. The ‚Äúcheesiness‚Äù related to elaborate flowers made of LEGO inserted into regular displays - weird.

The flower dome was underwhelming, but is part of the package so might as well go. Unfortunately, we did not have a chance to see the Super Tree light show that night, which we did want to see.

This is a must visit in Singapore. There are 2 domes. The CLOUD DOME & the FLOWER DOME. Both are located next to each other and cost $27 per person for each dome. Both domes are very different. The CLOUD DOME has a lift for different levels where as the FOWER DOME has sloping wide paths going to each level.
The displays are beautiful and well thought out.Great for all ages and very colourful.

I had read and watched so much about this place, but being there was a little underwhelming. Yes, there are beautiful flowers from around the world, but I think I would have enjoyed something natural better. I did love the ‚Äúeggs‚Äù in the bay and the large dragonfly statues. And the dragon sculptures throughout the cloud forest were definitely worth seeing. The Flower dome was decorated for Christmas, which seemed uncharacteristic for Singapore, maybe this explains why I was a little disappointed. I left the US, to see the US. All in all, it‚Äôs still worthy of a visit and my four stars for sheer beauty.

REVIEW_TITLE: Having nice sightseeing in Garden by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
I saw Garden Bay from Crazy Rich China then interest to visit it by my selves. It was so pretty and lovely at night with the light also several attraction that available on those area.

Recommended for other traveler to visit this spot

This is beautiful architecture with the most beautiful flowers to trees. It's like utopia, something out of the movie. You need to dedicate time to see this.
Worth the money, I really enjoyed my time there.

Do spend more time in the evening and do consider the visit if you‚Äôre planning to go in the afternoon as Singapore weather are generally warm and humid. However there is a bonus during the day which you can purchase tickets to ride in a buggy and bring you around the entire garden without walking much. This is especially good for elderly or children who may dread walking too much.

Fret not if there‚Äôs no buggy tour in the evening, wait around like 1945hr and 2045hr where there are light shows synchronized with music to dazzle you! If you‚Äôre hungry, do take a short walk to Satay By the Bay where you find tonnes of street food and hawkers to treat your tastebuds craving for local dishes!

REVIEW_TITLE: Music light show at night, incredible!
REVIEW_BODY:
We followed a large crowd at night from Marina Bay Sands that was heading to the Gardens by the Bay, they were actually headed to the Supergrove Trees. People sat on the streets and looked up and waited. By the way, this is how clean Singapore is, I sat on the street in white shorts and had not ONE dirt mark! I personally was very impressed.
So we waited with everyone else assuming something great was about to happen. At 9pm started an AMAZING music light show. The music was American from West Side Story to the Phantom of the Opera, the lights danced with the music, the colors were amazing. I was teary-eyed. This is a MUST see. I saw that the light show begins at 8:45p.m. make sure you know when it starts and find a place to view it from.

REVIEW_TITLE: If there be heaven on earth...
REVIEW_BODY:
What a delight ! We could cover only 3 areas - Supertree grove, Flower dome and the superlative "Cloud Forest" in the 3 hours we spent there and all 3 were mindblowing. The famous Supertree grove was a sight to behold but unfortunately we missed the light and sound show as we were late getting there.
The Flower dome was a visual delight and the newly added section "Poinsettia" was a "sone pe suhaga".
But for me, the magnificient "Fall" at Cloud Forest was stunning especially as I had neither seen nor heard of it. Please take proper time out to enjoy these while visiting Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you like gardens than this is the place for you
REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I have been to the Garden by the bay twice our second time being this Nov again. It is excellent both domes are fantastic however the flower dome was closed on the day we went but we have been there before also. So we spent our time in the other dome Cloud dome. Believe me you will spend a few hours walking around just the one dome. There is a shuttle that will drive you back and forth if you like or you can walk after getting your ticket. Now you can get to this place by MRT if you like and that is what we did. There is also the flower towers outside that light up at night and are very beautiful. If your in Singapore this is a must see place it has to be one of the best I have seen. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.
Although I have been before U have never been in the flower dome. And it's superb. Especially now as there is a wonderful white Christmas there. Just fabulous

I was travelling through Singapore and decided to go here just on a whim when I had a day free, I had no clue what to expect. I loved it.

The flower dome was nice, essentially thw worlds largest green house, but it was the misty forest dome that blew me away. Absolutely amazing! I can't recommend it enough. At the end there's even a message about human impact on the environment, which I thought was a great touch after enjoying the splendour of all the plants and wildlife sculptures.
The outdoor heritage gardens are a nice walk and the giant trees were impressive during the day, wish I had had time to go back to see them lit up at night.
Overall, I recommend it for anyone. There's a shuttle and a tour ride for people that can't walk the whole way, and kids areas too. Little cafes and restaurants dotted around as well and a nice lake/river to sit by.

REVIEW_TITLE: Admire at night but explore by day
REVIEW_BODY:
This was going to be a negative review. We went on a Sunday night and the lights were beautiful but I got frustrated and angry. It was very difficult to find the way in due to poor signposting, we had to get through a huge shopping mall. I had wanted to go on the skywalk but timed tickets were for nearly an hour ahead and no sign of where to buy them from.
We gave up and returned on Monday morning, what a difference. Plenty of space to admire the gardens and the views. The Cloud Forest takes you to a rain forest with an amazing high waterfall. Lovely and cool after the heat outside and a powerful message about climate change. The Flower Dome, again so cool and fresh was immaculately tended with plants from around the world. It struck me that I grow many of these in my garden at home, so why not an ‚ÄúEnglish country garden‚Äù along with all the others. I walked straight onto the Skywalk connecting the iconic steel trees this time with time to stroll and admire. Even the eating places and coffee shop were quiet and relaxing.
So, I recommend if you have the time, enjoy the atmosphere in the evening but really explore the place in the morning.
The most amazing gardens you could ever see.Even if your not into gardens you take time out to do this

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and Amazing place is a Must
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens by the bay was excellent and good for families. We came here when the Christmas decorations were up and it was very well done and interesting to look at. And the indoor waterfall was amazing. The walk took you along high above the ground around the waterfall and you got some great views inside and out. Great place to come and is definitely a must for all.
The Gardens by the Bay are free, apart from the huge conservatories and the elevated walkway. Very well designed and well organised.
Visiting Gardens by the Bay was very unique experience and It has variety of plants. It is surly one of the top experience of Singapore
Marvellous Human creation....The flowers..The waterfall and everything about the gardens is awesome.
Definitely a place for a couple to visit to refresh and relax our souls and minds. Place was easy and guided throughout.

This was a fantastic experience for us. We saw diverse garden landscapes, all showcasing different ideas. This attraction is located by the Marina Bay Waterfront in the heart of Singapore. Gardens by the Bay is a sanctuary for nature lovers and it feels awesome to explore the Supertree Grove, Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. Best to get tickets in advance to skip the queue and spend more time exploring inside. There is a light show in the evening to enjoy while relaxing. This is a must see attraction in Singapore.

Very nice gardens, especially the waterfall.
A lot of effort is being put to renew the themes in the garden.
Just remember to take a jacket as temperatures can be coldü•∂
One word awesome ... just amazing that how Singsproe team has managed to keep plantations of so many different continents in one place ... intact and budding
Went with my wife, her first comment was GBTB must have changed their curator. Th3 effort put in to this year's Xmas theme looked lacklustre...
Lovely during the day and night time light show. Good views from the skywalk. An enjoyable visit. Would return and recommend.

We went at dusk and thoroughly enjoyed the visit, but it was not as good as its marketing suggests. Sure it is a bit unusual and the canopy height walk is fun, even the light show is very worthwhile. Somehow though we were just rather underwhelmed.
If you are here for a few days then go and visit but don't expect it to be a real highlight.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit day or night
REVIEW_BODY: We were on a stopover so got the SMRT to the Bay and walked to the gardens. It was quiet when we arrived and was raining heavily but it didn‚Äôt spoil the experience. We went into the flower dome which was beautiful and fragrant with lovely water displays. We went into the dragonfly theatre which was n unusual experience. Back out into the gardens to explore and it was great to see the ‚Äòboat‚Äô hotel and also the giant flowers. We had also viewed the light display of the flowers from the 57th floor of the hotel the night before. A real experience.

The music and light show in the evening was so beautiful and clever. It was crowded, as you would expect. I would recommend taking something to sit on while waiting for the show to begin - the curbing is not comfortable ;-D
We wandered round the gardens for an hour or so before that, and

Definitely a must-see if you are in the city, whether you stay for a day or a week, you have to go to the gardens and I would recommend going during the evening, as it would allow you to see the lights and music show they typically do.

Even if you're only in Singapore for a stop over, this is the place to see! The night light shows are absolutely incredible and the gardens are the most beautiful I have ever seen! There are some lovely cafes and bars to have a meal or drink while your there so be sure to set aside a decent amount of time to explore!

I would love to have been able to spend longer here, but was squeezing in a bit of sightseeing on a business trip. The Gardens are truly surreal. Enormously crowded, yet quiet and peaceful with interesting light shows. It just makes you happy.

REVIEW_TITLE: A great day out for the family but dont miss the eveings lights and music show
REVIEW_BODY: This was a really good place to spend the day and if you have children they would love it. it really is a full day and to make the most of it its best to book in advance. the evening's light and music display is not to be missed so plan your stay carefully

This is a not to be missed experience, the tree show is amazing - tip - you can walk around and watch the tree show and see lots of amazing things without having to pay. There are other parts of the gardens that you can pay to visit but the free areas are amazing!

REVIEW_TITLE: Like a well done fireworks shoe.
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited the flower dome and cloud forest then walked the gardens before taking in the light show.

Take my review for what it‚Äôs worth since I am not a big floral enthusiast. The show was entertaining but just not my cup of tea. I think it‚Äôs an activity that you must do when you visit. I just wouldn‚Äôt spend too much of my time here.

An amazing experience, a trip of a lifetime seeing the most innovative, beautiful flora and structures anywhere in the world. Words could never be enough to describe the fragrance of plants and flowers, unbelievable. Take an 8 Singapore dollar lift ride for the OCBC Skyway experiencing fantastic views of the gardens and Marina Bay. Never wanted the day to end.

We enjoyed the gardens. Especially loved the flowers and those extremely old Olive trees were amazing. We purposely went late afternoon so we could catch the light show at 1945, which was excellent especially with the classical
Music.

Beautiful picturesque gardens in unique setting. Spectacular light show. It was crowded in the domes and people seem to push and shove making it a bit unpleasant especially when you have small children with you.Staff were very helpful offering special lift access when you have pram as we did, which was great as the lines to get up and down were so long. Definitely not to be missed. Must do while in Singapore

We visited this free musical light show a bit by chance, really glad we did. We took a taxi from our hotel Taxis are fairly cheap in Singapore)
The show was a real wow moment!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place if you love gardens, otherwise...meh.
REVIEW_BODY:
The Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest are both for-pay attractions, and that is what most people will aim for. If you're a flower lover, or just like to see plants from other parts of the world, you'll enjoy this attraction. But if that does nothing for you, you'd probably zip though it pretty quickly.

I'd say this is worth visiting, if you have your garden-loving relative in tow with you. It will occupy several hours of an afternoon, if you are looking for something to do. But kids would get bored quickly.

Super cooling, managed to handle crowds inside but bottleneck was at the entrance. However, understandable.

Overall, great experience. Loved the diversity and look of it all.
Walking through the gardens is a treat. The fountain pool is a delight for children to play in. Going inside is a visual and fragrant experience

Always back when there is a change of display at the Flower Dome. Awesome arrangements with different themes each round of visit. Else take a walk around the gardens and head over to Satay by the Bay for some lovely local food.

It's such a beautiful and peaceful setting with lots to see.
There are two main areas: Cloud Forest and Flower Dome, but there are also a couple of other attractions.
You can also see the Supertrees from here. I would recommend coming back in the evening to see them lit up.
You can easily spend a good few hours here wandering.

I had thought the domes might be a bit hot and steamy, but actually they were cool and fresh and it was a lovely place to visit out of the heat. There was a rhododendron exhibit that was very beautiful. The place is huge and the flowers beautiful. There is also a high walkway with views of the bay and interesting presentations on climate change and how the facility operates ecologically. A must - visit in Singapore.
If you're visit Singapore it's a must to go the Gardens by the Bay. You will see by your own eyes and enjoy it for sure. Make a lot of pictures.

We were a touch cynical about this before we went......."man-made trees?".......but this park in the middle of the Marina Bay Area is, in a typically Singaporean way, cleverly and effectively done. There's much more there than just several stylistic man-made trees.......a lovely lake with a boardwalk around the edge is full of exotic fish to look at.......trees, shrubs, flowers are everywhere. A very hi-tech driverless air-conditioned wheeled pod takes you around (at a price, if you want.....otherwise just stroll and get hot!). Above you are not only the iconic man-made trees but also the architecturally exciting new "hotel with a hat on".....something like $25 to go up onto the roof garden, which we avoided.
We visited during the day and again in the evening for the light show. The gardens are beautiful and the light show is amazing. I would recommend seeing them in both daylight and for the light show.

Was a great day out for us with a little one. We went early to beat the crowds so our little one (who is a bit of a runner!) Could just wander around and explore.

The free water playground for kids is amazing. It's quite big and has a smaller area for toddlers and a big area for bigger kids. It was clean and tidy and we'll staffed.

Just near by to there is Satay by the Bay food court which had heaps of great options of good and wasn't too expensive.

Overall a lovely day out.
Wonderful place to visit and had a great time.. spectacular light shows & very beautiful atmosphere.
Great way to spend a few hours while in Singapore.Plants from all over the world and the skywalk is a must,and to top it all off was the light show which was incredable.

Given I only had one day in Singapore and spent so much money to stay at Marina Bay I wasn't sure if I wanted to leave to go here. But it really was worth the visit. Very unique and can be done as fast and as slow as you want.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must-do if you visit Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
This venue is equally cool by day or night. Matter of fact, I suggest you make it a point to visit twice just to get the entire experience.
By day you will see some of the most beautiful flower displays in the world.
By night the very cool supertrees light up the sky - trust me, it's as fabulous as a 4th of July firework show.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best music and light show, both domes are worth it
REVIEW_BODY: Both domes are worth visiting with flower dome giving a walk through all types of plants into a flower field. The cloud forest has a garden wall with a waterfall.

I heard so much about the gardens I've actually put them on my to-do list as a main thing. Well.. the place is amazing, great amount of work and planning, lots of green etc. A nice place to have a walk for sure. Was it my number 1 in Singapore? No. But definitely worth visiting.

REVIEW_TITLE: Should be part of every visitor's itinerary
REVIEW_BODY: Plenty to see and explore. Both domes worth visiting. Night time sound and light show was really lovely and worth the visit. Be warned about the crowds rushing to leave at the finish though

We came to see the supertrees, which are fun and unique, and we also enjoyed seeing the botanical gardens and walking along the water. If you want to see the supertrees consider going in the evening when they are lit up -- it's quite a spectacle.

REVIEW_TITLE: When in Singapore- A must visit !
REVIEW_BODY: Singapore being a small country has a good variety of places to see. Gardens by The Bay probably is one that should be kept in the top 3 when you visit Singapore.

Visited many times Singapore, but never had the chance to visit Gardens by the bay, specially the could forest was something that I wasn't expecting. Very beautiful and not very crowded which made my visit even pleasure. totally recommend it.
Have visited the Gardens each time I have been in Singapore. It is very crowded at times but I do enjoy the coolness in the Cloud forest and taking pictures of all the flowers in the flower dome.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful, urban garden close to Marina Bay Sands
REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful, and well planned urban garden. There are many things to see, and places to stop at and just appreciate the architect's balance of nature vs. nurture. There are quite a few spots to catch beautiful pictures, and admire the Singapore cityscape. A brisk walking loop takes just over an hour. Lots of water points and toilets along the way. The children's water play-area is definitely a hit with the younger kids.

We booked the Night Tour for $64 per person. A bus picked us up at our hotel and dropped us at Gardens By The Bay. There we paid for the tour and then our guide showed us best where to be to see the magnificent show at 745pm. From there the bus picked us up and took us to Marina Bay Sands. We then heard to level 86 and out onto the Observation Deck... so beautiful. Once back down stairs we walked the link the hotel, past the casino and through the shopping mall to outside and into the Bumboat which took us along the river. What a wonderful night. Once off the boat we had the option of staying there around Clark Quay or being taken back to our hotel, we did that.
Stephen our guide was funny, informative and a lovely man.

REVIEW_TITLE: Totally Amazing best tourist attraction for all ages
REVIEW_BODY:
The best tourist attraction and a MUST SEE for all age groups Male or Female.
You can spend all day or just a few hours in these splendid uplifting spaces. The Flowerdome is just beautifuI. A day tour followed by the night attraction is definitely a must also. I will be back.
Love Singapore and cannot wait to return.

We visited the Flower Done, Cloud Forest, Skywalk and watched the laser show. Very enjoyable spending a few hours from the outside heat and walked in an air conditioned room. Must visit it in Singapore.

Not much to say but amazing must see, love this country so much. Can‚Äôt wait for our next visit. Walking around going the directions and care for the public, experience excellent, the tree top walk and light show was amazing, a must see if you‚Äôve booked a stop over. The backdrop and treetop walk is great. A must see attraction.

REVIEW_TITLE: Likely the best tourist attraction in Singapore?
REVIEW_BODY: This is likely the best tourist attraction in Singapore. It mainly comprises of two indoor gardens, one is flower-themed (Flower Dome) and the other one is waterfall-themed (Cloud Forest). The items in display in both domes were beautiful and breathtaking. And if you‚Äôre done, you can visit nearby attractions like the skywalk (which I didn‚Äôt because it was closed due to rain).
Beautiful gardens to spend a nice evening..the entry is paid but totally worth it if you are a nature lover

The way that flowers and plants are arranged in the dome is impressive at first, but once you've been there for 30 minutes or so the experience begins to drag on a bit. The light show is neat for the first minute or so, but really is not that great. There are no lasers with mist or fog, no fancy projections, only some colored lights that flash to accompany the various songs that play. Keep your expectations low and I guess it is worth seeing once.
Absolutely beautiful place, by far the best part of Singapore.recommend going in the evening to see the trees light up! An absolute must see!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit whilst in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely loved Gardens by the Bay. The 2 domes are stunning especially the Cloud dome. We paid for the sky walk tickets too which was well worth it. The best part by far was the light display at the trees. Very atmospheric and truly beautiful.

Wonderful
Most amazing experience
Worth every cent
Gardens great domes just u believable
So much to see and do
Some species I have never seen before

Not to be missed in Singapore.
We visited both Domes and were very impressed. In the Flower Dome there was the Rhododendron exposition and it was so good.
Not to be missed either is the light show. Amazing.
Only down side is the distance you have to walk to get there, maybe it is OK in the way in but after the visit and the distance walked in the park, the walk back is tiring.

Very good free light show set to great music.

Nice to walk through the gardens at night when it was a little cooler.

We spent the entire day here. Wow, what an impressive place and an amazing accomplishment by all those involved. Blown away by the beauty and the amazing design of these gardens. The Flower Dome and the Cloud Dome are an absolute must to visit. They were the highlight of the day. Who could imagine spending over 6 hours wandering these amazing gardens THIS IS A MUST DO when visiting Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Gardens, Use the shuttle if you are become tired
REVIEW_BODY: A lovely place to take a stroll and see many different plants ans flowers, a few sculptures here and there. The food places are very touristy. Skip them. Gift shop not worth it.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of best destination of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Great ambience beautiful decorations design unique one in all over world great view I think most people come for click beautiful picture here lovely garden building awesome view all over

What an incredible place! The Gardens, the Skywalk, the Supertree Grove, the Light and Sound Show, the Flower Dome, The Cloud Forest OMG the list goes on. After three days of exploring I still lots more to see and have to return to see them all again another time.
As a Lover of Flowers and Gardens, I was in Heaven in this place. I can't believe the generosity of the Gardens Management to share the incredible light show and the garden for everyone to enjoy free of charge.
The entry prices to the two domes are also so reasonably priced it is unbelievable!
A most beautiful feature to be explored and enjoyed by world travellers!
Loved it so so much!
Day visit, the park is well layer out and they have thought of everything. Amazing amount of plants, the environment and expanse blows your mind.

Surreal experience where you are transported from one amazing view of plants to another. Do the audio tour arond the expansive grounds first. It helps to orientate you to what is on offer.
The Flower Dome is absolutely amzing.
The Cloud Forest is incredible.
The Supergrove trees are out of this world especially at night with the light show and music.
We were fortunate to be part of a John Farnham Concert that was held in the auditorium in The Flower Dome.
What an experience!!

I am a regular visiting Gardens by the Bay - especially the Flower Dome as there are changing displays matching the seasons and events like Depavali and Halloween. The Christmas displays are amongst the most incredible with Italian made light installations in the garden that get designed and imported from Italy each year. The Santa house in the Flowerdome is every child‚Äôs dream! The displays are very lush and extremely well done, it must cost a real fortune to create. The domes are very cool air conditioned - a contrast to the outdoors, bring a jacket you need it! Awesome experience each time. If you book a table at Pollen there is a complimentary buggy that picks you up from the taxi stand - great on a very hot day....
Must visit place in singapore, its freshening and kids really enjoy a place with so many vibrant colors around

Not really a avid gardener or botanist but this place blew me away. Stayed there far longer than I originally planed.
Easily accessible from public transportation and good restaurants that cater for all tastes.
Another must see destination in this amazing island state. Everything is perfect and it is a joy to wander in amazement at such beautifully designed gardens

REVIEW_TITLE: Entertaining and educating at the same time
REVIEW_BODY:
Going there in the afternoon til evening
Watching Garden Rhapsody at 7.45hrs and its really amazing
Really enjoy the view and the experience
All at its best

A good place to visit if the weather is hot. Plenty of shade plus Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are air conditioned to a steady temperature. Lots to see including plants you would otherwise not get to see. Waterfall in Cloud Forest is impressive. Avoid weekends if you can as it gets very busy I am told. Only complaint is that the coffee shop/restaurant in Flower Dome was closed for a private function and you had to go outside to find cafe etc. Ask for a re-entry stamp!

Expect to spend several hours here and perhaps follow this up with a visit to the viewing platform on top of Marina Bay hotel.

We visited Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and the OCBC Skyway, spent around 5-6 hours there. Everything was beautiful and well maintained, plenty to see and take photos. Also a very good place to sit and relax because it‚Äôs really cool inside compare to outside temperature in Singapore.

We went up to the Skyway around sunset so the view and the sky was spectacular. We also stay up there till it‚Äôs fully dark to capture photos of the light trees when they‚Äôre on.

The light show starts at 7:45pm and 8:45pm if I remembered correctly. This to me is the highlight of the whole visit to the Gardens. Do bring a picnic blanket so you could spread it on the ground and lie down to fully enjoy the light show.

All in all highly recommend you guys to give Gardens by the Bay a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular open space in a dome
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great day out - the flora displays are quite stunning and refreshed on a regular basis. Samples from around the world and easy to see while strolling round teh dome. A worthwhile visit.
Loved the gardens by the bay. We went early to avoid the crowds, which worked although it mean you don't get to see the night time lights on the skywalk. Definitely a must for any Singapore visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Time to slow down and smell the roses
REVIEW_BODY: A trip here is the perfect way to get away from the hustle and bustle, and you are encouraged to take your time and enjoy everything it has to offer. Although it gets busy at certain times there are plenty of areas that are quieter, and the displays are so well put together you will find it hard not to stand and take it all in. The light show ends the day perfectly but get there early if you want a seat or prime spot.
We arrived at Gardens by the Bay just before sunset and found a spot on the grass to watch the light show. Bring a picnic blanket and some snacks - enjoy the view!

Beautiful place. Keep a day for this garden. Best time to visit the sky walk is from 6.pm to 7:45. You can be on the sky walk for 15 mins ideally. So be prepared to capture that awesome views quickly as possible. Guards are polite enough.

Not to miss the flower dome, the artificial waterfall.

There are a lot of things to do here. Explore and enjoy. Plan well.
Well situated gardens, overlooking Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Beautifully organised, airconditioned & cool wY to explore the Gardens

If you ever visit fabulous Singapore, Gardens by the Bay are just fantastic, they are incredible with their design and the variation in the plants and visual evening light spectacular show.
The detail that has gone into the gardens was breath taking.

Thoroughly enjoyed the Gardens so beautifully maintained.
Definitely worth a visit, right next to Marina Bay area , all conveniently connected.
Many areas to explore.
We walked, from central Singapore, plenty to look out on the way, or you can get the new MRT
Leave time to explore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay near Marina Bay Sands both place are best in Singapore. Gardens have good maintain clean and very cool bring with you camera walking shoes

We spent the whole day at the Gardens the domes were amazing and well laid out with enough space. The cafe was good though basic.

The dragonfly show was a nice addition and I bet kids would love it.

At night the garden is truly magical I'd advise to start queuing early to walk in the canopy!

We bought the shuttle bus but really didn't use it very much.

REVIEW_TITLE: Evening out seeing sights of the bay
REVIEW_BODY: What a place. As the entrance fee SPD 44 is quite steep and we only had an hour left we decided to simply miss the domes and simply walk around the external areas which was still breathtakingly beautiful. From here you can cross over via bridge to surrounding areas and take in the great sights. Clarke Quay and boat quay both a short walk to enjoy a great meal and drinks. What a great place in all and very friendly and laid back.

REVIEW_TITLE: 4:30 pm in the "Cloud Forest " Dome , the mist descends ! Wonderful cooling experience in this humid climate!
REVIEW_BODY: If you love flowers the "Flower Dome" is surely your cup of tea ! The "Cloud Forest Dome " is something else if you are into biodiversity ! Enjoyable for families or anyone else !
Day or night the place is unique. Night shows are nice and unforgettable. We go often just to enjoy.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fantastic, clean and light show is amazing
REVIEW_BODY: It is a beautiful garden just behind the Marina Bay Sands (which you want to see anyway). During the day pretty hot but beautiful with some places to relax and even a play ground with water for the kids. At night there is a spectacular light shows, a must see.

This place is absolutely majestic.. Hats off to the Singapore authorities for the splendid work in creation and maintenance of the same.. Go there towards the evening and witness their magnificent light show

It's an awesome place to visit with friends as well as our Family.We visited there on Saturday 2nd November 2019 to see the Seven Worlds,One Planet outdoor Screening hosted by BBC Earth.It was a fantastic show,once in a lifetime event filled with breathtaking wildlife footage.
The Rain Forest dome is spectacular, especially if you like begonias, and the misting over the whole height is dramatic. The flower dome doesn‚Äôt inspire as much

Go to see the evening show of the season and have a long walk before that along the little river. Sit down on the bench and look at the beautiful flowers or the magic trees. If you want a seat during the show, find and confirm your seat at the magic trees at least 30-45 minutes prior the beginning time.

This is truly an environmental friendly huge garden park surrounding with 2000+ trees & greenery.
The entire park is powered by Biomass renewable energy plant that makes the Gardens by The Bay a superb pleasant place for everyone to truly rest & relax while enjoying the various display around.
A tumb up for family & everybody even pets as well.
Flower Dome is dressing up for Christmas! Lots of thoughtfulness and efforts in creating the right atmosphere for the most wonderful time of the year! The reindeers are here, except Rudolf!
It nice and cooling inside the domes so you can walk for hours to enjoy the lovely landscaping. In the evening, this place is beautifully lighted up. Fun for young, old and couples ;))

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to flower dome and cloud forest.
REVIEW_BODY: Went with my daughter n 2 nieces. The autonomous vehicle was in operation and they charge a $5 fee. Would be good if they allow seniors free ride while on trial run. The flowers were so beautiful beyond description. As it was raining at cloud forest was very cold. The pitcher flower is so attractive. No wonder the insects fall victim to them. Its amazing that in Singapore without caves we can see stalagmites and stalagmites. We can also see huge and beautiful cacti in the gardens. One feels calm n relax after all the beautiful sights.

I really enjoyed visiting Gardens by the Bay. Peaceful, nice smiling flowers, cool temperature makes me feel so happy and relaxed. Worth visiting and revisiting. I can find a nice cool corner to read my favourite book also. So nice.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool inside with a variety of flowers and trees
REVIEW_BODY:
Great place to relax and get yourself in the middle of plants and flowers.
To look around with family and kids is the best option.

Expect to be here all day and part of the night. There is a lot to see so take your time. What ever you do don't miss the light show at dusk! Amazing display! The treewalk was quite an experience as well. Nice restaurants to eat at. One of our highlights from visiting Singapore.

When there during Sakura season... went there on late sakura season... plus the humidity in singapore, some of the sakura were whithering.

Still a place to visit whenever a new season arrives.
When in SGP, do yourself a favor and visit these gardens .... absolutely gorgeous. Thank you Singapore.

As I enter the Garden, I was amaze by the size of the dome. The air was very refreshing with all kind of flowers smell. The collection of plants is very impressive. Strongly recommend visitors to allocate at least 3 hours there.
We wen to the dome where the place is cooler and you can see many types of plants and habitat. Kids will love the place

REVIEW_TITLE: Do not miss this on your visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are fabulous, we spent two hours walking around these wonderful plants inside the glass domes, the trees at night light up to give a magical feel about the place
Gardens By The Bay is a must see and most certainly somewhere that I look forward to going back to. I particularly loved the Cloud Forest!

Even if you are not into gardens, plants and trees etc Gardens by the Bay is a must visit destination during your stay in Singapore.

The layout of the gardens as you walk into the complex is amazing. The architecture of the main glass domes has to be seen and once inside a real WHOW factor.

The various themed gardens displaying plants and trees from around the world is first class.

Apart from being a first class venue it challenges your thinking of our existence on the planet due to global warming.

Go here at night. The effect of the lights on the garden display is much better. So delighting to find an airconditioned tourist spot in very humid singapore. This place is wheelchair and stroller friendly. There is a nice restaurant inside, good for a date!!!

REVIEW_TITLE: a bit of R and R
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens are an exceptional piece of engineering and it quite spectacular to see. Not all parts of the gardens are thriving and I would expect there may be some strategic improvements over time. The light show and treetop walk are excellent.
Loved how they have brought plants from different countries to make this beautiful garden. Beautiful flowers and colors.
It's a perfect place for couples to take pictures.. Beautiful decoration and great flowers. There is even 4D ride at the end of the walk for floral fantasy. It's a 1 hour slot.

Gardens by the Bay comprises Flower and Cloud Domes, Super Trees and the surrounding cultural outdoor garden. The flower gardens are a horticulturists dream, however was somewhat a disappointment for me as the representative garden of my country, South Africa in the Flower Dome was a poor reflection of a South African garden.
The Cloud Dome however was more than made up for the disappointment in terms of concept and education.

To properly experience all that these gardens and surrounding, requires between you need 6 to 8 hours. Plan to start latest 10am, wear good walking shoes as there is lots of ground to cover and along a sun hat or umbrella for sun protection.
Take the paid tour around the garden to orient yourself and plan your next steps. The Gardens is more than just the Super Trees and the Domes. Make sure you stay to experience the 8pm light show. The gardens at night is a sight to behold.

Lovely and unusal attraction. Would advise to give yourself plenty of time for your visit. There is much room for improvement as regards information and communication regarding tickets and last entry times. Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are sold as a combined ticket but the entrances are separate and if you come at night you may have to forefit one of these attractions as the last entry is at 8pm for both of these. There were multiple groups in this position when we arrived. Eventually a helpful staff member said we actually could enter up to 8.20pm which did allow us to do both.

REVIEW_TITLE: A great way to spend the day
REVIEW_BODY:
To do it properly you'll need 5 hours, there are so many themed gardens to see and explore. Each themed garden focuses on something different. You can walk , then sit on a bench and look at the lovely plant displays. The gardens cover a large area, so don't make the mistake of visiting the supertrees and nothing else. It is beautiful and educational.

The cloud dome was fantastic and I could have gone around twice.

The flower dome was a little disappointing after visiting the Cloud dome.
It was my first visit. My wife and I took photos. The decor , ambience & music were pleasant. More objects of interest can be added to enhance the overall experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good to check out if you are full from eating
REVIEW_BODY: This is a great place for Instagram content and for people who love flowers and plants. Be forewarned that this place is very crowded which will definitely put a damper on your picture taking and overall enjoyment of a nicely put together horticulturist's dream.
You don‚Äôt have to be a gardener to be impressed by these gardens. We were very impressed with them both day and night.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the global benchmark gardens
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful. All I can say is if you like formal gardens this is must see. We like the UK Eden Project but Gardens by the Bay is a significant level higher in terms of content.
My only negative comment (and this does not reduce the score) is that there is a display of stallagtites and stalagmites - this is fundamentally wrong because it gives the impression it is ok to remove these items from caves - IT IS NOT.

The Gardens at the Bay are truly spectacular. Can't believe we have never visited when we were previously in Singapore. The Cloud Dome was our favourite; it is just unbelievable. The flower dome was also nice.
Even the outside "free" gardens are beautiful (loved the cactus garden!)
WELL WORTH a visit
Its best to visit this place in night... Crowd is there but you cant miss it ... So "must visit".. Also the viewing deck gaves excellent shots to phographers.
Really enjoyed this even after a long day the domes are amazing and the the light show is breathtaking

Garden by the Bay, what can I say. This garden was so amazing. Huge gardens and it‚Äôs free. If you want to see cloud forest or flower globe, there is a fee. But the cloud forest is so worth it. Super trees are awe inspiring both day and night. Once the sun goes down the lights come on and the trees dance to the music. Taking the metro is super easy in Singapore, which we did to get to gardens by the bay.

We visited Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, Supertree Grove -the bridge and enjoy the lights performance. Plan your time well so that you can also enjoy the evening light performance. it will be great if you can enjoy the light performance from the supertree .
during certain timing, some activities and events are also held inside the flower dome which you can spend a longer time.

It's one of those places you need to go when you're in Singapore. I can't say i've spent a huge amount of time there, the first time we went when we had just arrived in Singapore but we've obviously been numerous times with friends and relatives when they've come to visit. Go for a wander and then grab a drink at MBS after!

Get the full package and don't miss a thing. Stay for the light show starting at 1930. Food hall onsite with Asian and western food. Worlds largest green house and worlds best displays. This country is awesome with everything from the spotless streets and toilets, to the safest taxis and people. The sights at these gardens is too awesome to mention. You have to see it for yourself.

I didn‚Äôt go to the Gardens by the Bay in the day time because it was so hot. Later I found out the plants are in an air conditioned area. I did go at night though to see the beautiful light show that was free. Well worth your time!
Must visit place especially in the evening when lights are switched on! Visit the gardens, the aquarium & rain forest

A great value day out, with the only paid attractions being the 2 large inside domes and the tree walk. The gardens themselves are free to explore, as is the nightly light show which is a real must. Really well worth a visit and look out for the large monitor lizards walking around, especially near the bay!

If you are visiting Singapore - visit here. It is amazing.

Everything about the Gardens are amazing - the flowers, the trees, the sculptures and the views.

IT IS ALSO FREE ‚ò∫.

You only pay if you visit the Domes.

Yes! You heard it. A whole day is not enough to truly experience everything this place has to offer. Lots of plants, flowers, birds... The sky dome is really amazing and cold and has high walkways to. The flower dome looks even bigger inside. This, for me, is a romantic place. I think it's nice to come here not on a tight schedule so as to enjoy what it has to offer. Locals even come to this place to jog. You can do lots of bird photography in the outdoor gardens too. The light show at night is really nice.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must to see on a visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely stunning gardens and so much to see. Walking through various magnificent displays including local flowers and fauna from different countries of the world. Allow most of one day to visit and have lunch there or lunch in many of the outlets at Marina Bay Shopping centre close by.
Due to the hot weather in Singapore, the place can be very hot to move around during the daytime. More covered walkways need to built to provide shade. More trees too.

REVIEW_TITLE: A magnificent place to visit, you simply HAVE to do this when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
A great visit, well worth the time and money, and ideal to explore the indoor sections when it is raining outside.

Magnificent things to look at and take plenty of pictures of!
Wonderful experience It is a must do sight seeing and one must do it in the evening to enjoy the light show
Great value and you can go back again and again. Stay for lunch or dinner at the Gardens as well, especially before the evening show.
The Gardens are exotic & very beautifully maintained. Everything is climate controlled & looks amazing.
The rainforest glasshouse was fantastic. Such imagination and maintained beautifully. Will revisit when stopping over in Singapore.

You've got to give it to the Singaporeans, they do things on a grand scale and this is a wonderful example. Be sure to visit here for the night show, but also in the day time. I'd been looking forward to seeing 'the Garden's for years and they did not disappoint. Amazing.

Told we had to see the laser and sound show around these giant cooling towers covered to look like S\F trees. Easy to find on Bayfront MRT station with an A\C walkway all way to the attraction. Got there with 5 minutes to spare had a good view but we were a bit disappointed as the sound was very quiet and the trees changed colour a few times. No laser lights to be seen but it does make a good evening stroll around marina bay with the iconic marina bay Sands hotel behind you with its three towers and the cantilevered whale across the top.
Wow! What a work of art! It was awesome! I took the elevator up in the ‚Äútrees‚Äù...truly a must visit to Singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: Well worth visiting - stunning at night
REVIEW_BODY: Easy to get to using the MRT system from our hotel. Beautiful, futuristic vibe. Walked around the free public access gardens in the evening and took in the lit scenery.

Gardens by the Bay is an absolute must see if you‚Äôre in Singapore! The gardens themselves are huge, we definitely didn‚Äôt see everything, and that‚Äôs without the cooled conservatories and floral fantasy. We thoroughly enjoyed all of these, however Cloud Forest was our favourite, try to get there for the misting, it‚Äôs worth it! Floral fantasy is new and worth it for the beautiful flowers, however the flight of the dragonfly was a little disappointing.
We also did the skyway, which was amazing, however we should have booked our tickets earlier! The line was huge by the evening!
Overall, it was incredibly beautiful and we could probably spend another day there again seeing all the things we missed!

REVIEW_TITLE: Surprised how much I enjoyed this area. Well worth a visit
REVIEW_BODY: A unique visit. Surprised how much I enjoyed this whole area. It is also air conditioned so it was an oasis from the heat.

It's easy to spend several hours here. There's so much to see and the cloud and flower garden domes are absolutely beautiful. We didn't get a chance to do the sky walk but will definitely be going back to do it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wow! And the super tree night display is awesome
REVIEW_BODY: We decided to visit because rain was forecast and it is all indoors. What a truly amazing botanical garden. Wide variety of succulents and other flowers. The displays appear to be changed regularly. Alice in Wonderland and traditional Chinese element made it interesting. I took lots of macro photos. Spent 4 hours. Well worth the admission price.

i spend my time to visit garden by the bay
so amazing place , Enjoy to take time
we can to see beautiful flowers and plant more..very nice ..to visit
Another awesome place to visit in Singapore. Must visit place. Take time also to visit flower dome and cloud forest

The Gardens by the Bay was fantastic, so beautiful! You could easily spend a whole day there. I would highly recommend the light show, Supertree Grove is amazing during the day time, but when it lights up in time with music it is mesmerising. You will not be disappointed.

I visited the Gardens by the Bay last week. I strongly recommend you visit the Flower Dome and Cloud Dome in the evening time as it is more atmospheric. Be in the Cloud Dome by 2000hrs (8PM) as this is the last misting of the day, with the darkest and the mist makes it really a special visit. If you are frighten of heights would not recommend going all the way up to the seventh floor and walking out on the sky bridge. By the time you have completed your visit to the Domes you will be ready for the light show in the Super Tree Grove which commences at 2045hrs (8.45PM) another great event, the lights and music are very well matched.
We spent 5 hours here and enjoyed every minute, did both domes and the skywalk and styed for the light show which was amazing

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must see while in Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: These gardens are just so beautiful, go around 4pm to check out the gardens and stay to see the light show at 7.45 pm it is amazing.

Gardens can be visited for free but visit to domes well worth it, particularly the Cloud Dome. Also worth retuning at night for light show (also free). We stumbled upon a good viewing spot accessed from a public space at the Marina Sands Hotel.

If in Singapore this is a must see. The variety of flowers,plants and trees is amazing. It is enormous and you need to give 3 to 4 hours if not longer. Admission price I think is reasonable for what you see and the staff very friendly and helpful.

This was the top attraction in SG, so i think its a must. Although, I think its on the expensive side, but I think the entrance fee is due to the technologically advance garden and the upkeep of all the exotic plants, so cost is justified. But as I was walking around, I was suddenly reminded by the Kew Garden. If you cannot go to London, this is I think the next best thing. I loved the cactus exhibits and the ballerina flower. Both are perfect for photography.
This is the most amazing enclave on the bay in Singapore and it is definitely worth a visit to this peaceful oasis.
Excellent worth the visit. Went as part of the night tour which was spectacular. Highly recommend the light show

I absolutely loved this experience. It was very easy to walk around. I loved the Cloud Dome the best. The air in there felt so pure and fresh. I also enjoyed the Flower Dome. I enjoyed seeing the references to New Zealand- white water rafting, rhododendrums and flying foxes. If you had to choose, I'd go with the Cloud Dome. Z

Excellent day out and also went back in the evening for the light show.

No cost for entry into main area - pay for sky walk and domes.

Flower dome was not great as mostly same plants you see in the UK during the summer. Not for us however others from around the world may find it interesting.

Waterfall dome absolutely outstanding and very well presented. Spent at least 2 hours in there so great value for money.

Gardens were immaculate. Whist here took sometime to walk out to the barrage and see the hundreds of ships.

Light show at night was outstanding - free of charge.

The Garden by the bay is located near by the singapores most famous iconic marina bay sands. This place could be accessed through the MRT. Located beautifully with a combination of many gardens we really enjoyed the view of the super grove and visiting the cloud forest and flower dome. However this place do get crowded towards the evening and its advisable to arrive early.
Truly amazing. Took so many photos. So beautiful. Spent hours there and came back again at night for evening show. Loved it.
Be sure to go to the Lightshow at 7:45. (Times may change) It was free! Also fun to go during the day.

This was a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon. The ride is actually two rides so be sure to enjoy both. Have a Singapore Sling at the top and take in the panoramic view. Easy to reach on the MRT and just a short walk from the station.
Go before sundown as you get to see it in light and lit up later when dark. Absolutely lovely to walk through the gardens and enjoy the sights.

This is my second time in Singapore and have literally seen all the attractions for the second time. Gardens by the Bay is captivating, beautiful and a must see especially in the evening. I do recommend that when in Singapore always have an umbrella. I used mine for the sun and at times sudden downpours during the day and evening.
You must visit it‚Äôs a great show , no cost involved would recommend , show goes for approx 15 mins and it‚Äôs nice to walk through the gardens day or night
Loved the place. Great for an outing with family. Great for those taking pictures and def go at night for the best view

Inspired to visit here by a David Attenborough programme, this idillic place lived up to my expectations. Tranquility within a thriving city, well worth a visit in any type of weather. The sunset show is an absolute must as it was phenomenal!
I would encourage every tourist in Singapore to visit Gardens by the Bay. There are beautiful gardens and architecture. One can spend a whole day here and still be excited!

It was lovely to visit somewhere which is very passionate about plants. Singapore is very green and beautiful (anywhere a plant could be planted 9/10 chances a plant has been planted there) but it was lovely to see such a grand scale of different plants up close. You can buy your tickets to the different areas at the main desks. We took a ‚Äògrab‚Äô there - which is a great, safe taxi app.
Just a stunning place to visit, and the air conditioned garden domes are an oasis of cool on a steamy Singapore afternoon.
We were surprise by this place, extremely well done and organized, very creative , we were very pleased with this garden !!!
The 2 domes The flower dome and Cloud Forest are super awesome. need atleast 3 hours to have proper look and enjoy the domes

The whole experience is a wonder on every level... the extraordinary flora and design of these gardens are mouth watering... the domes are out of this world and the individual beauty of the artwork is outstanding... visit before you die!!!!
We went during the day and returned at night to see the light show which is a must see if going to Singapore,never see anything like it,the whole place is Amazing

This is a good place to stroll and have a leisure walk countering the hot and sunny Singapore weather.

This is best enjoyed during a sunny weather as the dome is shielded with special ventilation that reduces the harsh rays of sunlight plus the whole dome is air-conditioned - giving you a cool, highlands atmosphere.

I recommend this for families or big groups who has senior citizens in their group, or for people who prefers light walks, lots of pretty photo ops and relaxed vibes.

REVIEW_TITLE: A Must See - More than Just Supertree Grove
REVIEW_BODY:
Left it rather late in the day to go to Gardens by the Bay because I wanted to see the Supertree Grove at night. Should have gone hours before because there is so much to see such as Cloud Forest, Flower Dome and more as well as the Supertree Grove.
The Ticket Options I found were somewhat confusing at least by the lady I spoke to at the Ticket Office. What was particularly annoying was not being able to buy a package which included the OCBC Skywalk. For that you had to go to the Supertree Grove and find the separate Booking Office as you were advised what time the next walk was available. After booking your time you then had to join the queue and wait in my case close to an hour before my time allotted became available. I simply ran out of time before the Grove closed as I didn't want to spend my time standing in a line.
Wandered around for about 20 minutes gazing at the magnificent sight of the illuminated 'trees'. I noticed a lot of people starting to lie down in various places even on the walkway not realizing that there was an evening audio/visual display about to start (hadn't seen any signs advertising it anywhere even at the entrance).
