Decided to join all the people and lie down gazing up at the illuminated 'trees' and to my delight the audio/visual started at about 7:45 PM after only lying there for a minute or two.
Advice: Go for perhaps 3-4 hours and see as much as you can without it becoming just a blur. Certainly Cloud Forest and Flower Dome look interesting. See if you can get onto the OCBC Skywalk in time for the audio/visual. At least make sure you are there at night for everything to be lit up.
This is so beautiful and relaxing- mindblowing - take your time from after lunch and until the concert is over. Worth any penny and any minute

Beautiful grounds and heaps of things to see. Could take you a whole day just taking in the sights and appreciating the wonderful world of plants and flowers from every corner of the globe. A must see whilst in Singapore!

Being an artificially constructed garden, it has that feel throughout of course. But that said, it has an enormous collection and so e very interesting structures with water etc. Very pleasant and nice for youngsters too.

We went there at dusk about 7pm. We saw all the lighted solar trees against the dark skies with the marina bay sands as a plus. The sky park was closed because of some lightning. It had just rained around sentosa island. It was quite a view. As we were leaving the lights on the supertrees began changing colors so we stayed for a while to watch and take photos. It was worth the rush from USS to this.

We did the overhead walk at night, and it was spectacular.
The gardens haven't finished growing up the towers yet, but it won't be long. Well worth the visit and the price wasn't too bad either

This was our first visit to the Gardens by the Bay. We felt it was reasonably priced and very well organised. Crowds were not too large and we had a great day. We bought the Attraction Bundle (see website) which gave us access to the Flower dome, Floral Fantasy and the Cloud Forest (my personal favourite). I think this will become like the Long Bar at Raffles - no trip to Singapore will be complete without having visited it
This is truly unforgettable experience. Love the gardens, the views, the waterfall and lights show at night. Definitely a must when visiting Singapore!

There isn‚Äôt much to dislike about Gardens by the Bay. It‚Äôs free to walk around the expansive grounds and take in some pretty immaculate landscape architecture.
I would highly recommend getting the 2 conservatory pass and seeing Cloud Forest and flower dome. Cloud forest looks like something out of Avatar, it‚Äôs awesome.
The super tree light show it‚Äôs ok, although I expected more. If you are already there then hang around for it, don‚Äôt make a dedicated trip just for that though.
Great day out and lots to see

Absolutely one of the best attractions I have ever been to . So much to see and do spent a long time there in excess of 7 hrs . Highlights were the skywalk amongst the trees . Then the two conservatories The Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest . Excellent value staff friendly an absolute must

The general gardens are free to visit and walk around. Gardens ponds lakes and fountains. Even if you are not a gardening enthusiast it is worth visiting. Hop on hop of bus stops here. Shop casino cafe across the road if it is hot. One of a kind garden.

WOW was all I could manage to say as I slowly walked around this incredible garden and each of the domes. 7 hours it took me as I was just so impressed, I will be back.
This was really one of the most beautiful places I've ever been.
Don't miss any of the domes, as each one has its own incredible beauty.
I also loved the 4D theatre experience in the Floral Fantasy Dome, just SO beautiful, well done Singapore!!!
A must see! Photographer‚Äôs dream! Don‚Äôt forget your camera at home! There is a wide variety of plants from different countries. Amazing

Arrived around 11am and the place was fairly quiet. Walked across the walkway which was lovely but you pay extra for a ticket to do this. Floral display lovely as were the two huge domes. The place started to get busy around 5pm. The light show comes on at 7.45pm and 8.45pm where lots of people sit and watch the show to music.

REVIEW_TITLE: Spectacular and free. Don't miss the light and sound show.
REVIEW_BODY:
Spectacular garden with free access. (Except the two futuristic buildings inside that come with a fee) A must in Singapore specially the also free light and sound show that comes at 19H45 (and I think also at 20h45) everyday. Do not miss the "supertrees" specially at night.
One catch: Access is tricky through a passerelle in the "shoppes" and by a back door and an elevator by the Marina sands hotel. Ask someone for directions as indications are misleading.
everything was unbelievable, a great view, a great experience. nice job.I can't wait to return and hope to be impress like the first time :)
it is a must to visit this place if you are in Singapore. I visited flower dome, cloud forest and groove tree.. really it was a memorable experience for me.
Cloud forest was amazingly interesting. The flowers at the flower dome were attracting wish the bears; theme for the period can be allowed for us to take pic with. Coz they were too cute.

While it was very hot today, there were plenty of shady places to sit and the two greenhouses were cool inside. We were pleasantly surprised that there was mo fee to walk around the grounds and gardens. The only thing you had to pay to get in were the sky walk and the two greenhouses. You can have a nice day and not spend a dollar.

This is a very good attraction for anyone wanting to see the natural beauty of Southeast Asia and some of the most iconic buildings of Singapore. Tours range from free self-directed walks around the grounds to reasonably-priced access to specialty collections and exhibits. The Singapore Tower, Domes and Mushrooms are all located in or around these gardens. It will be enjoyed best by those with an ability to walk well, or with ambulatory assistance. A full casual walk around the gardens can easily take 2-3 hours. It‚Äôs a great way to spend a full morning or afternoon of a Singapore Tour.
Excellant facility. See the light show at 7.45pm and 8.45pm for spectacular light display and music extravaganza.

We only saw it at night so cant really say much about the gardens but the light show is amazing. Food options are limited to either fast food in a food court or fine dining but vietnamese was tasty although basic surroundings.

REVIEW_TITLE: A MUST on your list to do - But give it enough time!
REVIEW_BODY:
The gorgeous, lush gardens and the fantastic night light show can be visited and seen free of charge. The amazing (and well worth the entry frees) Cloud and Flower domes require time as well. Suggest you try to get there at least by 15:00 to allow yourself time to see some of the gardens, experience the domes before seeing the evening Garden Rhapsody show (by the trees).
Tip: One need not go up on the OCBC skyway to see the show (which anyway is tricky due to the 'timing') - honestly think the best view is from the ground!
Additional tip: easy walk across to the Marina Bay Sands Mall from the Gardens to see the fantastic Spectra sound, laser and water show. You can see two shows the same night !
The lights are on by 7:45 PM, its very beautiful to see, we went on a free walk and thoroughly enjoyed it

REVIEW_TITLE: A lovely place to cool off!
REVIEW_BODY: We visited Gardens by the Bay on our first trip to Singapore. We went during the day and enjoyed cooling off in the giant greenhouses and returned in the evening to see the light show which happens at 7.45 and 8.45.

We went and had a great half day here. Unfortunately, the forest dome was closed for maintenance and only the flower dome was open otherwise we might have spent longer there. Worth checking on the website before you go if anything is closed!!
Nice to walk around the outside spaces as well though.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to spend the day
REVIEW_BODY: Quite an interesting experience. It's peaceful and also a great way to spend the day and you can easily get lost amidst all the gardens, flowers etc. Worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Something to do if you have extra time
REVIEW_BODY: This wasn't my cup of tea but still giving it 4 stars because I can still appreciate the effort that goes into creating these gardens. We went here because we had time to kill before a 1 am flight and it was a good use of time to see the 8 pm lights since by that time museums and stuff are closed. It is something to do if you have the extra time but don't think it is a must do if you can't fit it in.
For families with children this is a place of immense enjoyment. Tram facility for exploring pereferal gardens is immensely helpful.
This was our second visit here and enjoyed it just as much as the first time. It is a very pleasurable way to spend a morning, wandering around the gardens and taking in the views.

REVIEW_TITLE: Family friendly attraction that is easily accessible.
REVIEW_BODY: The evening light and music show is very well done. The Cloud Forest is worth it as well. GBTB is also accessible by MRT
The place is nice to visit both during day and night. The theme for the plants and flowers are all insta worthy.

A nice way to spend an hour or so but many of the plants and flowers you can see in your own back garden. Rhododendrons, azaleas, roses etc. For us, for what it was, we felt it was a bit expensive, $28 Singapore dollars each to visit both domes. Would recommend if you love plants and want a couple of hours in the cool as it‚Äôs well air conditioned.
Never fail to deliver the awesome experience...always good to brings friends who enjoy nature. Never fail to impress them.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good didnt stick around till the of the show
REVIEW_BODY:
Would recommend but late show times
Difficult for young families

But definitely worth watching
Would recommend

This Garden was amazing! They also have an evening night light tour! Unfortunately we were on a tour and only allotted 2 hours not nearly enough time-allow yourself a full day or afternoon and evening! This is a MUST SEE if you are visiting Singapore!
Pictures worthy if you buy S$28 tickets for entrance in both Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. But remember bring jackets if scared of cold, as temperature can drop till around 10 degrees

This would have to be the top tourist must see in the world. We enjoyed it so much, we went for a second visit. We loved the 4D show Flight of the Dragonfly and the light show at night is spectacular and also a must see.

Gorgeous park with a lot too see for the whole family! Very romantic evening walks around the park with endless lights and different shows. I highly recommend this park, and it‚Äôs completely free if you don‚Äôt want to enter the gardens inside or go up the trees.

We spent an afternoon in the the two domes using Tiqets.com for buying the tickets. The cloud forest is about the vegetation in tropical mountain areas. Quite interesting since it is tough to get to see it live. The big waterfall is nice and then meat eating plants in too. The flower one is filled with flowers from all around the world. There are a lot of nice ones as well as a cactus section. There are lifts to bring the strollers up and down the different floors.

It‚Äôs beautiful and time passes by very fast. You would probably need a day for this. I thought half a day was enough. It wasn‚Äôt plus I was so exhausted afterwards that I could have easily fallen asleep standing. Stay hydrated, bring water with you. It is definitely worthwhile visiting.
Yep well worth a visit at night and in the day food is available and travel is easy to get there.Plenty to do etc

We spent much longer here than intended as the attractions were so wonderful. We were going to return to the hotel before the light show but ate at one of the many food outlets and there were also bands playing so stayed on. The light and music show was amazing as were the large glasshouses. Give these gardens as much time as you can spare!

A must to visit. You need hours and hours if you are to it all. We didn‚Äôt do the conservatory (payable). The rest is free unless you want to go up the treetop walk. Well worth the 8 dollars. No queues as it very controlled entry. You are up at the level of the rack forest canopy

Highly recommend. There are ample toilets but the food court isn‚Äôt too great. Take your own and have a picnic!

REVIEW_TITLE: A plant lovers paradise. Actually, just paradise...you don't even have to love plants
REVIEW_BODY:
We thoroughly enjoyed our time in the gardens and particularly loved the cooled conservatories and also the cactus area. The architecture and the huge variety of plants are so mind-blowing, it really was a highlight of Singapore.

TRAVELLERS TIP: The plants at Cloud Forest get ‚Äúwatered‚Äù through a misting system which comes at 2-hour intervals from 10 am. You may wish to visit in the evening for the best effect, as the mist will linger for a while longer in the evening when it is cooler. The water misters give the Cloud Forest more of a mystical look - it was best described in an article I read as "a scene from Jurassic Park".

HELPFUL INFO: The outdoor gardens - free admission (Supertree Grove, Sun Pavillion, Heritage Gardens, World of Plants and Dragonfly & Kingfisher Lakes) are open from 5 am-2 pm. The Cooled Conservatories - $28 (for two conservatories) with the peak times being from 4 pm-7 pm. The OCBC Skyway - $8 is open from 9 am-9 pm with the peak time being from 5 pm-8:30 pm

REVIEW_TITLE: The best garden and light show
REVIEW_BODY: Although there is a price tag for entering a few small sections of the garden, large part of the garden is free and as enjoyable. The light show in the evening is spectacular and free to watch from nearby walk way linked to Marina bay sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: The light and sound show is a must.
REVIEW_BODY: Wonderful! I went at 4 pm to see Domes nearby with flowers and waterfall then went to Super Grove to get a seat early before light and sound show. The grounds are beautiful and I walked on top as well. It gets crowded so go early to get a good seat. The light and sound show were the highlight of my layover in Singapore.
A beautiful garden with many exotic plants and flowers. Everything is very good organized. Surroundings are nice.
its a big garden with limited facilities for tourist to enjoy, staffs are not helpful and you will easiliy get tired walking around. The views are just okay...
Nice place with beautiful view. Travelling to Gardens by the Bay is more convenient by MRT and buses.

This was an amazing place to visit and well worth it. Make sure you have plenty of time as there is so much to see and do and you don't want to miss anything. Just beautiful how they have put it together and such a nice way to spend the day. Highly recommend going to it when visiting Singapore.

This is a must-visit place when you are in Singapore! Even if you have been here before, you have to visit again because there are always updated with different themes with the plants. You will be surprised at how beautiful those plants can be when are they are creatively placed together! Always a new discovery!

gardens by the Sea is one of those rare experiences and an example of what can be done by government when it is committed. Little more than a decade old, the Gardens by the Sea are built on reclaimed land and feature some outstanding attractions. The best bet is to take the train tour around the park to get your bearings and then buy your tickets for the various attraactions based on what you have seen. Whilst the walkway seems to be one of the big attractions, we found it to be more hype than value. On the otherhand the flower and indoor gardens were truly exceptional and worth the money to see.

We spent a day at gardens by the bay as lots to see. We found it cheaper to buy tickets on line. Great venue for all age groups.
We found at the bays interesting however the cloud forest with the waterfall was stunning as was supertree grove. Highly recommended.
One thing to note we found food & drink expensive at the food outlets at the bay.
Gardens by the Bay is unique place and worth to visit. You need hald day min to pass the gardens , and to see the night laser experience.

A must see !! This was a highlight of our trip to Singapore. Something new appeared every few steps. We absolutely loved the light show in the evening. Tip: arrive early, pick the perfect spot, relax and people watch!
We came to the gardens at night time. All the paid attractions were closed but we still got to see the gardens and the trees. Absolutely stunning and was nice and quiet.

Well worth a visit, you must go in the domes, no need to go up and walk in the super trees, very hot, and you can see them well enough from the ground. Plenty of toilets and ramps, easy to get around and find your way. Not busy

We attended the gardens as part of the red bus tour. The gardens are free to enter but you pay extra to visit the flower dome and the cloud forest (well worth the additional cost). You could easily spend the day in the gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit to gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: My review of the gardens by the bay visit with my family. The best and the tips.A pleasant experience which can be better with a little preparation.
We visited the Gardens on a hot and humid day and enjoyed the beautiful and serene environment. A must-do when in a Singapore.

My wife and I spent the entire day doing the gardens. We started around 10 and finished with the light show at 9. We were beat but had a lovely day with a stop at McDonalds for a burger( excuse us we had just been in Japan for two weeks and had all the raw fish we could take). The three different parts are all quite unique and you could spend much more time in each than we did. We loved each but probably the flower dome the best.

Was very impressed with this. Only $28 to get in which I thought was very reasonable. Amazing gardens , all the beautiful flowers were out in full bloom. Amazing colours and sections with different plants from different parts of the world. You could spend a lot of time here just getting lost amongst nature.

We spent the most amazing day here! The place is unique, it's a must see if you visit Singapore! We arrived early to beat the crowds and it was a wise decision. The gardens are amazing, to describe them as gardens is an understatement. Don't miss this place!

We spent half a day here , waterfall dome cool and peaceful , loved the cloud forest and the orchids and leggo . Flower fantasy lovely , not to crowded and beautiful displays . The last dome was like a indoor botanic garden with zones from around the world , Favorited was the succulents . After a nice lunch on site visited the super trees , good , but a bit sticky in daylight , much more impressive at night viewed from the Sands hotel .
Great place to visit, could easily spend a day just walk around, enjoying the views of the city. the place is amazing, you can see the light shows & very nice place to spend your time.

Ingenuity meets plant care. A good collection of flora and fauna under specially designed roof with the right temperature and set in various themes and designs is an absolute treat and worth every singapore dollar spent.

I took the whole package (Three locations) at 48 Dollars if i remember correctly. Its absolutely worth it.

The place is well maintained with drop off and pick up carts from one location to another within this package, clean toilets, directional signs and friendly staff.

A good family destination.
Great place to visit, could easily spend a day just wandering round, enjoying the views and the sunshine. Well kept and interesting. Nice food hall which was reasonably priced.
This place is like a oasis in the middle of the city. Every this lush green and beautiful. All the vegetation thrives and the Zen Gardens you can just let your problems melt away in.

We took the underground subway and came out at the entrance to this park
You can walk the grounds but I strongly suggest you purchase tickets to both of the domes. These huge glass domes are air conditioned and have lovely displays of trees and flora. The walks are easy and cover seeing the domes at different altitudes because of how they built the walks.
We really enjoyed this place. what a fantactic and almost futuristic setup. this is well worth going to if your in Singapore

My goodness.... What an attraction in Singapore. Wish we could have stayed longer. Visit day and night.
Singapore is amazing!

The Gardens by the Bay is one of the worlds most checked-in places and it is easy to see why. The combination of outdoor spaces, domes and supergrove trees creates and garden like no other. There is something of interest for everyone here and it is an unmissable climax to any trip to Asia.
This was the most amazing and beautiful gardens I have ever seen. The trees are gorgeous and the garden sculpture is amazing.

Walk through the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. A walk way will lead you across a highway down into the gardens. We had tickets into the Cloud forest and the Flower Dome. Stunning floral displays. Magnificent colours. Easy to walk around all areas. Wheelchair access. Gardens of the Dome were from several countries. Credit to the gardeners , the plants were all in good health.

Don‚Äôt miss the evening light show at the super tree grove. Was absolutely amazing.
There are lots of the gardens that are free to access so you can come back a few times to enjoy. The only ticketed areas are the cloud forest and flower enclosure.
You will not be disappointed with this place. So well run, staff are happy to assist with your needs and was worth the money

One of the most beautiful gardens you will ever visit

If you were to visit Singapore for one thing this would be the place

It‚Äôs just stunning and reasonably priced for what‚Äôs on offer

A visit during the day and then one at night for the light show is a must do event when in Singapore

Don‚Äôt miss it

I love this place. They have 2 type of gardens. And they change the flowers and plant seasonal. Beautiful. And all the gardens are aircon. Beautiful place and yet not hot for tropical weather.
Recommended .

Beautiful. Words cannot describe the care, the planning, the high level of creativity in all aspects of Gardens by the Bay. Real time and then more time is needed to enjoy the magnificence of the gardens. One has to congratulate Singaporeans for their worthwhile efforts and inspiration. Quite magnificent, flowers, trees, (huge trees and old trees) international gardens, quirky ideas, great architecture in creating the wonderful spaces- outstanding all of it!

Must be visited when you stay in Singapore
So many type of greens.
Organised very well with a lot of explanations
It is a must see in Singapore, relaxing gardens and pretty big, loved the show at 7:45pm and it is all free.

Wonderful plants and indoor gardens, with a massive waterfall feature inside for you to walk around to the top. Its Flower Dome is the largest glass greenhouse in the world.Love the pretty and colorful lights at night.

This is worth a visit, it was stunning with so many varieties of plants and the sculptures wear so impressive too. Trying to get a photo can be challenging, especially with those who like to get just the right "pose" in and want to take multiple shots! We went mid week and it was busy but not too crowded, the queues moved quickly and things were well signposted. Lots to do there.

Wanted to visit here and saw good reviews. Was still unprepared for such an incredible experience. Cloud forest and flower domes are breathtaking - flower exhibits change every 6-8 weeks - rhododendrons this visit! Would watch twice nightly light shows from one of the sky bars rather than ground level visit - still impressive. Most enjoyable!

We visited the Gardens by the Bay during the daytime. It has to be seen to be believed, those giant 'trees' are just breath taking. The different styles of gardens with all the different plants are lovely. The two giant glass houses are fabulous, a real must if you like plants and the orchid festival was beautiful. The indoor waterfall in the larger of the domes is stunning.
Don't miss going there!

Leave a lot of time as it‚Äôs very big, we only had a few hours so only saw the two domes.
If gardens and plants are your thing then you‚Äôll LOVE it.
Kids would like it too.
Worth seeing at night (which we missed) so if you got there at dusk then you could see it in daylight and at night. Or see the domes during the day (you have to pay) and go back for the rest at night when it‚Äôs all lit up.
We got cheaper tickets for the domes at Klook.com
That was amusing place full of oxygen and energy,we spended 4 hours in flower dome and cloud forest,but out of domes is a little hot at 4pm,i reccomend you visit garden atnight cause of view‚Äôgarden
Worth a visit .. perhaps pay to go upstairs on the boardwalk .. or get there early and grab a beanbag but prob couple hours earlier

REVIEW_TITLE: Must Visit all the Gardens in the Bay has to Offer
REVIEW_BODY:
So much to see and do here, both day and evening.
You can spend a whole day here, exploring the gardens, the two domes, the supertrees, etc.
Break it up with a walk across the Marina Bays Centre.

Refer to the other individual reviews for the trees, and domes.

You cannot miss this, and absolutely wow experience. Everything is so beautiful and well kept.
Totally awesome.
We like very much the place, many flowers, plants and trees from every places in the word. Price is expensive
The place was really nice and cold with really nice plant. It is a very nice place to go to because Singapore is so hot. I am writing is review as a one time place, so I will not be going back.
Excellelant the lights were just magical and could watch them several times over. the park was clean and you felt safe even with ots of people around you. Loved the lights and music. woud watch again

Beautiful gardens inside the Gardens by the Bay. An opportunity to escape the humidity and heat. The gardens are continuing refreshed with different themes. Always a pleasant and nature appreciating experience.

We went down for the free show at the Super Tree Grove and weren't disappointed, it was amazing. Something you need to go and see, no matter how good a photo may be it can never convey the real thing. I'd go again and again

Definitely worth seeing. Wear comfortable shoes and bring an umbrella in case it rains. There are LOTS of different places to walk, but if you can't do that level of walking there is a shuttle cart to help ease the load on your legs also. I visited the Cloud Dome and really loved it. Didn't get a chance to do the Flower Dome, nor did I get to walk in the giant trees. But note the Cloud Dome is air conditioned and pretty cool - so if its a hot day, this is a great option! There is an abundance of natural beauty alongside some man-made wonders as well (like the tallest indoor waterfall). Definitely a must-see if in Singapore.

There is so much to do and see in the Gardens by the Bay. You can wander the property, among the super trees and there is a hawker complex on the grounds. The Cloud Dome and Flower Dome are a must do experience. There are many different themed areas and places to stop and people watch or just relax. This is also a great place to visit at night when they have a spectacular light and sound show. A great place to get away from the crowds and noise of the city.
Exceptional ! Stunning spot to spend a couple of hours. Really amazing what they have done here. Worth a visit for sure.

Loved both of these, bought our tickets from the airport as we arrived. Liked Cloud Dome better, but please note, it is pretty cool inside, so a light jacket/cardigan is advised. Easy to get to by MRT, but a bit of a walk. Bring an umbrella for both the sun and any rain.
Had a great time just wandering around the Gardens there is lots of info about origins of plants etc very well done good place to chill out

we were not going to bother seeing this, what a big mistake that would have been, its amazing, climate controlled, a walk through magnificent gardens, and the environmental film at the end is so special. don't miss this.

The exhibition hall is quite small and I completed the whole place in less than half hour.
But the floral display are really beautiful and the 3D show is good.
Gardens by the Bay is a must see when visiting Singapore.Day or night it is a wonderful public space. Singapore should be commended!

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful flower and could forest exhibition
REVIEW_BODY:
The thing is the highlight such as flower dome, cloud forest dome and giant trees are little bit far to get in especially in hot weather.
But inside the dome, it's actually cool, so it's really good to avoid the heat outside.
For reentry, you can reenter the dome but you need to get a stamp.
ADVICE for OCBC skyway, please get the timestamp as soon as you reach the place. (or you have to wait like an hour)
It's 20 minute waiting round to get on the elevator to skyway.
I don't think it's significant to be there from my own experience.
By the way, there is light show on 7.45 pm and 8.45 pm. Be ready
So much to see in the gardens. The plants are so differnt in this place. This is definitely a must visit when going to Singapore

Booked the skywalk for early evening, but were moved along it at quite a pace as restricted numbers allowed at any one time. Views over gardens good, neon park and lit trees provide an unusual element to the garden.
If you love gardens this is the perfect place to explore at a leisurely pace. There's so much to see that you could easily spend two days taking it all in. Definitely a must visit!

An absolutely stunning garden. The synchronized light show in the evenings is a must see. The tour to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome is spectacular. This is definitely a mist visit when going to Singapore
Amazing at night with the light shows - even in the rain. And the majority of the park is free. Go at night. The shows were at 7:45 and 8:45.
This is an absolute must! I loved the Cloud dome best but the flower dome was beautiful too, both should be visited!! Not an expensive thing to do and can take as long as you like
Out of the world experience. Beautifully done gardens. You would need at least 2 days to see all of it. But it's worth the time. The light and show in the late evening is the icing on the cake.
Beautiful place to visit. Allow 3-4 hours. If you go late afternoon you can stay for the light show.
Best time to visits pm to 6.30 pm for two domes. after dinner move to super-tree for nice night view.
The Floral Fantasy (FF) is awesome. However, FF is small walk for like 10 minutes and then finish. It's suit for photoshoot session.
Scenic views and wonderful photography opportunities all around the gardens. A must see in your bucket list!

Arriving a little late into Singapore, I wandered to Gardens by the Bay. I expect to spend an hour or two and then move onto something else. I was so wrong.

After 2 hours I had barely touched the surface of the Gardens. Surprisingly to me, a large part of the Gardens is free to view, this including the Supertrees, which are amazing in themselves, especially during the evening light and sound show. This was truely special and not to be missed.

You do pay to enter the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. That was SGD28, which I consider money well spent as I spent probably 3 hours there in total. Times that by 2, as I went again the next day as I enjoyed it so much.

The grounds are huge and many beautiful things to see. Other than hunger preventing me, I would have spent at least an hour or two more there looking around.

I recommend you go after lunch to see everything and wait until the Supertrees light show. Otherwise, go twice like I did.
Truely Amazing!!! So unique the gardens are stunning both by day and night! If you have h the time would recommend both, the light and sound show is beautiful!
Excellent visit especially the evening show went three evenings in a row it was so good. Great views on the walk way

REVIEW_TITLE: An afternoon till evening strolling at gardens by the bay
REVIEW_BODY: This is my first time visiting here, while my friends had came a dozen times aredi! A very popular tourist attractions place, with two domes sheltered housing all these flowers species in a cool zone! I find the high held bridges interesting n excited, cos u can see tru below, one might get nervous of height, overall a fun fill outing n if u love flowers!
Such a huge variety to see. These gardens are spectacular and so well planned and maintained. Entry is S$28 for two exhibition halls.

Amazing!!! Loved the Cloud Forest the best. Incredible! If you are going make sure you leave enough time to see it all. I had to rush at the end which was a shame. The Hanging Garden is on the other side of the park so a shuttle ticket might be an idea.

Place is nice and attractive specially in evening time under the lights although could not get the chance to explore complete but the worthy to visit.

recommended
Breathtaking highly recommend. Go early as it gets quute busy. Incorporating the cloud forrest in your visit
We enjoyed wandering about the gardens in the cool dome. This time we didn‚Äôt go to see the light show but have previously and it is fab.

A great place to spend a few hours wandering around. Many exhibits and gardens to see, most of which are free.

Really nice staff in the visitor center too where I was able to charge my phone while I looked around.

Worth a look if you have a free morning or afternoon to spend here.
The night show was something out of this world. Hard to find from Marina Sands give yourself time to get there

REVIEW_TITLE: Visits to Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: I have visited Gardens by the Bay about 4 times during the last few years that I have visited Singapore. The Gardens are free to the public, and easy to approach by public transport (MRT train and Bus), either to the main Gate or to the "Canopy", which is a central Meeting point inside the Gardens. It is well laid out, and you can take an electric buggy ride through the gardens. There are also 2 large cooled covered enclosures, the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest, besides the OCBC (walking) Skyway, all 3 with ticketed entry. There is also a free open air "Sound and Light Show" at nights. I have seen 2 special shows in the Flower Dome, the Tulips Show and the Cherry Blossom Show, which were exquisite and most colourful. Normally, there are seasonal shows here every year. This is a must visit location, not far from the main attractions in the city, for all visitors to Singapore..

We were worried about the cost of going to Singapore but were presently surprised. There are many things to do and see on a budget. It costs nothing to go to the gardens by the bay. They put on a wonderful light show ( I think it was 9 pm but check). You can pay to go up, but there are plenty of viewing platforms you can watch for free and may even get a better overall view. We loved this show, with the bright lights and Disney songs. Easy walk from the mrt station.

Do yourself a favour and and head to Gardens by the bay. It is very reasonably priced for such a wonderful place and you can easily spend a few hours here. Make sure you stay for the light show in the Supa grove. The food court has a large range of cuisines and finding a seat was not a problem. Be prepared to wait for quite a while in for a taxi at the end of the light show.

The Gardens by the Bay is a wonderful place to visit. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the time spent here. We visited Floral Fantasy and the Cloud and Flower Domes which were amazing. We also visited by night for the sound and light display. Well worth visiting.

My husband and I enjoyed this attraction very much. The scene is futuristic than any other gardens I've been to.

If you are a first timer like me then I would advice that you purchase the bundle package which includes Flower Doom, Cloud Forest and shuttle ride from main entrance to the two Dooms. The walk is long and the weather is hot during the day, so I would strongly recommend it. The bundle package only can be purchase at the ticket booth.

We went to the Floral Fantasy first, which is very romantic & beautiful. Especially, we loved & enjoyed the ride at the end very much.

The Flower Doom & Cloud Forest are nice too. I was amazed by the varieties of flowers & trees that they have in the doom.

We didn't get to do the supertree's skywalk because we thought it would be better to do it around the dawn instead of morning. We were planning to go back around 5pm.
However we have encountered some incidents that our schedule got delayed by couple hrs. We went back close around 8pm and the ticket was sold out, so we weren't able to go up there.

Overall, we had great time. We ended up spending more time than we originally anticipated. I would recommend place if you like flowers and plants.

Big park that needs to be discover with some free time because is so big. There is some expositions regarding local flowers and plants that are so interesting and views around all the visit are great. The most great time for me has been the spectacle of music and sound on the light tree area during the night, environment are so amaizing. So recommend to visit with children. If you start the visit during the day, note that the sun is so strong and as the park is very big you need to have comfortable shoes.
Other nice thing is the way to leave the park, you can go by walk crossing a bridge until the Hotel Marina Bay Sand, entering by one of his doors and discovering a big commercial centre inside. The park is so beautiful, plenty of small rivers and water source. Cleaning is incredible.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the must visit in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited with friends during the day to walk round and visit the 2 main attractions , the Rain Forrest and the Flowers
You must also visit it in the evening to see the light show

Like everyone else visiting Singapore, this is definitely a place to see.
Great vibe, great light show in the super tree grove
Lovely place to walk around and a great food court

Stunning views. Especially from the sky walk. Really great day out to just walk around and enjoy the beauty this place has to offer. Places to get refreshments. And also a chance for kids to have a splash in the water playground. We expected to have a short trip, but ended up spending the whole day just walking round. Really worth a visit.

This place is one of the best gardens/places we have ever been to. We got there about 6 p.m. so only had a few hours before we had to leave. The rhododendron show was on in one of the giant domes and as everybody rushed off to the 7:45 light show we went to the cloud dome. It was brilliant. The scale of the gardens is hard to describe, we went down to the 8:45 light show and sat under a tree to watch. It was a bit hectic trying to leave but our Grab found us.
On of the most popular attractions in Singapore. Fantastic vegetation, funny sculptures. Be generous to yourself, let 1,5 2 hours to see everything

The best time is to visit is at night to enjoy the lit up Supertrees, the Gardens, Flower Dome, Cloud Forest and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Savour the culinary delights at Satay by the Bay. Then take a stroll to the Marina Barrage for unobstructed views of the city skyline.

Bloody brilliant place, wow, I really enjoyed my walk through this garden. I am no plant person, but I do appreciate beauty and this place is beautiful. The different gardens are well done, the Australian garden did have a lot of plants that I recognised from our garden in Sydney. The baobab garden reminded me of Africa, it brought back many memories. Thank you.
Exceptional night light display and beautiful flower dome and cloud forest. Flower displays including the diverse types of orchids were amazing.

REVIEW_TITLE: DO NOT Buy your Tickets on KLOOK and pick up at RED DOT Museum!! Its a 65 minutes walk under the HOT SUN!
REVIEW_BODY:
We were dropped off at the Entrance of GBTB only to find out we had to walk all the way to the RED DOT Museum to collect the tickets.
Under the FIERY HOT SCORCHING Sun we were told to take a shuttle then walk to the RED DOT Museum. It was the most unbearable experience as the staff kept telling us to walk over. Shuttle, Cross a pedestrian bridge, into a mall, walk all the way to the end of the mall , out in the sun again to the end of the promenade... just to collect the tickets. That was definitely a Marketing PLOY for Red Dot Mesuem. Finally had to walk to the adjascent office building to mail a taxi back to GBTB.

It was a nice experience cooling inside the cool blowing temperatures, with our sweat drenched shirts and pants. Needless to say we caught a cold the next day!!

Dont spoil your visit, buy the tickets at the main entrance!!
Truly amazing and captivating, either from afar or up close. The way they weaved together the flora is truly mind blowing!

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice Attraction but Access Bottlenecks is a Concern
REVIEW_BODY:
Nice attraction. Well-designed but not cheap. While I agree with recommendations to go late afternoon to catch the light show when it gets dark (7:45 pm for 1st show), make sure you provide enough daylight time if you wish to go to the two main gardens. We ended up in the floral garden and it was too dark to appreciate it as they keep the lighting quite dim. We went on a Saturday and it was extremely crowded. It was designed to push the crowds through so it wasn't a long wait but it distracts from the nature appreciation aspects.

The most disconcerting part are the massive bottlenecks along two narrow staircase on the path to get back to the Bayside MRT Station when everyone leaves after the light show. While the crowd during my visit was relatively well disciplined, it is a disaster waiting to happen if anything unusual occurs. The massive sway in the pedestrian bridge with a huge crowd was not the most pleasant. I am surprised these were not taken into account in the design.

I go there at mid-autumn festival .
There got a lot of light and lantern are display.
I go with my friends and take a lot of photo there for memory. :)

This attraction is definitely unique and very beautiful. We went through the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome. The Rhododendron Radiance display was stunning. This place is wonderful for all kids from toddler to 100. It is a place where your senses are working on overload to take it all in. You keep thinking about different aspects, long after you have left the building. Make sure you take your camera/phone, there are plenty of magical photo opportunities.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay - Need to go on a bright sunny day / For people afraid of heights, bring someone to hold your hand
REVIEW_BODY: It was a fun day at the Gardens at the Bay as the sun was out and the air was fresh. For people that is afraid of heights, you may need someone to hold your hand just in case you feel dizzy walking among the supertrees.
Garden by the bay is a botanical garden in Singapore. There are millions of plants here. The air and atmosphere was the greatest thing!

Well worth coming here, if you can make it on dusk all the better and stay through to see the light show once its dark.

Bit of a walk from the MRT station and also around the gardens. There is an inexpensive shuttle.
beautiful area to walk around and you can see many types of flora and fauna here. Its design is not the best as you keep walking in circles

We visited the gardens at night for light show and parade which was great fun.
In the daytime the gardens are great to walk around and visit the skywalk for an even better view.

Spent a morning at the Gardens, absolutely fantastic if you love plants, flowers and gardening. Lots to see and kids will enjoy. Amazing experience under the domes in controlled enviroments. Great views from the tree tops, a must do in Singapore.
Worth the purchase gor the skywalk flower dome and cloud. Great thing to do on a short or long layover in singapore.
Had never been inside the ‚Äúbubbles‚Äù before, but wished I had! Lovely inside spaces and well worth the money for the experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Light and Sound show is a must!
REVIEW_BODY: One of the highlights of Singapore, Gardens by the Bay is beautifully made area, with the main attractions being the Cloud Forest and Flower Domes and the Supergrove trees. The light and sound show at the supegrove trees is a must watch, at 7:45pm and 8:45pm everyday!!
A great place to cool down in the heat when you visit the indoor waterfall. Kids love it and there‚Äôs also plenty of refreshment areas and learning experiences for all ages.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great displays of flower befitting its name
REVIEW_BODY: My wife loves flowers, so we went to see the place. Lucky for us, the display was "Rhododendrons Radiance" which was magnificent. Different species of this flowers beautifully arranged. For us, only this display was worth the ticket price. We also loved other flowers there, especially the succulent ones.

My wife wanted to go to the place with the tall electronic trees which is Gardens by the Bay. We took Grab over to the place with no issues getting there.

We got there in the knick of time for busloads of school kids and tourists that follow a flag came just after we arrived.

We paid the admission to see the gardens. Absolutely spectacular. Lots of different fauna, trees, etc from countries around the world. It was great seeing stuff from South Africa, New Zealand and other countries I had been to years ago.

My wife went picture taking like crazy. It is inside a very large dome and is air conditioned.

I whole hardheartedly suggest seeing it

It was a nice visit/walk. good organization and efforts to offer the visits a nice ‚Äúgreen‚Äù area with the corresponding information to the plants and trees. It was not what I expected but if you are in Singapore then at least do not miss the light night show and the skyline walk!

Spent the entire day at the gardens as so much to see. The floral exhibits were magnificent and we especially enjoyed the orchids and the rhododendrons. We went to view the sound and light the following day ( free ) as the main exhibits do take time to get around. This was also very spectacular. Definitely a mail attraction in Singapore.

What an amazing place! And a great place to escape the heat. The cloud garden was our favorite, what an amazing design and loved the different levels and plants. The flower garden was nice but very busy. The tree top walkway was excellent... we went there mid day and almost had the whole walkway to ourselves. Incredible views! I understand that in the evenings you have to queue for long periods of time....fyi
a must see whilst in singapore not only by day but surely at night time. Amazingly spectacular display of dancing lights.
The rhododendrons were stunning. A beautiful cool place to wander surrounded by lunch vegetation . Great little restaurant inside the service and food gorgeous.
This place is absolutely amazing and if you ever go to Singapore this place is a must see. So beautiful and so well done.

I visit Gardens by the Bay at least twice a year. And each time, I am amazed with new things to see. All conservatories are well maintained. We loved the Flower Fantasy so much! It was perfectly conceptualized. I could visit the place over and over. Furthermore, the staff are very nice and accomodating. Great experience!

If you plan to go shopping in this place.. I will have to disappoint you cause apart from souvenirs you cannot get any thing much. But on the whole i give 5 stars because it's a place which is quiet and a place you can go for good walks.
Arrive about 16:00 for a 5 star evening. Just don't book with Kook or pick up at Red Dot Museum. THAT will cost an hour, plus a twenty minute walk, and a S$8 cab ride.
a very nice experience. got to see and learns lots of different types of plants and flowers. it was so beautiful

The gardens are fantastic they were extremely clean and well cared for, there were three light shows around the super trees each evening I would strongly recommend anyone going to Singapore seeing one of them, It was really amazing it was almost like watching a firework display, you have to see it to believe it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous gardens and Tree light show.
REVIEW_BODY: We loved walking round the gardens, the amazing glasshouses, satay on the bay for some street food and the light show. We actually went back again because the cloud forest was closed on the first day.

REVIEW_TITLE: not my idea of a garden
REVIEW_BODY:
We were excited to visit and decided on early evening to visit to see the gardens being lit up. It was so crowded. We went on the Skywalk which was very good. Lots of lovely photo opportunities. It all looks wonderful in the evening but it's more of a tourist attraction rather than a garden. If you want to see a proper garden The Botanical Gardens are utterly fantastic!
I wouldn't visit again but nor would I discourage others. This review is strongly my opinion.
The current exhibition for another couple of weeks is rhododendrons and azaleas. This is an awesome place to visit. Try to catch the misting at selected hours at the Cloud Forest.
Gardens by the Bay is a must see location. You will love the views, the gardens, and the whole experience.

Not the cheapest attraction but very interesting. If you have flown in on Singapore airlines take some booking paperwork with you to the attractions, like this one and the zoo - the Eye etc as you will recieve a 10% discount on entry fees.Nobody tells you this but it is well worth doing. Also a lot of visitors forget that there is a lot to see of the gardens - OUTSIDE. Everyone sees the two main attractions and then leave - there is a lot more to see.

We had a lovely day at the botanical gardens, thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful displays. Favourite chargeable display was the cloud forest, but the free-to-view supertree light show is just fantastic.
Entry fee is on the high side, but there is lots to see and enjoy, even for non-gardeners
Just incredible. Go at sunset for the transition from day to night. Absolutely magical! Awesome to walk around and take amazing photos! Stay for the light show!

This is a beautiful place and please take some time to visit it.the flower dome is full of colourful flowers from all over the world and the cloud forest has a waterfall and a canopy walk.to cover the cloud forest quickly start from the top taking an elevator.the gardens are full of mist and it is very cold inside.enjoy the super tree arena ,it is best enjoyed in the evening.there are a lot of options to eat.McD is also there

Going to the Domes tomorrow (payment required) but we visited the park twice already. The rest is free. The ‚ÄòSatay by the Bay‚Äô hawker area is quite a walk but fabulous. The free night light show is great (7:45 & 8:45 pm for 15 minutes). We loved it. One warning, bought postcards in one gift shop but to get stamps we had to go to the one gift shop. They wouldn‚Äôt sell it to us until we showed the receipt and card of the purchased postcard.
Been here many times and still as impressive as ever. Transport for less mobile very welcome. Light show each evening with staying for.

In one line - DO NOT MISS IT

simply awesome. The cloud forest and the flower dome will take your breath away

The light show in the evening is pretty amazing as well

Nice way to spend a morning. Lots of nice plants, flowers and trees to look at with information signs dotted about also. I enjoyed it although it was so hot I took a break to visit the air conditioned domes.
We visited The Gardens by the Bay and were very privileged to witness the fantastic light show, would highly recommend to anyone visiting Singapore to try and fit this into your schedule.

So worth it. We did both domes plus the Floral Fantasy. Floral Fantasy was my favourite. We got there right on when it opened so we had that section to ourselves. Recommend getting there as it opens. üëçüèª

The Flower Dome has a vast selection of flowers from various parts of the world with special collections added every now and then and the new added dome The Floral Fantasy has that playfulness and artsy designs of floral along the interior of the dome

REVIEW_TITLE: If visiting Singapore this is a must 5*
REVIEW_BODY: Plenty of transport links and various food cafes and restaurants. If you need to charge your phone the information office has free charging lockers.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Skywalk was great , some great pictures from up there .
REVIEW_BODY: I went with friends but Everyone , all age group will love this place , you have to go on the skywalk to take some pictures . Also plenty of places to eat and drink .

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for day or night
REVIEW_BODY:
This place has so much to offer, unfortunately the cloud forest was closed when we were there

The light show at night is a spectacle to say the least, plenty of food options and cafes for a break from the walking.

The sky deck is worth going up and seeing the gardens from a plan view as they really huge

If you don‚Äôt want to spend too much money but have a wonderful time at gardens by the bay with the great light show at 7:45pm or 8:45pm. If you like Disney songs you will be in heaven. Check out the show from the mall to have a global view and then under the trees for more emotion.

We walked from the main town down to the marina but there is a MRT very close. You can walk around the park area at no cost and also watch the light show (745pm and 845pm) for free. We paid to get into the cloud forest and it was worth it. You can buy ticket bundles if you want to do more and get a discount. Plenty of toilets and a tram (cost). We didn‚Äôt pay to go up the skywalk but I can imagine it‚Äôs a great view for the light show.

REVIEW_TITLE: A lovely place to visit especially worth the money to visit the domes especially the flower dome
REVIEW_BODY: The flower dome is great as its showing flowers from many countries. They are in flower not necessarily in the correct season so i suspect the display must be changed when they go over

One of the most impressive place in Singapore. I already enjoyed the best show in there with the lights changed according music. In addition, I visitted the orchid garden as well as green forests in there. The place can not miss in Singapore.
Very creative and mind-blowing sample of the art. So many plants and trees that one will love this concept.

REVIEW_TITLE: Very very cool! It‚Äôs a must see!
REVIEW_BODY: Just watch the you tube videos of this. The skywalk is very cool and must be done. Take a cushion or something to rest your head on as lying down underneath the trees is the best way to enjoy the light show.

What a delight to experience the Gardens By The Bay attractions! To watch my 8 year old daughter light up as we walked through the doors to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.. she literally started to dance and beam.
Highly worth a visit!

Spending a few hours wandering around these beautiful gardens was a highlight of our time in Singapore. The gardens are impeccably maintained. We visited the Cloud Forest and the Flower Dome which were both incredible. Informative climate change display at the end of the Cloud Forest walk was thought provoking. We will definitely be back next time we're in Singapore.

Gardens by the Bay is great daytime and especially in the evening when you can look at the famous light show. It's at 7.45 PM and it's free. Should you wish to go into the domes to look at flowers and plants you'll need a ticket.

One of the most amazing things I ever saw
The Silver garden is of total 3 trees and than we went to the main attraction. The place was crowded but there was enough room for everyone and more
The light shows was spectacular
After the show we were ‚Äúlost‚Äù in the gardens, really beautiful place, everything is amazing, clean and peaceful

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful garden with flowers from the world
REVIEW_BODY: This garden is beautiful with a lot of flowers. Interesting information about the flowers and they have a eating area.

What a beautiful place to visit, the gardens were so colorful and extensive. Very well maintained and kept. I've always wanted to visit this place, I'm so glad I had the chance to go. The night light show was equally as spectacular.

REVIEW_TITLE: The greatest garden in the world
REVIEW_BODY: My Singaporean friends took us to walk around merlion,durian opera and then keep moving to Garden by the Bay there were many flowers from different countries in the world here and there are about 6 chimneys with trees climbing around looks very impressive indeed, our children like walking around the garden very much . Really enjoyed the day and we will definitely come back to the Garden By the Bay in Singapore

What a magnificent establishment in the middle of a concrete jungle. We thoroughly enjoyed the day out. The plants and flowers have been lovingly maintained and the general grounds are impeccable. There is work being done on the biggest treetop but it did not deter from the experience. I did wonder if there may be butterflies and birds to add to the beauty but there definitely no wildlife. 100% effort into the flora.

REVIEW_TITLE: worth a visit for cloud forest and light show.
REVIEW_BODY: Had a couple of hours walk around here and really enjoyed it. did the sky walk the cloud forest and stayed for the music/light show. unusual but glad we did it.

Gardens by the Bay is and unique garden in Singapore where you can witness flora around the world under one (actually 2) roof. There is also a light show at 7:45 and 8:45 on weekdays and on weekends 7:45, 8:45 and 9:45 which is good and free.
Must go if you are in Singapore.

It is opposite to Marina Bay Sands and near to Singapore flyer and Merlin which can be covered together.

There are food court in the garden as well.

Great location with many areas to visit, we toured both domes, well worth it.
Need a few hours needed to walk thru both domes.
Care if there are storms around for if you want to take the "skywalk", this activity could close without notice. It will not re open if closing time approaches 9pm.
The light show is well worth it, its free..two shows 7.45 pm and 8.45pm. Plenty of places to eat....good views of Marina by the Bay as well. After shows it's a mad dash for taxis, we waited 20 mins on a week night.
The pictures speak for themselves. You must go here. So much to see. Lived cloud mountain as it was a great relief to escape the heat. The flora is just amazing.

Amazing, beautiful and futuristic. A must see. Allow a full day if you want to see everything. We spent 5 hours there and only did the Cloud Dome, Flower Dome, Floral Fantasy and the evening light show at the Supertrees. Plenty of toilets and water refill stations. We had dumplings at one of the restaurants for lunch and these were very good. Don't miss it.

REVIEW_TITLE: The most amazing place for free
REVIEW_BODY: The sight and sound of this place at night is amazing the light show is twice a night (less people at the second ) if you go to the first one you can get up onto the bank and watch it

We tried the children‚Äôs area, but whole place is indeed worthwhile of visiting. Make sure that you have your swimming gear with you. Note, I would not recommend the Satay restaurant area in the area despite it offers a large variety of different street stylish choices.

What a beautiful place this is .The Singapore heat burning outside you explore this beautiful cool place. The flowers are something else .Even if like me your not big into flowers. You have to be impressed. The cloud garden is great with some very interesting wood sculptures. And to finish it off The Trees outside are well worth the time .Sadly I missed them at night but I'm told they are beautifully lit.
A truly spectacular sight.... the flower exhibition was good but the evening light show "a must see".

REVIEW_TITLE: Family Visit in daytime and evening
REVIEW_BODY:
Easy to reach via Metro, nice gardens to relax in during the day. Indoor domes are a must although there is an entry fee, unlike the gardens.
In all places, it was easy to access for strollers and the kids will find it very exciting.
In the evening it gets very busy before the light show starts, so if you have young kids get there early to secure a good place. After the light show, the lifts are very busy so it will take time getting out with a stroller.

REVIEW_TITLE: Expected better but it was ok.
REVIEW_BODY: May have made a mistake going in the morning. Maybe late afternoon or early evening, with all the lights, it‚Äôs better. However, it was a nice thing to do for a couple of hours, and nice and cool in the domes.

A must when in Singapore! The gardens are fantastic, well laid out, full of plants and attractions and is a definite must see! Both the cloud forest and the flower dome were excellent, packed full of flowers, plants and other sights you really do get your value for money when visit them.

Also the flower show in the evening was incredible and rivalled those you‚Äôd find at Disney World in America!

Recently visited gardens by the bay,it is a visually stunning location just in front of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
The cloud forest was amazing,the range of Orchids was superb.
This is a must visit attraction In Singapore.
These gardens are amazing.We went in the evening.The trails are easy to walk and the variety of plants are gorgeous.Great for families and easy to walk around.
The place was well preserved and clean. It was amazing how they can grow such an amazing flowers and magnificent architecture. The restaurant inside was reasonably prices and the staff was kind.

What an experience. I would recommend going not only to the light show but also to the forest and flower domes. What an experience. The domes gives you a unique way to explore a hidden forest with great climate (after escaping the Singaporian heat).
The light show can be summed in one word: WOW.
Enjoy
The show was free, met some great people. But not that amazing. Just trees and lights. Pretty aquariums with different type of fish

Was a very well put together place. Both indoor Domes had a lot of varieties of plants/flowers etc. both were grand in size.
Nice place to visit.
If you are going at night, you can easily get lost as the garden is not very well lit. But they do have really nice view and it is nearby the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
I saw gardens and lights but it was not special I guess you have to have an appreciation for such. I will try again

I love visiting gardens around the world, but this place was truely epic. I would recommend a stroll through during the day and then again at night when it all comes alive. The kids really love it to.
Supertrees worth seeing. Don't have to pay to visit the gardens. There are light shows in the evening. A short walk to Marina Bay Sands hotel and metro.
A superb garden to explore day or night. We visited during a ‚ÄúToy Story‚Äù light show and enjoyed both of the paid entry attractions too.
A wonderful experience with a unique way of experiencing mother nature and technology. Operating hours at your most convenient time until 2am. Very much appreciated.
A must see after dark. Light & Sound show 7:45 & 8:45 PM. Fantastic views of the giant trees but also a great view of the Marina Bay Sands.

Loved the gardens, especially the cloud domes filled with waterfalls, mist & gardens. Missed the skywalk as it close due to rain, told to come back to use our ticket bit tricky as flying out! Worth a visit but make sure you get dropped off where you have to collect ticket as we did a fair hike to get there!

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens with lots of options
REVIEW_BODY:
The gardens are amazing. The biospheres are incredible, the Flower dome and Cloud Forest are simply stunning. Theme changes in the Flower dome throughout the year, we saw rhododendrons, Xmas time will focus on poinsettias.
We took the shuttle to the new exhibit Flower fantasy which included a 4D ride at the end of the exhibit ( a 3D film which replicated flying through the Gardens from the viewpoint of a dragonfly, the 4th dimension included sprays of water, air and bubbles ) It was quite amusing and light hearted, and very impressive ( worth doing)
We took the Audio tour on a buggy through the gardens and this explained all of the areas, different gardens and sculptures. This is a great way to see and hear about the gardens especially as it can be so hot and walking the gardens can take a few hours. To do all of the gardens you really need most of the the day. Total cost per adult was $46 to see the biospheres and floral fantasy ( shuttle included)
The audio tour cost extra $8 per adult
The light and sound show ( which starts at 7.45 & 8.45 each evening ) and children‚Äôs garden ( waterplay area) are free.
This is a spectacular area of Singapore and should not be missed

REVIEW_TITLE: Incredible gardens. Out of this world experience.
REVIEW_BODY: The most incredible garden dome in the world. Short of the leuver in France, this was incomparable. You must go to see, and the nightie lighted with music garden show near the marina bay Sands hotel.
This is one of Singapore's most unique attraction. Best visited after dark, when the gardens transform into a fairyland of lights.

REVIEW_TITLE: First visit to the Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY:
We decided to visit the Gardens by the Bay whilst staying in Singapore, being totally honest we were left slightly disappointed having paid $36 each to obtain entry into a couple of the exhibitions.

The Floral Fantasy does have some very exotic and interesting flowers/plants as does the Flower Dome but it‚Äôs not really worth the entrance fee.

The Cloud Forest was unfortunately closed for maintenance, we didn‚Äôt get a chance to walk around the public gardens as it was dark when the light show finished.

The light show which is formed around and onto the Super trees is a great spectacle and was by far the best thing we saw and it‚Äôs free, the show starts at 19.45 each evening and lasts for 15 minutes.

My advice would be to walk around the vast public gardens during day light and then take in the Super Tree light show both free of charge.

This is an excellent display of plantings, waterfalls, and much more. You could easy spend a day in here seeing all that the Singaporeans have developed and what they are aiming to achieve. Well worth the money spent.

We were in awe when we visited the gardens. So much to see and experience and its all for free! The themed gardens and the childrens gardens with the water park was a nice surprise for the kids. Loved the various education tents and the gardens are nicely spread out for the visitors
During the weekends it can get a bit crowded but there is plenty of room for everyone. There are also restaurants for lunch/snacks and Satay on the Bay is amazing for anytime!
Ask when the evening show is on. Then the artificial trees are illuminated, you will see a light show and special music is played. Nice.
Very pretty Area, should definitely come by to check out everything from the super trees, to the flower and cloud domes.

This has to be one of the most magical experiences for me while travelling. I would recommend this for everyone. I spent around 9 hours there and did not want to leave !

I arrived and wanted a quick tour before walking around.
There is a bus ride you can get for around 7SPD or around this price I can‚Äôt remember exactly. This was great- English speaking tour guide pointing out all of the different sections and then ending by the cloud forest so you can buy a ticket and go inside.
There is a dual ticket for all the domes which are all worth the price.
The floral fantasy is on the other side of the park, you can get a bus over or it‚Äôs about a 10 min walk from the other domes.
You can walk around the park with no charge and do not have to pay if you don‚Äôt go into the domes / skywalk etc.
You have to pay around 7/8SPD to walk on the super tree grove skywalk, this is done in time slots and can get a bit busy but the lines move quickly. If weather is stormy they will temporarily close the walk for safety- but you can simply wait for it to clear and get a later time slot. This is what I did, I just went and had some lunch while waiting.
The food there is great there are lots of choices inside the food hall right opposite the super tree grove.

The light shows in the evening are well worth the wait ! Absolutely incredible to see, get a spot early as the lawn fills up with everyone sitting down and waiting for it to start.
Times of the shows are 7.45pm / 8.45pm last around 15 mins.

Some lovely things in the gift shops.

After the light shows it gets very busy with everyone trying to leave and get taxis
Either leave a bit early or wait for the lines to clear up. I managed to book a grab taxi instead of waiting in the line for a taxi which was about a 30 min wait.

Gardens by the bay is very beautiful. It has a flower dome and cloud forest which is filled with beautiful flowers. It even has a waterfall view. Gardens by the bay has an awesome lights show at night. There are lots of places inside for food and also a children's garden park.

I visited both the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome and spent more than 4 hours across both domes. There is so much to see and experience - and completely in awe with every view. I went on Saturday which was very very busy and sometimes hard to maneuver given all the crowds taking pictures. I exited and got a return hand stamp and came back just before it closed. It was nice to have the place to myself!

Tip: Go during the day and stay until the sun sets. The dome completely changes from a beautiful sparkly jewel box to a futuristically lit terrarium.

This is one of the places, which quite a few people visiting Singapore do not really know about. There are some lit up Avatar trees with a musical light show and is free of cost, which can be appreciated by watching the show by lying on the ground, literally by sleeping on the ground. One should experience this and then go watch the fountain and laser show besides, on the bay front, about 15 min walk from there. There are a couple of in house gardens for which the tickets need to be bought.
Stunning place to visit. Saw at several times of the day and spent many hours there and still didn‚Äôt see it all

I have been to Gardens by the Bay both during the daytime and at night and I must say, I prefer to be there at night. It is prettier as it is all lit up and also way cooler if you want to be wandering around. Do be prepared for the crowds. we Grab there and just to get in took us a good 15 minutes as it was packed. Mind you, it was on a Saturday night. Once you are in there, it is easy. The shows wee fabulous and if possible, I do recommend trying to catch it at least once.

REVIEW_TITLE: ‚Ä¢ Such a waste of time and money
REVIEW_BODY:
Following friends recommendations and general tourism blogs recommendations
I decided to go to the gardens by the bay.
I must say that I had my doubt about the price but nevertheless I decided to go for it with an open mind.

It was just a waste of time and money! There is nothing special about the attraction. It over price and similar plantation can be found in other gardens around the world.

Also, it is hard not to be cynical about the pro-environmentalist video they show at the exit from the cloud forest.
The environmental costs of such a project (garden by the bay) are probably very high.

we went to 2 domes, the cloud forest and the flower dome. Both domes can be cold so be prepare to bring a light coat just to protect from the cold.
It depends what you are interested it. The cloud forest has a water fall and you can walk up to see the forest from the top. The queue to the lift can take time as it gets crowded.
The flower dome has so many beautiful flowers to see from many parts of the world. Its flat and not any high altitude as in the forest domes.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens By the Bay by day and night
REVIEW_BODY:
Well didn't expect to spend so long here, 3 - 4 hrs.
To enter both domes was $28 SGD each but well and truly worth it.
Reccomend going in around midday to escape the heat as the domes are temperature controlled.
Midweek is not that busy at all.
Absolutely beautiful floral displays and crafted wood carvings.
Went to The Barrage after which is interesting on it's own, but then came back to the gardens for the amazing light show at 7.45pm.
Get there early for that as very popular!!

REVIEW_TITLE: Put it on you list to visit when in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
One of a kind with great design and atmosphere. Feels like you been transported to another world.

I would recommend one takes a jacket as it can get cold as the whole indoor space is air-conditioned and it felt like it was under 20 degrees in there.

Highly recommended.

Very well worth a visit. Loved it that the gardens themselves are free, there were lots of families with young children just wandering around and enjoying the gardens.

The Skywalk is worth doing for the view, S$8 isn't too much for those amazing views.
We were fortunate to visit on the last day of the Orchard Show. Really spectacular! The free light show in the evening made it a truly memorable experience.

This is a large park set on "reclaimed land", which contains a series of themed gardens from various countries. It also contains two 'biodomes' and the "Giant Tree Grove". The gardens themselves can be enjoyed without paying an entrance fee and make for a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of Singapore City. The gardens are very natural, with evidence of local wildlife starting to take advantage of this relatively new environment. These gardens also offer good views of Singapore City and "Marina Bay".

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous evening topped off with the Super Trees Light Show
REVIEW_BODY:
My son and I enjoyed a wonderful evening walking around this area, admiring the various displays. It was extremely crowded, but we did expect this. We paid to enter the two domes, however, the queue for the walkway in the Cloud Forest was so huge, we didn‚Äôt bother lining up. We had some good photo opportunities though.

We went for dinner at the nearby Satay by the Bay before returning for the super trees light show. Simply amazing and something for all ages.

A must see for all visitors to Singapore.

Very attractive and beautiful bay area. Visit all the three domes. Full of green trees colours, smells. And all is airconditioned!. Take 4 to 5 hours. Outside gardens are also extremely attractive. Don not forget to visit OCBC skyway!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must go place in SIngapore
REVIEW_BODY: Its a beautiful place, a must go place when u r in Singapore. Its brightly lit up at night, very colourful and beautiful.
If you are in Singapore you must visit the Gardens which are truly magnificent. The cloud forest and flower dome were excellent. Would recommend to others who visit Singapore

Absolutely stunning, loved the part of our trip. Definitely worth a visit. Worth checking when they are doing maintenance in the domes as we first went on a day that the cloud dome was shut so we replanned our days and went back again when both were open
This is a must do while in Singapore, the gardens are beautiful and definitely worth seeing It is a really easy and lovely walk from Marina Bay sands. Highly recommend

Stunning, amazing and beautiful manmade flora and fauna gardens.
Definitely will come again with family.

Hope management will consider to built moderate eco freindly prayer room for muslim tourists in the future.

If your into gardening you will love this, and it is beautiful and some of the displays are fantastic but after a while it gets a little boring.

Glad I‚Äôve done it, wouldn‚Äôt do it again. Did get some good photos though
Beautiful place.must visit in the evening.light and sound show around 8pm is a must.everything is so organised.its a paradise
Best place to visit. You will really invite your friends to see the place. Food there also excellent. No doubt is a charming place in Singapore.

We did the floral fantasy, which has the 4d film. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the gardens. The whole area is very pleasant to wander around. We were disappointed that the cloud forest was closed for maintenance the day we went.
The gardens were nice but it had an artificial feel. My husband and I preferred the Botanical Gardens which has a more nature feel.

The gardens themselves (without paying to go inside the domes) was spectacular in itself, but we still did go into Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. There's a 3rd, but we only wanted to do 2 of them and was told that if we only picked 2, it was these 2 that we could only do (I assume because the 3rd dome was further out). You can pick all 3 in a package which comes with a free ride on the golf buggy.
We got there nice and early on a Monday and had breakfast there, before starting out. We did Cloud Forest first and found the dome nice and quiet - only a handful of other visitors. The place is so big, you don't really get in each other's way anyway. Bear in mind that the domes are climate controlled and it was very cool in both of them. The Cloud Forest begins with a misty waterfall, before you walk around and head up to the overhead walkway. The views around the gardens and outside through the dome windows were really cool. With the 2 kids, it took us about 40 minutes to complete the dome.
Flower dome is located next to Cloud forest and when we entered about 10.30, it was very busy. The dome is broken up into different regions of the world and is very colourful, but I didn't find it as fun as I'm not a green thumb. There were plenty of colourful photo opportunities, but as it was very busy, it was a case of waiting for your turn, or waiting for the crowd to stop walking through.
The park and the domes are very wheelchair and pram friendly - we didn't have a stroller, but noticed all the ramp and elevator options.
Once we were done, we left by walking to the MRT station. It takes about 10 minutes (adult walk) and you get to walk through those gigantic trees you can see from afar. There's also a great opportunity to take photos of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and the Singapore Flyer.

The gardens by the bay are a must visit for all ages with so many plants and micro climates in the two domes an amazing sight to see allow for the whole day to visit there or do it in two half day sessions.

We had heard so much about this so decided to visit before we left Singapore. It was beautiful we would recommend visiting at night as they have a light up section in the middle and they do shows to music twice a night. 7.45 and 8.45. it is free to get in so don't be conned into thinking you have to pay. If you would like to visit the 2 flower domes, this is when you have to pay. Show was amazing very pretty and well worth a visit!

REVIEW_TITLE: The Cloud Forest garden was absolutely spectacular.
REVIEW_BODY: If you have any interest in gardens and plants, this is somewhere not to be missed, the views looking at the 'mountain' of plants and through the glass dome toward the surrounding gardens and city are spectacular. We were more impressed with the Cloud Forrest dome than the Flower Dome, so if you get tickets to both, go to the Flower Dome first.
