Do not try to do it all in one day: go and walk bait one hour before sunset and stay to see the lights and water/ light show. you can see both at the same time.
Next day go during the day and plan to spend 1/2 day to see the cloud forest, walk on the trees and visit the botanical garden.

I had seen Gardens by the Bay in daylight and this time I saw the light show at night. It was breathtaking, colourful, music üé∂ to compliment the flashing, running colourful lights. A Wonderous sight to witness. Mesmerising. Thanks to ALL.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful and well maintained place to hangout
REVIEW_BODY:
Main garden area doesn't have any entry fee, however, special attractions as cloud forest and flower dome require tickets. Entire garden is very beautiful and petfectly maintained. Best time to go is early evening so that you can watch the free light show by the supratree. Be prapared to walk a lot if you want to cover the whole garden area, and carry a water bottle to keep you hydrated.
Nearest mrt: Bayfront
Pictures taken of the light show
Well worth a vist to this place there are many plants from all over the world. Access to the areas within the garden is good.

Loved this place, well worth a look if you are in Singapore. The restaurant is a little pricey but there is a McDonalds there as well so take your pick.
I thought it was going to be a hot house in there, and Singapore is hot enough, but when we walked in it was surprisingly very pleasantly cool, compared to outside. Lovely spot.

REVIEW_TITLE: Floral Fantasy special exhibit was wondrous
REVIEW_BODY: Well worth a visit. The special floral fantasy exhibit was wonderfully done. (Note you have to get tickets to a specific time of entry, so allow for that.) Must see inside the dome buildings. The autumn lantern festival was going on while we were there so we planned afternoon/evening visit to catch the super tree light show and lantern walk after dark. Easy to get to via public transportation and just across the street from the Marina Sands complex.

REVIEW_TITLE: Two air-conditioned domes let you blessedly beat the heat
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay includes two massive and blessedly air-conditioned greenhouses. The Cloud Forest simulates cool and moist mountain conditions, centered around an artificial mountain planted with flowers and ferns, from which cascades a 115-foot waterfall. After an elevator ride to the top, shrouded in artificial clouds, you walk down a series of ramps to the bottom.

The other greenhouse, the Flower Dome, is a riot of blooming color, with azaleas the main current attraction. Most of the plants are Mediterranean and sub-tropical, and there is a Chinese garden decked out for the New Year. Lots of interesting sculptures, too.

A must! Crazy rich Asians. Wait for the show which last for 20-30 minutes. To reach there is a bit of long walk but worth it. Near the Marina bay sands and gluttons bay and also Merlion which are mainly best spots in Singapore.

Gardens by the Bay is an amazing day out that triggers all your senses. Take the free trip around the bay and you will then know the order of gardens to visit. The staff usually provide helpful advice. You will need most of the day so take a lunch break at the Marina Sands hotel.

It's a really cool place to walk around and read if you have a long layover. There are nice shadows and lots of greenery around.
But if you plan to visit all the attractions around prepare your wallet because are quite expensive!
Loved Gardens by the bay so much we went back at night time also...a must do for every person who visits Singapore.

Fabulous floral experience. The Flower Dome and Cloud Forest were truly magical. They transported us into wonderlands of botanical landscapes along with all the quirky sculptures and architectural features. Do not miss.

It was a nice and clean place. Very fresh feeling and i love it.
Singapore really a very creative and always very up to date in every ways.
Without doubt this is a must do while in Singapore. Even if you are not a plant lover, like myself, you will be amazed by everything to see. Also a great opportunity to get some relief from the heat

We were blown away by the splendour of these gardens...pictures just don't do them justice. Who knew there were so many varieties of Orchids and that they have a smell üòâ. The night time light show is also a must see.
This is a must see for any visitor. The sound and light show at night is a is spectacular and well worth the visit

It is an enchanting and lively garden. Don't rush here; look at nature from all angles. People taking selfies may be an obstruction to your enjoyment of the plants and flowers. If you are taking photos, also take photos of the plaques. It will help you remember and identify the plants once you get home.
It‚Äôs almost pointless writing a review. If you go to Singapore you include Gardens By The Bay. It‚Äôs always going to be breathtaking, all you can hope for is minimal crowds.
This show is amazing. It is daily at 7:45 and then is another at 8:45. It is good to lay down and check it just in the middle of the gardens
Very impressed about Supertree I have never seen anything like this. The dome garden is made me feel like being in paradises.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing views, entry free, good place to take pictures
REVIEW_BODY: You can visit here at night or day, both times have a different feeling. In the night they have light shows and in the early morning its looks like just tall trees of Avtar movie.
I would recommend a night visit to get the full effect, at 20.45hrs there is a light and music show, which lasts 15 mins and worth a watch

Wow,absolutely spectacular,even our 11 year old was blown away by how amazing it was. Friends had said must visit it,and not been the biggest botanic garden people we weren‚Äôt sure what it was like. We went twice in one day first early in the day before to hot and crowded,then in evening for last night of lantern festival and also to see the light show. The gardens are like nothing else we‚Äôve ever seen

A mesmerising light show set to classical music in the heart of Singapore. Not to be missed. Book and go early to enjoy the elevated walkway. The night show finishes late and there will be a crush for taxis, but order does prevail.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the visit. Visit early and come back at night.
REVIEW_BODY:
I visited the park early afternoon when it was not crowded and stayed till the light show. I had too much time but I was too tired to go somewhere else to kill the time. If your stay is nearby, I recommend an early visit to the floral attractions "Floral Fantasy", "Flower Dome" & "Cloud Forest". There is a bundle ticket for all 3 with shuttle service. Start with Floral Fantasy and take the shuttle to the other 2, and than come back with the shuttle for the light.
The garden itself is free to enter, but it is worth buying the bundle ticket.
After 4 o'clock there were waiting lines to all the attractions and I think you enjoy less with all the people inside.

It's a beautiful placeÔºÅ
Especially the waterfall was great.
I got a postcard when I showed a map that was distributed free of charge at the airport.

REVIEW_TITLE: Light show at bay of gardens
REVIEW_BODY: The show at night with all the bay of gardens lighting up is truly amazing. Recommend being on skywalk at time of show absolutely truly amazing. I just sat on the skywalk in awe as I watched the show, from the music to the lightshow it all goes perfectly together showing off singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great light show but much more!
REVIEW_BODY: The gardens have three attractions worth visiting, the Flower Dome, the Cloud Forest and the light show. There is more to this attraction but these are three very good reasons to go along. All three of the attractions have amazing wow factors, well worth the time to visit. Good value for money.
Absolutely beautiful! Defo worth a visit if going to Singapore, staff were helpful as well. Lots of different domes to visit and all worth it. Very well maintained.

REVIEW_TITLE: Pros and Cons of day and night visit
REVIEW_BODY:
Our tour included the option of the cloud visit or the gardens by the bay dome. Our guide said the waterfall at Singapore Airport was better than that in the cloud dome and unless you were interested in climate change the more ‚ÄòInstagram friendly pics‚Äô would be in the gardens dome. Needless to say I think most of the tour party opted for the garden option.
The subtle and elegant lighting made it look like a wonderful fairy grotto but in all honesty if you really want to see the Flora I think a day time well lit option might be better. That said the advantage of the evening if the wonderful light show outside to music. The treetop walk amongst the structures looked very exciting and would be great for photos so one to explore for a return trip I think

What originally was going to be an hour or so planned to visit we left 3.5 hours later. This was phenomenal. The gardens were breathtaking. The waterfall was amazing and you could see people having fun getting a little bit damp if they got too close. We saw some amazing artwork and things we didn‚Äôt expect to see. There are three main different attractions to purchase tickets to see; the Flower Dome, the Cloud Forest and the Floral Fantasy but we ran out of time to see the Floral Fantasy. If you want to see everything there is to see get there early as it will take longer than you expect as there is so much to see, read about and interact with. This is great for all ages and I would highly recommend a visit and it is wheelchair assessable.

Another (physically) cool place to visit. Interesting flora from around world with some new learning points. It must take the caretakers an enormous effort for the upkeep- kudos for them - and don‚Äôt touch the plants - ok üëç?

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful during the day and night
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely to wander around during the day admiring the gardens, sculptures and giant plant like triffids that light up at night. Great facilities within the park too and easy walking distance from MBS hotel.
Amazing place with man-made lighting trees. Beautiful light & sound in the evening. Great place to visit.

I was with my family at Gardens by the Bay. It is definitely worthy to buy tickets and take time to visit. We went to Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. The flowers and trees from all different part of the world are very therapeutic and relaxing.

I do agree is a good sightseeing spot of Singapore! and we had a great time for a whole day together.

What an incredible place! The first show started shortly after sundown. It was bit crowded so finding a perfect place to put my tripod to take photos was challenging. If you want to try to take photos with your dslr camera/tripod, you may want to just watch the 1st show to scout out a location to take the pictures during the second show. The 2nd show was less crowded.

The first two photos were taken in the grove. The next two were taken up the walkway by the water. Nice photos with water in the foreground.
Enjoyed a walk around these iconic gardens, as a antidote to the concrete jungle of downtown, great for a casual and hardcore garden fans alike

REVIEW_TITLE: The Night Show is a MUST
REVIEW_BODY: You must attend the daily night show, but get there early for the first show. Also, if you are early enough you can get a spot on the bridge that connect the live trees.

REVIEW_TITLE: Simply Spectacularly Brilliant Concept Of Indoor Garden!
REVIEW_BODY:
Must be very hard to maintain and regulate temperature in such a large indoor garden and we were very fortunate to be there in March this year and saw the Japanese Sakura cherry blossoms in bloom!

Apparently they have different themes of plants and flowers throughout the year and even have tulips at some point!

There is a caf√© inside which one can have food and drinks in the relaxing set up.

Overall very impressed and we really enjoyed spending three hours here.

Really recommend for family and friends to visit and worthwhile to check on the website for whatever themes that they have throughout the year.

Wow... the gardens are exquisite! This is a must see for tourists, and the artwork and attention to detail are definitely worth a visit!!

It‚Äôs $28 per adult, to see two features, which at the time seemed steep, but it was well worth it in the end. The gardens are beautiful.

Be aware for people who are afraid of heights, the waterfall area is pretty challenging.

The Singaporeans never cease to amaze. The concept and execution of this project is truly amazing. Even the heat and humidity can't detract from the amazing experience that a visit to this attraction offers..

This was my 2nd time to visit Garden by the bay.

I went to SG at the 1st time in 2015 and visited Garden by the Bay. Now came back on Aug 2019, It‚Äôs still a good place to visit as beautiful garden must visit in Singapore.

Recommend to go to Garden by the bay in the evening then you can enjoy their beautiful with the Light show in Garden.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful show and wonderful music. Highly recommend
REVIEW_BODY: We thoroughly enjoyed the night light show. It was spectacular laying on a bench under the trees enjoying the lights and beautiful music. Highly recommend. Especially since it is such an easy MRT ride to get there.

Gardens by the Bay was fantastic. We was twice there - once during the day and once at night. Both was great. Floral Fantasy was amazing! The 4D cinema there too. The skywalk was also very impressive and the Garden Rhapsody Show is great to see. The easiest way to go around is by bus. It is cheap and you are fast at another point of the garden.

This place is absolutely stunning.!

A must place to visit when in Singapore. The conservatories are worth the admission price and the ‚ÄòCloud Forest‚Äô conservatory is a particular highlight. I would also recommend the small extra charge to view the gardens from the ‚ÄòSkywalk‚Äô where you not only get to view the gardens but you also get a great view across the Singapore skyline.

A real gem and eye opener, really enjoyable visit.

The Flower Dome and Cloud forest are very very beautiful and mesmerising places!! The beauty of nature is just breathtaking!
Do take the stamp at the exit for re-entry to the Domes, re-entry is allowed with the stamp, multiple times on the same day!
Brillant place to bring your family to. Food and drinks are easily available too. Atms are available if you need cash on hand and kids will enjoy the kids area. Be sure to bring their swimwear too.

Make sure to be there few hours before the closing time. We were late and had to go through the gardens in a hurry. Couldn't take the skywalk unfortunately. Other than that it was an amazing experience.
Loved the gardens, especially at night. Two free music and light shows per night. You can walk through the park for free, however, crossing the bridge, and entering domes requires a fee.

One of the fantastic places i have ever visited. Loved it. Totally. Make sure to be there few hours before the closing time. We were late and had to go through the gardens in a hurry. Couldn't take the skywalk unfortunately. Other than that it was an amazing experience.

The Super Trees are there, and a light show occurs in that area at 7:45 pm. For the attractions tickets if you have a Singapore airlines reservation coming up, and can show proof, and if you are a senior citizen, and bring your passport to show proof of age, you can get discounts on the tickets.

Singapore was our entering point to Southeast Asia for 23 days of adventure. We arrived at Gardens by the Bay sometime after dark.

Lots of crowds, but everyone was very amiable.

There are stunning sculptures everywhere - underfoot, overhead and randomly situated for all to encounter, and lots of interactive installations.

The Gardens feature light shows with music for people of all ages.

A nice taste of Fantasyland.

Visited Gardens by the Bay several times while in Singapore because they were close to where we were staying. I think the term Gardens by the Bay refers to the gardens and the tree structures but may also include the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome, each housed in their own separate very large Greenhouse - I have reviewed these separately. The tree structures are very impressive in the style of something from Avatar the movie. They are much more impressive at night when they are lit up and there is a twice nightly light show set to music. It's a surreal and futuristic experience. There is a walkway between the two 'supertrees' for which there is a small charge. We found it difficult to plan ahead to do the walkway because we were given contradictory information by ticket staff which meant we made two fruitless attempts to get tickets for a specified time. Best advice is just to turn up when you want to do the walkway and wait your turn. Definitely an attraction not to be missed when visiting Singapore.
This was a first class experience. The whole event was an amazing experience. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. The light show was fantastic as was the tour round the gardens.

We got a taxi when we first arrived to the Gardens by the bay and fed our faces in McDonalds before going in. It was the most magnificent array of flora and forna I have ever seen, the orchid festival was on when we visited and well worth the the 28 dollars we paid. I have been to the Eden Project but this is bigger and better by far. Mind blowing is my opinion but for the full effect it should be done on a night.

We saved this attraction for our last night in Singapore and were not disappointed. The extra charge for the OBC walkway was worth it. The light show was one of the best I have seen, and was better that that of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.

This place is amazing. I only had time to see the the trees and the flower dome. Even seeing those few hours were worth it. The orchids in the flower dome were some of the most beautiful flowers I have ever seen. I went during the day and then again at night for the light show. Don‚Äôt miss the true gem of Singapore.
This attraction has great views, plants and statues! Although a little expensive to get into each dome!

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit by day and by night
REVIEW_BODY: In the day it is breathtaking and tranquil, by night it is hmimg with people and life. Come early to get a position, bring a blanket or something to sit on.. And all for freeeeee but do fork out money just $8 for the treetop walk

REVIEW_TITLE: It is nice but certainly not the no1 location in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I went to the flower garden and cloud forest for $28 and while it was nice it didn‚Äôt really blow me away, certainly not an essential stop to make during your visit to Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome must see attraction in Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely beautiful gardens, displaying flowers, plants and waterfalls. Truly the best attraction in Singapore. These are gardens like you will not experience anywhere in the world. Very impressed with the amount of time and effort that goes into all the gardens.

Stunning architectural ‚Äòsupertrees‚Äô with a ‚Äòtreetop‚Äô walkway between some ($8). Lovely garden around, although we preferred the Singapore Botanic Garden. Plenty of food options available, plus you get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

We spent about six hours here and it was a wonderful experience.
A bit like the Eden project but all air conditioned! So very comfortable being out of the intense heat. There is a lot of walking, we did so from the mall near the sands, without realising how far it was with little shade. Surprised they didn‚Äôt think about that!!
We ate lunch in the food centre but to be honest it was tasteless.
The waterfall dome was something or nothing sure they could have made more of it.
Perhaps should visit in the dark, with all the flowers lit up.

REVIEW_TITLE: Free to enter and worth a couple of hours
REVIEW_BODY: Lovely gardens by the bay, with green entry, excellent paths, clear signage and great views. You need to pay to do the high level walk $8, but worth it for the perspective and $23 for the two domes (also very worthwhile), but the basic garden entry is free and I really enjoyed it.

We went mid-afternoon and stayed as it went dark to see the light show on the 'Trees' which was fabulous. It wasn't too busy in the two domes either. Food places not so good - chicken/noodle dish was cold and mostly bone and skin, but the soup was hot and tasty
If you have a few hours free, you really shoud visit the flower and cloud domes at gardens by the bay. They are very special
Wonderful place, you really get a sense of Singapore's commitment to ecology. The gardens are free to enter and enjoy as opposed to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome.

best place to go to to see a wide variety of floras and succulents. place is fully air conditioned, thus good to plan this in the afternoon so you can avoid the afternoon heat during your day out.

place has 2 areas, the cloud forest and flower dome. just buy both of them :)

this place host several endangered species and if you in luck, you see them blooming.

also check on their websites as they do have seasonal events. do not miss the sakura event, but expect 100% more crowded the usual crowd.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of Crazy Rich Asians filming locations in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens By The Bay is a vast waterfront park comprising of three main gardens and two plant conservatories. Here, you‚Äôll find one of the best botanic experiences in the country. Lush flora and fauna can be found everywhere, even the supertrees, which have over 162,900 plants of more than 200 species growing up their trunks. Be sure to catch their dazzling light shows (Garden Rhapsody) daily at 7.45pm and 8.45pm (lasts for 15 minutes)

Very impressed with the layout and my ticket purchased in the UK included the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. I'm not green fingered but the colour on display throughout the displays were fantastic. The price paid was also reasonable.

Like most things in Singapore the gardens are well worth a visit
Located right behind the Marina Bay Sands one can spend hours exploring these wonderful gardens. Not to be missed
Start with the floral fantasy and the 4D movie giving a great overview of the gardens before you tour. Definitely worth getting all the tickets
Our family visited this garden, although the ticket fare is expensive but we like we go. The gardens are collections of many different kinds tropical trees, very good for kids to learn about them.
A superb place to visit, Such a beautiful garden in the middle of the city. Beautifully made. Will surely visit again
Night walk by the huge trees. Light show was amazing and the fall festival decorations are very nice.
You must visit this place! It‚Äòs really awesome! It‚Äòs for singles, parents, everyone! Light shows ecery night! Just sit down and enjoy it. Visit this place only in the night!

After visiting gardens by the bay last time we were in Singapore there was no way we were going to come back to singapore and not go again. Last time we visited the cloud forest wasn‚Äôt open so went with the intentions of just seeing that however we ended up buying a bundle which included the cloud forest, flower dome and a special event they had on called floral fantasy. The flower dome had a special orchard installation that wasn‚Äôt on last time which I really enjoyed. The cloud forest was interesting (I‚Äôm not a massive fan of heights) but the highlight was the floral fantasy. Day or night I would definitely recommend a visit to gardens by the bay!
The new floral fantasy is great! The setting is really nice and my kid likes the 4D ride a lot as well.

It was amazing place.. Its painted very well & variety of flowers are very good.. there is 2 dome.. Flower & rain forest.. flower dome is very very nice.. i never see this type of things any other place.. they have maintenance day 1 day in a month.. so please check the day before book ticket.. night show is also good..

One of Singapore's best tourist attractions. Extremely well done and so interesting. The flowers are just stunning and so beautiful. All the exhibitions are great. Allow at least 2 to 3 hours to see everything. The exhibition halls are also air conditioned, making it a great place to visit!

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit Garden by Bay while in Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY:
Garden by Bay is one of the most amazing place to visit while in Singapore. The place is full of beautiful flowers most of which one does not see in any other Garden.
The artificial rain is also one of the major attractions over there. The best time to visit is evening hours when one can see the lights also.

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoy the walk up the Garden Path
REVIEW_BODY: Allow plenty of time to meander around this wonderful place with lots of different 'pockets' to explore in this magnificent garden creation. Families, single people, old people and young, school groups .... all seemed to be enjoying this space.

REVIEW_TITLE: Special displays during mid-autumn moon festival
REVIEW_BODY: Be sure to check the time for the light shows at night and get there early. Although it took us a while to find the spot and too bad we missed 1/2 of the show, we still think it was worth going.

Really wasn‚Äôt a fan, found it very over crowded. A stupid process for the sky walk I had purchased tix at 5.50 I asked ref girl if I Ching get an allocated time she said no you don‚Äôt need a time can go whenever, I said we wanted to go at 7.30 she said yes fine just come when ready, so we line up yo be told no you need to get an allocated time which was now only available after 8pm..... with 2 kids in tow we couldn‚Äôt hang around in the large crowds so asked for a refund which took another 40mins! The show was quiet underwhelming

It is like a zoo for plants, they show you plants of all over the world and is super nice to visit. They have a water fall inside that is super nice. I recommend, great place to bring your kids. I loved the visit.

Supertree Grove is an amazing place after dark. The light show commences at 7:45pm and 8:45pm and goes for 15 minutes. It gets busy but there are so many trees to view to spread the people out. It's also free to attend and a must see place in Singapore. The Bayfront MRT station is close and the easiest way to attend.
Beautiful indoor garden can't imagine how its even possible to build a miracle indoor... worth the money and time...
Fantastic place to see , felt the real important of saving plants , kids , elder will enjoy for sure

With a mordern City like Singapore we did not expect this. Garden by the bay located right in the city center. Very close to the Marina sand bay . Come here we can just spend time walk around the garden. Looking over the river.Or we can just lay down on the grass. The Cloud Forest and Flower Dorm was also woth checking out .
Worth the walk with comfy shoes and a bottle of water. On site cafe had great reasonable food. For a few, you can tour gardens by small trolley.

Spent the evening here and found the gardens and lights amazing The Chinese autumn festival was very interesting with lots of lights and people carrying lanterns Views from the budge outstanding A must see on a visit to Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to spend several hours..
REVIEW_BODY: As many people have already said... we don,t do gardens, but this was amazing.. well set out, bright and beautiful.. well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: The Must Do Thing in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: No One in the world visiting Singapore should miss this 8th Man Made Wonder of the world, the evening shows which take place at 7:45 and 8:45. The light show and story telling within the show are translatable into any language or society beautifully told and had all of the audience captivated, do not deny yourself the opportunity to see this

REVIEW_TITLE: A delightful evening at the Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must go if you visit Singapore. The perfect design and structure of the building host thousands of visitors from all over the world. It‚Äôs very interesting to see the gardens from the top floor with a panoramic view of the Financial District. The exotic flowers and ga den design is breathtaking. It‚Äôs good for the spirit to see the waterfall and walk around the whole day. At night it looks stunning! Highly recommended!

I am not a particular 'Green Thumb' but thoroughly enjoyed my visit here
Such a variety of colours and fragrance made it a complete package
Visit

We don‚Äôt normally do gardens but was highly recommended Gardens in the bay and it was fantastic. Even our daughter loves it. The attractions were all accessible by wheelchair so we could all enjoy. I loved the sky walk way between the trees and the cloud dome. As with all of Singapore very clean and great people to guide you.

I was so happy & thankful that I decided to view GBTB Cloud Forest & Flower Dome. For nature & flower lovers, this is it! Mini paradise in an urban area. Great exposure & educational trip for my kids. Part of the wonders of such a tiny country!
I've been here before, and even a second time it's just so much fun. Great walking around, lively fun for a date and absolutely beautiful structure and flora.

The gardens are truly something spectacular. The basic entry is $25, but you can get access to other parts as well with purchase of additional tickets. I only did the 2 domes and found this to be sufficient for me.

Definitely worth spending a couple of hours at!

It is recommended that you go at least 10 to 20 minutes before the Show. It's a beautiful show. Highly recommended. The show is free and the two domes are paid. I think the dome does not need to see it.
Very well done and worth the visit. Reminded me of the Eden Project. Be prepared for an information ocerload.

REVIEW_TITLE: So beautiful and an amazing show of diversity
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see for so many reasons, please don't miss it if you come to Singapore. From Cactus to Orchids

REVIEW_TITLE: Great way to spend time in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: A very hot day forecast so we went here to see the orchids and other features in the morning. It was fantastic, colour everywhere, wooden sculptures, a real credit to those who set up the Gardens by the Bay. The cloud forest, while not as eye catching, was also enjoyable. We returned to Singapore city via the MRT, easy to use and were very pleased we had visited..

REVIEW_TITLE: The light show is a must
REVIEW_BODY: The light show at Gardens by the Bay happened at both 7:45 and 8:45 while we were visiting. We went to each time slot on different nights. It was quite packed at both times. Head to the largest tree at least 10 minutes before start time as it is the center of the show. It is best viewed lying on the ground looking up (everyone does it). Don‚Äôt be tempted to view from the skywalk as there are lights underneath the walk that you will miss. The show goes for at least 15 minutes and is a great thing for young and old. You could watch the 8 o‚Äôclock light show in front of The Shoppes at Marina Bay and then walk over for the 8:45 Gardens light show.

Apart from the domes being such a cool relief from the outside humidity they are so beautifully set up in both colour and themes. Great place for kids as well as elderly as easy to walk around. Waterfall was fabulous from the top level or from the bottom.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay: Must See
REVIEW_BODY: You can find a lot online about this iconic attraction. I bought the tickets for the main spheres along with the team ride through the park. Both highly recommended.

It's a simple review...
Stunning..magnificent.amazing. do not miss it...
Make sure you visit the new dome and experience the 4D cinema strap in and be amazed at the full gardens journey...
Allow 3_4 hours to really enjoy the gardens

I read one needs 4 hours and I did it in 2 but raced through the forest cloud dome and the flower dome, so I will need to return. The light show was magical, including the lanterns as it was Autumn Festival. The park is huge and spread out so a lot of walking is required. Loved it ‚ù§Ô∏è

Do not miss this attraction if you are in singapore. Suggest to visit this place in afternoon so that you can enjoy the free light show at 7:45 and 8:45pm. There are three main attractions: cloud forest, flower dome and super tree. I liked the cloud forest most.
In Singapore gardens by the bay is one of the biggest garden in Singapore such a lovely weather out there I totally enjoyed it ...great structure built

Gardens by the Bay is a beautifully impressive example of Singaporean innovation and attention to detail. Strolling across from Marina Bay Sands via the dedicated walkway is an experience in itself. The views differ by day and by night, worth a repeat visit to experience each.

We only had 3 days in Singapore (as a stop over) and we soent nearly a whole day at Gardens by the Bay and the skywalk. It was very interesting and I really recommend a trip to it. Our favourite part was the Cloud Forest Dome (opposed to the flower dome) as it was so different to anything we had experienced before. There were multiple levels to walk around and a massive waterfall to marvel at. I especially liked at how at the end of the walk round, there was a whole section on protecting the environment and climate change to start educating people from a young age.
Also the Flower Dome was very pretty and interesting to see. In both we were pleasantly suprised with the temperature (around 25¬∞c in them both with was lovely compared to outside). Very easy to access via the tube by Marina Bay shopping centre.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful way to spend a few hours being delighted
REVIEW_BODY: Both the Flower and Rainforest gardens are exquisite, what an incredible exhibition of all that the world has to offer in nature. I also enjoyed the Music Rhapsody in the evening. Where else could you lie on the ground and look up through the 'manmade' trees and listen to a lovely array of music.

This was one of the highlights of my trip to singapore. The Flower Dome is beautiful with its many gardens and floral displays, but the true highlight is the Cloud Forest. It is simply unbelievable. The lantern display for mid autumn festival was also cool to see, and the super tree grove with its light show was neat. Lots of shopping and dining options on site as well.
Shockingly neat and breathtaking collection of nature rearranged in engineering perfection! Felt as if in a different world!

REVIEW_TITLE: Had an event at the garden hall
REVIEW_BODY: Really beautiful place and I enjoyed the experience very much as a guest of the event. Guests could come earlier and enjoy the flower garden before the event too!
Beautiful garden. Its breath taking. Just a little pricey to go in the domes. The garden is family friendly. Its a must to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Don‚Äôt miss this when in SG
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud forest and flower dome is very nice. Plus during hot weathers it is fully air conditioned. It‚Äôs a nice experience walking around. Maybe come in the morning for less crowd. It‚Äôs beautiful inside plus the lot show in the evening.
After reading about this we felt we should go. Was o we fast but pleased we went , handy hint walk out Onto main road for taxi or leave a few minutes early the cues for taxis are huge

I come back here during every trip to Singapore because it is so beautiful and there is so much to admire.
As a real nature lover I am very selective and critical about places that are people-made but I love the way Singapore has a way of combining man-made structures with nature. They know how to combine the beauty of nature and it is so important on an island that is virtually a city to make space for nature where one can enjoy the beauty while having the comforts and conveniences of modern technology. It is a must-see for anyone visiting Singapore. Prepare to spend the entire day here and wear good walking shoes, as there is a lot to see, with both the cloud forest and the floral gardens, where it is nice and cool. If you are able to come during the week or at least Saturday instead of Sunday you would be wise to do so as it does get crowded. Although it is big enough you can get away from crowds (at least in the outdoor part) for a while.

the views are so amazing here. We booked a tour and the guide brought us round the area and explained the trees and the archicteuure and even took our pictures over looking the trees and the marina bay sands. One of the most picturesque areas in Singapore
We have been before but not at night so just wanted to see the trees lit up .they didnt dissapoint and glad we took the time to do this

This is such a lovely way to spend 2 to 3 hours in Singapore. We loved the cleanliness and lovely plantings. We visited during the daytime but hope to return again in the evening. Our guide told us the property is magical at night and we are looking forward to seeing it!

Im so amazed with the beauty of the place. Its very unusual to me coz firs time i visited inside the garden. Just saw it outside. The view so relaxing and i cant feel thatim bore. So lovely flowers i saw and experience those.

REVIEW_TITLE: Magical tour of 2 fascinating glass houses
REVIEW_BODY: I spent many hours strolling through the flower & succulents & shrubs exhibits taking photos of very diverse plants in the flower dome . The orchid display was very original & extremely colourful. Early Lunch in the restaurant Pollen was very delicious! It was worth spending two hours strolling through Cloud Forest and strolling down the suspended walkways especially during a misting session and watching how plants on the mountain face were attended to by gardeners suspended on ropes.
not much to add - there is so much to read about this - just go and see it yourself - light show 7.45 unmissable

Just takes two hours to see the whole thing but super worth it even if you're not into nature. Everything's just so pretty. The walk inside the conservatories are pleasant coz they're airconditioned. Only go outside in the afternoons coz otherwise you'll melt in the heat.

Love the clean and beautiful place. Nice to take photos and to post in your instagram post!
Basically everywhere is nice here.

This is a free day out for the core areas of the gardens. I would recommend visiting the flower and cloud domes which are also special by you do have to pay for these. The most amazing thing that I would recommend is the night show at the supertree grove. This was wonderful and was my favourite thing of the entire holiday!

I think the outside is prettier than going inside. You can take a subway to get to the Gardens. But you need to purchase another ticket to take a trolley to take you inside the garden. Otherwise, you can walk
Some of the best I‚Äôve ever seen a well designed and serviced complex anyone who loves plants this is better than I‚Äôve ever seen

What a show Singapore puts on üëç we went to the light show it was spectacular, it runs for about 15 minutes and you can watch from the ground or up in the walkways. The next day we did a morning tour to see all the gardens and flowers it totally lived up to my expectations the different types of plants and styles of gardening we just beautiful! This is must while in Singapore especially the Orchard season
The evening show was very enjoyable, this garden is free to enter though there is a charge for the sky-walk (I did not do) some may find it cheesy but chill and enjoy......

Singapore‚Äôs Garden by the Bay has won many accolades and praise for its architecture. We fully expected the highlight to be the Bay‚Äôs buildings, but we were also blown away by the foliage as well. We were pleasantly surprised at the plethora and variety of flowers in these gardens. It‚Äôs a very large space, we recommend a whole day or two set aside for this attraction. If you have time, we recommend that you stay for the light show in the evening. It does get crowded - but that is expected since Gardens by the Bay is such a huge and famous landmark in Singapore. If you are unable to visit all of the attractions, we highly recommend the Supertree Grove & OCBC Skyway, Heritage Garden, and Cloud Forest.
This is impressive enough during the day but at night it comes alive. The light show is amazing.Set to music the colurs are stunning
short walk from Marina the gardens are so tastefully decorated. You have nice walk ways and enjoy the environment. a feeling for nature.

Outstanding place! Must visit! It‚Äôs beautiful and colourful! One should visit both observatories. The cloud forest is mesmerising. Plan the visit post lunch. So that you see around the place and also watch the super tree light up at 7.45 pm
we wanted to see tropical plants and we saw tons. but the weather was super hot. thankfully they have AC haha

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place I have visited so far !!
REVIEW_BODY: It was amazing to see how Singapore has paid attention to industry oriented development and also towards the construction of nature based tourist attractions such as the Gardens by the bay .

Very impressive, in its wholly artificial way. But if you arrive by MRT, you walk along a very broad, very beautiful, passage, to arrive at a steep, narrow, staircase, and a wholly inadequate lift. No escalator, presumably because the Important People who come to be shown around do not arrive by train. But when it is crowded it is positively dangerous. And the signage, esp when you are trying to find your way out at night, is hopelessly bad. Such a shame.
This place was amazing, so many flowers to look at. I really enjoyed here and spent most of the day looking around. Have never seen anything like it before.

REVIEW_TITLE: Allow plenty of time to explore
REVIEW_BODY: Absolutely beautiful gardens and the management deserves much praise and admiration. Even if you choose not to enter the domes, it is well worth a visit and your time.

Marvelous place, wonderful flowers and wide green areas.Lovely water falls.
Must visit if you come to Singapore.

Singapore can get quite warm so the Gardens are a nice respite from the heat. We purchased the combo ticket to see the Cloud Forest, Flower Dome, Supergrove Trees and Sun pavilion. The ticket included being able to do the sky walkway but it was too hot for us. They do say bridge is weather-dependent! They also do allow re-entry as long as you get stamped, so a short walk to Marina Bay Sands is also possible for those looking to have lunch in the area. They offer light snacks at a small cafe and there is a seafood restaurant.

The exhibits are air conditioned so it can get quite cool. Our family went early in the day to avoid the crowds so i would recommend that for those wanting a stress-free visit. But we would definitely go back just to see it at night! A worthwhile visit even for those not interested in gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: An oasis of calm in a bustling city
REVIEW_BODY:
Went for a couple of hours early evening to catch last of the daylight and then the night lights.
Easy access from Bayfront MRT by tunnel and stairs (a lift is available). Sculpture and artwork everywhere, and of course magnificent natural gardens. Captivated by the sound and light show, even though it was quite busy there was an air of calm and tranquility which we loved.
Highly recommended. Free if you don't visit the add-on attractions. Reasonably priced food and drink, by Singapore standards !

A great place to visit.

Im glad I visited... but it was very crowded and overall not that exciting.

Good place to tick off the list....

Wow. What a park. Amazing greenery in the midst of the city. Lots to see. Give enough time in your itinerary(which I didnt sadly). But still enjoyed very much. 2 closed conservatories, Floral Fantasy, Super Tree Grove, lots of outdoor gardens. Great views of the city,Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer. Must see if you are in Singapore. Easily accessible by Bayfront MRT. Also see Light Show at Super Tree Grove every night. You can also walk to Marina Barrage.

We entered from the Bayfront MRT station, which was an easy walk to the entrance. Certainly worth visiting, they are free except for extras such as the Cloud Forest and the Supertree above ground walk. I think to visit after dark would be even more special, I only visited during the day. The grounds were not as extensive as I thought so it was achieveable in a few hours. You can hire wheelchairs for elderly or those who cannot walk around in the heat. There is a nice food hall in the Supertree grove with an excellent variety of foods that were not expensive. Highly recommended.
Just a short walk from the new bayside mrt station. All sorts of plants, sights, and close to Marina Bay Sands and many other attractions.
Flower dome and Cloud forest , you must visit both. Feel the vibe and enjoy the visual party. oh yeah , don't forget to watch the light show on Supertree.
Had a great day out to the domes. Smooth entry and exit to the domes with many beautiful pictures to be taken

Impressive show of lights in complimentary setting.
Everyone there enjoyed the music and colorful lights on the artificially framed trees and plants. It‚Äôs worth the visit but bring some mats to lie on. Being near the sea, it helped that the air was breezy and comfortable.

We were fortunate enough to stay at the Marina Bay Hotel which is connected by a walkway to the gardens by the bay. Because it was very hot and humid we decided to take an early morning walk to the gardens. We had arrived before the ticket office opened so we just strolled through the Gardens public areas. The areas were extremely clean and well manicured, but it got very hot quickly and we returned to the hotel. We were able to see the light show from our room which is not to be missed. It‚Äôs probably even better in person. This is one of those Singapore attractions that I would not miss.
This is a must visit when in Singapore and a nice place to escape from the heat all the plants are amazing
Very busy in the glass domes. The cloud forest was the better of the two. However the highlight is the supertrees lit up at night. A modern wonder! a Must see

We visited gardens by the bay Singapore, what a wonderful place, plenty to see and lots of gift stores to visit. The eateries were all nice & clean, food was affordable and they catered for all tastes if we go back to Singapore we will definatly revisit.

REVIEW_TITLE: What an amzing place...both during the day at in the evenings...
REVIEW_BODY: We visited twice and enjoyed the experience both times. It offers some novel approaches to 'greening up' a city - definitely worth a visit.
I always went there for a morning walks while I was in Singapore. It is nice and quiet. Good varieties of flowers and plants that are indigenous to South East Asia.
Garden by the Bay is superb view and it is amazing. I feel it is heaven. people can spend more time there.

Today I visited Gardens by The Bay for the1st time. The garden is huge & colourful. I booked a ticket for an Audio Tour, a 20-minute tram ride around the outdoors accompanied by informative audio commentary for a full cruising around. The next step is to enjoy the Flower Dome + Cloud Forest with FREE timing. The Supertrees are the first things you will notice when approaching the Gardens. Unfortunately, the OCBC Skyway was closed for maintenance. The Flower Dome was less than what I expected, I could say that the Green Planet in Dubai is far more exciting to see (although smaller) and many comments say that the Botanical gardens of Singapore are more beautiful (I will visit this week). I seem to enjoy the Cloud Forest more; I loved the waterfall, the cooling atmosphere, and being on top of the mountain. You will find SentSational Orchids (event) until 22 September in Cloud Forest, It is a small area though. I will visit the latest attraction at the gardens, Floral Fantasy this week.
SEE photos.

After our last visit eight years ago we were impressed by the way in which all the planting had matured. The whole site is very impressive, even for those who are not horticulturally minded. Access to the outside gardens is free but it is well worth paying the entry charges for the Flowerdome and Rainforest. A trip to the top of the Rainforest with its tumbling waterfall is quite unique and breathtaking. As well as the permanent planting, the Flowerdome mounts a changing number of special exhibitions and displays. During our visit the orchid display was exceptional.
An evening visit is also recommended.

This is an absolute must for everyone to visit when in Singapore. It is so good that you might have to go twice to experience all it offers, once during the day and definitely again at night. A must see!

REVIEW_TITLE: Where nature meets the creative mindsets
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing gardens and well-maintained structures. The towers are equally beautiful in day and night. The lighting and the view from the bridge are stunning.

We went twice to the Gardens during our stay, first day we arrived early and practically had the whole place to ourselves which was lovely but unfortunately the Flower Dome was closed for replanting so we decided to return on another day and instead took a leisurely stroll through these beautiful gardens and also enjoyed the views from the Skywalk, totally worth the cost. A couple of days later we returned around 5pm in the afternoon to see the Flower Dome and Cloud Dome, they are both extraordinary. I think we really lucked out with the Flower Dome, we have never seen such an exquisite display of flowers and exotic orchards before and the Cloud Dome is equally stunning in it‚Äôs soaring grandeur and breathtaking vertical gardens. We had plenty of time to view both domes and then meander down to the Super Tree Food Hall and enjoyed Niigata Bento for dinner. Found a good spot on the grass below the Super Trees and watched the 7:45pm light and music show which was both dazzling and magical. Highly recommend everything about Gardens by the Bay.

REVIEW_TITLE: Never fail to make me fall in love all over again
REVIEW_BODY: If you have one that limited time in Singapore, this is THE place to visit. The Garden by the bay is always flourish, be it day or night. Love all the fresh flowers and plants. Perhaps it is one of the best and well kept garden in the world. NOT to be missed is the FREE light show at the Super Tree.

Pretty good, not great. Then again, I had just came from the Botanical Gardens and the National Orchid Garden.

A bit like comparing apples and oranges, however, still relevant. Free entry into the Botanical Gardens and $5 for the National Orchid Garden. Therefore, some of the costs of the attractions at The Bay, by comparison - seemed expensive.

The cactus garden was nice and was free, however, I was a bit disappointed by the cost of other attractions.

Nevertheless, it was still pretty good.

Relax and unwind
You can not believe how beautiful, how superb the Gardens are.
Anton and Grace gave us a wonderful insight into the world of gardening.

This experience was like no other!! I am lost for words!
Gardens by the Bay were the ultimate. It's certainly a must do when in Singapore!
We spent the whole day here, so much to see and do.
The displays we're just amazing! The colours, designs, ease of access, helpful staff - just brilliant!!
Highly recommend this outing!!
So bright and enjoyable, the experience makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside.
Gardens by the bay is an awsome place to visit both day and night. The inside waterfall is a must see along with the nightly light show on the massive trees

This place was unreal! Our flight landed at 5:30am so we headed to the gardens before it opened but your allowed to walk around the outdoors. To see my full experience, visit my youtube channel: Morgancita. I highly recommend visiting this place. If you've seen the movie Crazy Rich Asians, this place is even more magical in person. The grounds are so clean and the staff is extremely nice. It is worth taking a few hours out of your day to come here.
Gardens by the bay is a must when you go to Singapore. I went with my parents and they enjoyed every bit of it! We spent the whole day there and it was worth it!

As one of the tourist destination in singapore, we decided to visit and look what‚Äôs inside. For this month, it‚Äôs Orchid season. Both dome were air conditioned. They were able to display different types of orchid and it was instagrammable.

REVIEW_TITLE: Part of Gardens by the Bays ....
REVIEW_BODY: This is a large glass house indoor garden with multiple areas with different themes. Check website for events at the time you visit and has great access for all. Also view it at night as lightning is an extra experience.

REVIEW_TITLE: if you only can go one place....go here
REVIEW_BODY: If you only have time to go to one place in Singapore, this is the place to go. I spent about 7 hours here wandering around and just taking in all the beautiful natural landscapes. There are plenty of dining options too. I ended up staying for the super trees light show (which is worth it!).
Loads of various plants and shrubs from around the world. Miniature orchids plants as well. If the weather is hot outside, a nice way to cool off inside for couple of hours.
Gardens by the Bay are beautiful. But it is very touristy and a bit artificial. If you like nature combined with a little plastic and bling-bling. This is the place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Target the night show at 7.30 pm
REVIEW_BODY:
Excellent!
Love the theme. Great if you could add other country music for all the Travelers.
No point of climbing up to the tree top views. Becoz you can visit the Flower dome and #CloudForest so you can witness the view from the top.
You cannot enjoy the show from the top.
There are plenty more things to be explored. So go early plan the 7.30pm show. I recommend you need at least 7+hours.Save your time do not spend minutes in a same place. üòá

REVIEW_TITLE: Outstanding gardens visit at twighlight so you can see the light show
REVIEW_BODY: This place was just wow, Singapore has excelled itself with these Gardens. Just make sure you purchase tickets for both the domes you will not be disappointed. If you cant go out during the evening, go by day - the domes are air-conditioned and on a super hot day, its nice and cooling.
Background of Crazy rich Asians movie. The Supergrove trees and the skyline walk were impressive and beautiful! There are also shows in the evening! Fantastic places to chill and spend hours!
When visiting gardens by the bay, which is certainly worthwhile, avoid the foodcourt! Unfriendly and expensive!
Wonderful place to visit, un believable construction and maintenance.Amazing blend of technology & nature.
Lotsa lantern so beautiful to take pictures ,nice environment to go for families & couples.Its very ideal to go during the nights to see lightings.Lots of greenery

We have been here before and really looked forward to seeing it again, but please remember that the place is huge and to allow at least half a day, can be reached by public transport without to much effort, easy shoes and carry some fluids to drink

Now, there are may be only a few people who may not know about the majestic Gardens by the Bay, and that's totally ok. It's one of the most celebrated spots here in Singapore. So every year, during September it lights up on the occasion of Mid-Autumn festival and this year it is no less with breath-taking lanterns adorning the entire place that depict stories of rich tradition and heritage. Don't miss the captivating cultural performances and activities at the festival.

Gardens by the bay is a must when visiting Singapore.

We went as advised by concierge of Ritz Carlton hotel in late afternoon to see the flowers dome with daylight and then to see the gardens by the bay after sunset.
Well worth visiting during the day even though the heat might put you off. The night light show is beautiful.

The Gardens by the Bay light show is pretty spectacular. The show is set to music and it lights up the sky. Bring something to sit on (blanket or towel) if you don't want to sit on concrete. The rest of the Gardens is pretty amazing too... everything is so green and it feels that everything is in place for a purpose. I think if I missed the Gardens by the Bay, I would have regretted it!

We arrived there from our hotel by subway.the walk to the ticket office is a great way to see the beautiful surroundings ..beautiful gardens and pathway by the water. The light show is a fabulous view from the sky bridge..can only stay on the bridge for 20 minutes .staff push you along ..good thing I'd the light show is fabulous to see from below the bridge...lovely colors...long and crowded walk to exit when the show ends.

Another wonderful and free attraction within the Marina Bay area.

Located in the South Bay, Gardens by the Bay is so vast that not everywhere can be explored in one visit, and I highly recommend pacing yourself through the various areas. The Gardens overall are free, in addition to other areas such as the Supertree Grove. However, there is a fee for entry into some of the curated greenhouses (the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest).

There is a food court located in Satay in the Gardens, a McDonald's and other food snack stands dotted throughout. A great attraction for families, friends, singles and couples alike.

Had a lovely time here. Was expecting to be disappointed, but for an engineered and somewhat expensive (cloud forest was great, flower room was OK) attraction, it was rather good fun. Easy to get to and navigate - nice way to cool down from the heat.

If you have extra budget, the domes are very much worth seeing. If not, the super trees are good enough. It's better to go here at around 4 in the afternoon onwards, so that the sun won't be that high and that will give you enough time to go around the two domes and view the super trees fully lighted.

Wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect here. I was worried there would be lots of screaming kids or crowds. But it‚Äôs very nicely done, with several areas to see, some free gardens and some paid areas, and very spacious. I went to the two conservatories and that was enough for one day for me, although there‚Äôs more to see. A good activity for an afternoon especially if you love plants and flowers, or if you need a break from the heat.

The Gardens by the bay are incredible. You feel as if you are in the middle of the lush Forrest while you are in the middle of a major world city. The line is very fast and the foliage is worth the wait! An absolute must if you are in Singapore.
Went on our second night in Singapore, Great with all the lights, also had a light and sound show on our visit for free. A spectacular piece of structural art

Visited during the day and also at night to witness the Light show.

A really great feature and must visit tourist attraction. All visitors were so friendly and there was a great family vibe.

I guess I went to Singapore mainly to check this garden out and I was not disappointed! The place is a must see when you visit the country.
We visited during the day, and am not sure whether to recommend the visit at night or daytime.
Walking through the garden in day time was really challenging as it was quite hot and so humid. However it got better Once we entered the domes. We bought the tickets for the domes for 26 SD at an info point in China town. I guess you should dedicate at least half a day for this visit.

The Gardens by the Bay are a beautiful escape from the rest of the city. Don't get me wrong, I dig Singapore. But taking time to just wander through these lovely domes is extremely relaxing. I spent more time at the Cloud Forest than I did the floral dome, but both are worth a visit. And it's got plenty of great a/c on a hot day!

REVIEW_TITLE: Great for disabled, great for everyone
REVIEW_BODY: I have to say, I thought I‚Äôd find GBTB to be a bit sterile and artificial but thought we‚Äôd go anyway. I absolutely appreciated the effort and skill in creating something so amazing and the site does a lot to encourage people to appreciate nature, which is clearly a good thing. Our day was divided up into morning spent at the domes and returning in the evening for the light show in the Supertree Grove. With mum having reduced mobility, we hired a wheelchair for the bargain price of $2. Mum was treated well everywhere she turned and her presence of her walking stick showed all that they needed to give her space which was just wonderful. Plenty of lifts in the domes and the availability of a shuttle between the ticket office and the domes made it easy too. We returned in the evening for the light show and while a lot more crowded, it was still manageable for Mum. We didn‚Äôt manage to get there in quite enough time for the skywalk but we found a good spot and lapped up the spectacle with just as much enjoyment. The whole thing only lasts 15 mins but it was most definitely a highlight of our time in Singapore.

The Cloud Forest & Flower Dome are a must see when is Singapore. The Flower Dome had a lovely display of Tulips from Holland and hundreds of flowers from all over. It was truly amazing! And it's a lovely respite during the hot part of the day. The domes are air-conditioned!! The Cloud Forest was amazing! Also, stay if you can for the light show it is worth it!! üòä

A must go and visit during the evening as during the day it‚Äôs to hot and humid . Light show also is amazing and you can get lost in the garden. So stay close to your friends and family. Satay club also a nice addition to it . A bit to many tourist around that area but one can understand why ! Casino is just around the corner and mega mall of MBA

REVIEW_TITLE: Oasis away from the bustling city!
REVIEW_BODY: You can stroll around the various sights and attractions easily spend an afternoon or evening. Much space and an open air food court. Amazing light decoration at the tall structures - great for memorable photographs. Family friendly and lots of walking - an oasis away from the bustling city!

We were very impressed with Gardens by the Bay especially the Cloud Forest which besides being amazing was a welcome relief from the heat outside. The Gardens are absolutely wonderful and we wish that we had had more time to spend there. Would defiantly go back.

It is rare in modern cities to find nature.
I went with my family to ArtScience Museum and in the evening took a walking track to this place.
Light show is a must watch. As I recall it is at 745 and 845 pm daily.

Inside the place are sone eating joints. We went to McDonalds for dinner and sat in the open to enjoy the weather.
Was beautiful. However, the indoor flower dome air-conditioning seems not as cooling. Would visit again thou

We stopped by on a 10 hour layover. So glad we decided to come out of the airport and see the sites. Our children 8 and 10 enjoyed the different domes. We were also lucky enough to check out Floral Fantasy and the Dragonfly film. Had a wonderful time and came out with some beautiful pictures. We would love to come back and bring family in the future.

Especially with kids our advice is to go but not pay (the really excessive) prices for the two bits. They were by far the worst & most underwhelming parts. The free stuff far out strips & the light show daily at 7.45pm is brilliant.

From the bridge if you look down to 2 side of the river. This is amazing outlook. I didnt take the shuttle bus because i think work through the garden would be more interesting to discover. However, if you go through the garden like flower dom feel more disappointed of the place. First step in, along the first line where some flower seem dried of water. There is only one corner look perfect when you go to the end of dom garden. And what you found is a nice orchid flower there to take a picture there. I love more at forest garden. This more green as a waterfall is nearby.

It's amazing how much of this space you can see for free. Easiest to access from the hotel and walk across the walkway. Lots of shade and flat walkways so easy access. Water fountains are dotted around too.
Had a great fun. Flower dome and cloud forest are amazing. Lovely place to spend time with family. It is better to visit after 5pm. Avoid weekends.
If you like flowers,visit the Flower Dome. The orchids are brilliant. Plants from all continents. The Gardens by the Bay is an amazing playground.

We were rather late in the evening visiting, but the park is beautiful and well set up. It's a really good time to visit right now as there are lovely displays of lanterns and other displays that tell the story of the Mid-Autumn festival.
Next time we'll certainly be there for much longer and earlier in the evening.

This place is adjacent to Marina Bay Tower and readily accessible. It is an enclosed area with air-conditioning system teeming with so many plants and faunas. We enjoyed taking pictures of the beautiful flowers and various unfamiliar plants. We also enjoyed the short movie featuring some animations and the amazing scenery inside the gardens.

Visited gardens by the bay recently during a stopover in Singapore. What an incredible place featuring an amazing sensory overload of colour, smell and texture. The people who designed this exhibit have truly completed an amazing exhibit. We visited seeking more knowledge of orchids but left with far more. How the operators manage to combine flora from all over the world under the one roof and make them thrive is unbelievable.
You cannot visit Singapore without visiting this amazing place!

REVIEW_TITLE: Breathtaking landscapes, artistic designs and architectural wonders
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is definitely a must go attraction in Singapore. The vision for this attraction was ambiguous from an engineering standpoint and wide ranging in terms of its appeal. Your visit will encompass Breathtaking landscapes, artistic designs and architectural wonders which you do not see elsewhere. We visited during the mid autumn festival and Independence Day celebrations so had the privilege to experience extra events and contraptions. Highly recommended.

Gardens by the bay are one of the most spectacular places in Singapore and should definitely be visited while you out there. Especially during evening when there is a million lights and everything looks like out of this world

REVIEW_TITLE: Definitely worth seeing on your visit to Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must just to see it up close. It is free to walk around but there is also the cloud forest and floral dome to check out and worth going as well
We only had a full day in Singapore, and gardens by the bay was our priority. And was it worth it.. the plant conservatorium was almost as amazing as the light show. Must see!
Cloud Forest my favourite as well as my 9 year old niece. So peaceful and calm, feels like being in Avatar movie forest surrounding.
The place is breathtaking with the variety of orchids. There's love in the air. You can even smell it.
This is a must see place. Be sure to go to both domes and enjoy the beautiful flowers, and rainforest. Take a walk around the giant trees. Enjoy

REVIEW_TITLE: A perfect place for peace lovers
REVIEW_BODY: I can not tell you the amount of peace and happiness you get once you are inside the dome. Both the domes have different themes, one for the gardening and the other for the waterfall but it feels so amazing to be there and the light show from the groove trees in the night is so lovely. If you have gone to visit Singapore and did not visit Gardens by the Way, you have missed a lot!

We loved Gardens by the Bay. Just don't go on a Monday. We were fine because we didn't have a lot of time and seriously loved the Orchid Extravaganza. We spent ages there and with four children under 10 that was quite a feat. The reason Monday is not a good day to visit is because many of the areas are closed for maintenance, for example the children's playground and the Cloud Dome.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool gardens within the city of Singapore.
REVIEW_BODY: The Gardens by the Bay is a very popular visitors' park for both locals, residents and tourists. The whole gardens' wide variety of living flora are all housed within fully climate controlled dome housing. Plants and flowers from around the way are beautifully displayed. We can enjoy seeing many temperate varieties, although we are located at the equator. Simply amazing. Take many photos and memories back Home to share with family and friends.

REVIEW_TITLE: Most impressive garden complex I have seen
REVIEW_BODY: Visited the main south side gardens and regretted not having a full day to stay there. Both the park and the greenhouse globes were fantastic. Singapore is also the first place I have visited where greenhouses are cooler and drier than the air outside, which is a welcome respite for a visitor from sub-arctic climate.

Panoramic view, everything is like a new one. Cloud Forest and scenic view from the upper top position is beautiful. Lighting show with musical sound is magnificent. Overall it's a beautiful place to visit for tourists.

Wow. Gardens? Yes, WOW!!! The variety of all types of plants from all over the world; Asia, Nth America, Africa, Australia just to name a few will keep you captivated for hours. We‚Äôll definitely be back. The Satay across the park is worth the walk too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Amazing human creation by the Bay!
REVIEW_BODY: Amazing human creation by the Bay next to another fantastic place which is Marina Bay Sands ! Great to spend afternoon and evening visiting both places.
a place for young and old great places to eat or have a cup of coffee with a friend. Super impressive. Another must-see.
Rainy day in Singapore so the indoor gardens were ideal. The various regions show how different climates affect trees and plants and it is very informative.

Cool and beautiful place to be during the hot afternoon in Singapore
Just 15min walk from MRT station
Love the flowers and cactus
Good information on human impact to the earth, make me feel like doing something to help the environment.... :)
This a great place for all purposes. Educational, taking pictures, experiences etc. The laser show at night is something you shouldn't miss.
This was a tour you must do while in Singapore. Well worth the money and enjoy the gardens. A must to see also is the NIGHT SHOW with the lights. You will not be dissapointed.

Wonderful stroll through beautiful gardens
Nice to get outside :) so much of Singapore is an indoor event

One of the best gardens with so many species of flowers and plants! It's brilliant and colorful. Do not hurry this place. You will have to absorb this place with good amount of time as there is so much to see !
it's really nice to walk around.... both day time and night time . it's one of "MUST GO" place in Singapore.
A short stroll through the Gardens. A must visit location if you come to Singapore. Best time to visit is at dusk.

Visit here from 4-8pm to get glimpse of light and dark designing.
spare 3-4 hrs so that you dont miss anything. It has 3-4 attractions inside. One of them is closed on different days. Plan your visit accordingly. Watched the light show here. Free of cost . Different and eye catching.

I enjoyed the new exhibit at the other end of Garden by the Ba. The concept is refreshing as it has hanging plants displayed upside down as well as bundle of flowers moved up and down vertically. This add a new dimension to a otherwise usual static display of plant lives. When one through the walkway, we are also welcomed by waterfall with floral pattern made possible by computer aided design. The 4D shows is interesting as the background is the Garden itself.
The man made waterfall dome is however looked dated as more green or birds perhaps colorful south american parrots or hornbills should be considered.
Cooling and beautifully done place. The cloud forest is something to look forward to. Beautifully done and maintained. 100‚Äôs of flowers to explore. Something to include in your trip to Singapore.

It was impressive how they maintained a huge indoor garden.
I hope there were more seating areas to rest and simple enjoy the view of the flower gardens.

REVIEW_TITLE: Exquisite gardens, so much to look at
REVIEW_BODY: The succulent garden alone is worth the visit. Definitely plan to spend an entire day at the very least at these gardens. I couldn‚Äôt see to appreciate even half of the plants on display. Highly recommended as a destination visit.
since they have different flower in different event, it's always fun to go there and even more because a lot of flower can't grow in singapore weather.

Visited these gardens and was blown away by the design and construction of the buildings and their magnificent content. The internal sky walk, massive waterfall and even LEGO Venus Fly Trap with world theme gardens throughout. This is a must visit place with something to do for all of the family.
Just love to be around in the park, many points to check out in this place. Also a wonderful light and sound in evening
It is a very nice place to visit. Best time to visit is between 5 and 8 pm so that you could see the beauty in the daylight as well as the night time lightnings.

Been to the Gardens By The Bay twice in past two weeks. The display in flower dome is constantly refreshed to a certain theme, cloud forest is still amazing albeit the strong crowd and a bit of human jam going up the escalator. However, the staff was quick to divert the crowd to nearby elevator etc.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not to be missed at Night
REVIEW_BODY: This could be one of the high lights of staying for a few days in Singapore. the night "light shows" are entertaining and offer lots of uhs and ahs. Depending on your budget and available time to see all the photo ops. you can spend an hour or 1/2 a day to take it all in.

Definitely must visit garden by the bay. Especially around evening time after the flower dome, with cooling environment and hundreds sort of beautiful flowers to be captured in photos, followed by super trees as an ending. The music accompany the changes of lights of the man made trees with MBS as background are just magnificent views.
This is a great activity that is fun for the kids to run around and beautiful scenery. Excellent for photos but go early because it can be busy.

We visited the garden in August and it is something you need to do while in Singapore. The cost is $28 Singapore each, I felt this was a bit pricing for what it was, we then had to pay extra to go up the OCBC Skyway. The two domes are flower dome and cloud forest and the waterfall is a highlight, it is very well air conditioned and can get a little cold which is a nice change from the heat outside. If you like orchards as I do then I would recommend a visit as I have never seen so many varieties on display.
What an extraordinary experience. From the well planned layout to the amazing array if plants. All in air conditioned comfort .

REVIEW_TITLE: A Visit to Garden by the bay
REVIEW_BODY:
A very pleasant place to visit with families member. Flowers, waterfall and many others attractive trees and features.
Educational for my children too knowing about the trees and flowers.
An attraction that no one should miss it! The dome was unique and the flower theme change every season.

We did the tree top walk and visited the flower dome. The tree top walk is short but the views of the gardens, the city and the bay are all worth it. The flower dome is definitely a must visit for flora lovers however it‚Äôs quite expensive - $20 a head for adults.

This whole area is beautiful, you don‚Äôt have to pay just to walk around but you have to pay to visit the flower dome or the cloud forest but unfortunately the cloud forest was closed that day so we visited the flower dome. Beautiful

We visited cloud florist and flower dome. We spend about an hour and half in cloud Forest for photo taking and it took about half an hour in flower dome. I‚Äôm not so into flower. But I would suggest to visit before sunset so you could take better photos with sufficient lightings. The ticket we bought from Klook doesn‚Äôt come with the buggy, but it was fine to walk from entrance to cloud forest. We reached about 330pm. after visited cloud forest and flower dome, we made it to the light show of Supertree groove which was amazing. better to go early to find your own spot for photo or video taking. Not much choices of restaurants and food nearby.

I enjoyed this park on my morning run as well as late this evening. Visit before 11 pm as the lights on some of the scenery went off at that time. This is a free open park that is ideal for running in the morning and then an after sunset walk with family. The lighting at night is very romantic and beautiful. There is an MRT metro stop right near as well.
The gardens by the bay exhibit is in an airconditioned dome, it features plants from all over the world, it is well worth a walk though. The cafe was really nice here as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: Fabulous Place to Visit - Loved the Gardens
REVIEW_BODY: I had the absolute pleasure of visiting here during the day and at night - I recommend doing both..they are both different experiences. The super tree grove and walk is AMAZING - and just walking around the different areas is a must. I especially loved the 2 Conservatories - I was blown away and the obvious attention to detail - dont miss Gardens By the Bay - good exercise too....
Beautiful place, but the show was too late (around 9pm) my baby just fell asleep right before the light n music show begin. So i have to go back to the hotel.

Very beautiful place suitable for kids and adults. Plan to spend about a half day to see everything. Unfortunately the cloud forest was closed due to maintanance. I‚Äòd recommend to buy the tickets for both conservatories (flower dome and cloud forest) for 28 SGD. if you intend to visit them separately, you‚Äòll pay 20 SGD per conservatory. Get your stamp to re-enter the conservatory. The skywalk is for one-time entrance only and costs 8 SGD. be aware that it is closed during rain.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gorgeous gardens with amazing foliage and flowers.
REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are worth a visit. We saw the most exotic flowers, plants and fabulous orchids on display. The Cloud Forest has an indoor waterfall and a spectacular circular walk down from the top of the Forest to the base.

gardens by the Bay should be on everyone‚Äôs travel destinations.
Something for everyone any time of day and night.
The Cloud Forest is a brilliant experience with fascinating array of plants in a beautiful setting. The waterfall is impressive as is the tree walk.
Go into the flower section to see what a stunning mix of flowers. I went in Autumn, which was great, but I imagine Spring would be incredible.
There is a night light show and lots for kids and families.
Not an expensive activity but certainly worth it.
Currently there is a Chinese Lantern show. Always something different going on.

REVIEW_TITLE: Impressive to visit and not too crowded
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the bay is not only about the gardens, the plants, the water... it is a lesson in environmental protection as well without giving a lecture. The flower dome is great to visit, the Cloud forest is impressive if you also take the time to read the notes. Yoy pay 28 S$ for a visit to both. You can walk around in the rest of the park freely.
