The Skyway, you have to pay separately as well as the floral Fantasy. You can spend hours walking around here and enjoying the park, the nature, the sculptures...
Such a beautiful place to visit. Really enjoyed my day here. Need minimum 2 hours to see all the gardens. Upkeep of the gardens is wonderful. Must see in Singapore. Best thing I did in Singapore!

If there is one place in Singapore which I could go again and again to , it would be Gardens by the Bay and especially it‚Äôs conservatories flower dome and cloud forest . Which city has the luxury of having so much nature in the heart of the city . While the sprawling gardens are lovely and free , it is flower dome and cloud forest both paid attractions that are really worth a visit . The fact that here is a beautiful flora and fauna haven you can visit at anytime of the day since it is completely air conditioned and perfect to save yourself from the hot climate of Singapore , is the 1st reason to visit . The flower dome is a delightful display of seasonal flowers all arranged perfectly for those Instagram shots and simply wonderful to be surrounded by so much colour . All year round it‚Äôs a treat to the eyes to see floral displays of orchids, roses , Sakura , dahlias and many more .
While cloud forest is truly what it‚Äôs name suggests . A feeling of walking in the clouds with a rainforest display of varied fauna and a huge waterfalls . There is something so refreshing and peaceful about the cloud forest that makes you forget the outside world .
Try to get to these places early , as you will encounter large groups of tourists late morning . But it is also magical in the late hours around 7 pm . The conservatories close by 9 pm so make sure you dedicate at least 1/2 hr to each .
Other paid attractions are the OCBC skywalk and the newest one , floral fantasy , worth visiting if you have the time.
Don‚Äôt miss this enchanting place , a must visit for anyone visiting Singapore !

REVIEW_TITLE: Bit pricey; not super assistance friendly
REVIEW_BODY:
Went here with my mom and dad. The place is very well kept and the structure and layouts are very unique. I did find the entry pricing for what you see a bit expensive.

Both my parents need wheelchair support. This entire facility is not very assistance friendly. We waited about 20 mins to get to the 7th floor lost world in the cloud forest.

Amazing gardens in Singapore.
The walk through Flower dome and Cloud dome are breathtaking
The skywalk and Supertree Grove gave an wonderful view with the gardens and the city in the background
There is lots of walking but the ground is fairly level and there are plenty of places to sit and soak up the atmosphere
Very beautiful garden many tourist we have taken many pictures there and enjoyed ourselves, must visit in singapore!!

The sheer variety of plants available for viewing is mind blowing. The whole experience of getting in and getting out of the place is awesome. Being inside during the misting time is quit enjoyable! one can easily spend several hours inside!!

We have been to the Gardens by the Bay a few times already but for the first time at night and during the Mid-Autumn Festival which was the perfect time. A rhapsody of colors, best to enjoy from the Skywalk, lanterns, and food street and a spectacular light show.

This is my 2nd to Cloud Forest and Flower Doom. The first in the evening and the 2nd time at noon. When you come here in the evening you not really can enjoyed the view of the plants but the light show was spectacular. When you visit in the noon, you can enjoy a beautiful flowers, the relax ambience and waterfall. You should take a photo in the front of waterfall.
Interesting if you have knowledge! But otherwize it's just something you do to pass your time in Singapour has there is not that much to do or see...

we went to the gardens during the day and also at night on a tour. this is an amazing part of Singapore and the beauty surrounding this area is stunning. At night its like a new place and do different than the day time

I was leading a group of 100+ Indian Tourist and this is one out of many visits to Garden by the Bay by me give in past months. It's always a Charm for Couples, families, specially Travelling with kids to come and experience Nature. Recommended to everyone to visit Once
Take the time to stroll around this garden. They really are a delight with lots of plants, designs and sculptures to look at. The waterfall is beautiful. Easy access and great for all ages.

Very large park inclunding different kind of outdoor gardens with water elements. Two conservatories in addition to OCBC Skywalk are places one must see and experience. Definitely one of the top attractions in Singapore.

Wow!!
These gardens are awesome.
Well done Singapore this is a wonderful attraction for everyone.
Absolutely spectacular

Our whole family loved it here. Plenty of space and wonderful gardens. Waterfalls & flowers to make you gasp with delight.
The light show at the end of the evening was great! Huge Super tree Grove was stunning at night and not to be missed.

Each time there is something different to see and experience. The gardens are beautifully kept and amenities are spotless. The staff were friendly and helpful. Don‚Äôt miss if you are stopping in Singapore.

I would highly recommend going to both conservatories ($28 SGD) and the sky walk ($8 SGD). The conservatories have air conditioning so it perfect during the hot afternoon. If possible stay for the light show at 7:45pm although it gets pretty crowded at night. Satay by the Bay (hawker center) is within walking distance or there are plenty of places to buy food on site. It is a great place to visit with a family or as a couple. Plenty of opportunities for nice pictures and excellent views on the sky walk.

REVIEW_TITLE: Does Live up to the Hype
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens of the Bay has become the new icon of Singapore and it doesn‚Äôt disappoint. We spent a whole day in the area, which was a 10 minute walk from the Pan Pacific Hotel where we were staying.
Besides the attractive grounds and the massive metal trees that are the emblem of the Gardens, there are 3 enclosures to visit. The Floral Fantasy is new and contains a concentrated mass of flowers and a multi-dimensional theatrette at the exit. This 5 minute film of the Gardens takes you on a 3D flight around all the attractions with seats that sway with the movement and the occasional spray of scent to mimic the flowers. It‚Äôs very well done. The Cloud Forest has a massive inside waterfall and an elevator that takes you to the top before spiralling on a walk back down. The Flower Dome unsurprisingly is full of blooming colourful flowers.
While you can ‚Äúdine‚Äù on McDonalds nearby, make the effort to find Satay on the Bay nestled in a corner of the park. This is genuine street food, though slightly more expensive than your average food stall. But the options are many and the food fresh and delicious. I purchased 30, yes 30, mixed satay sticks on a platter supposedly for sharing. I got to 21. Yum. You can try stingray here if you wish plus lots of other more regular delights.
We spent some time over in the Marina Bay shops, definitely looking only ‚Äì Singapore isn‚Äôt cheap anymore and these arcades are lined with every boutique brand imaginable.
Finally we returned after dark for the night light shows ‚Äì one a water fountain presentation on the city side of the Marina Bay Sands at 8pm and one in the Gardens at 8.45, where all the big trees ‚Äúdance‚Äù to the music with multi-coloured displays. There is a skyway walk that circles between 2 of the big trees. We had tickets but the time stamping ends at 5.30pm, though the times can be till later at night. You can only get up there at a particular time and you get your ticket stamped for that time. Cleverer people than me who had prepared well had their walk in the trees during the light show, which may well have been spectacular. Give that some thought if going.
All the enclosures cost money, but relatively the prices are reasonable. We paid about A$50 per person for the 3 domes and the skywalk.
Gardens of the Bay is simple but very creative and can easily keep you enchanted for a full day. It‚Äôs one of those must-sees that you really must see.

A great experience watching the 8.45pm light show. The crowds were huge but we managed to get dropped off at front door and walk through the gardens in time for show. We then walked over the bridge to Marina Bay Sands and enjoyed the view back on the garden from the ship in the sky at Spargo.

Fantastic tourist attraction
Beautiful gardens
Good walking cycling tracks
Food an amenities plentiful and good
Skywalk flower dome views of the city and Marina Bay Sands fantastic but the best thing has to be the light show
So amazing
We also took a cart tour around initially to get our bearings which was very beneficial

REVIEW_TITLE: A must on every Singapore itinerary!
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay is one of the most iconic sights in Singapore for good reason. It‚Äôs been crafted as a feast for your senses. The Gardens are spectacular beyond your highest expectations. The pictures and videos we saw prior do not do it justice! To get the full experience, plan for an entire day. The Cloud Forest, Flower Dome and OCBC Skyway are a must. Seeing them all gets a bit pricey, but will be a once in a lifetime experience. The Skyway is best in the morning when it‚Äôs cool or at night when the lights are on. The views of the Supertrees and skyline are incredible. Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are a great way to cool off from the Singapore heat and are both botanical wonders. Make sure you get a re-entry stamp so you can revisit after walking around the outdoor gardens. For those with children, the free Children‚Äôs Garden is not to be missed. First of all, prepare for them to get wet! There is a great water feature where kids can play in their swimsuits. Our rowdy American kids ran straightaway into the feature with their clothes on. Then they played in the beautiful hidden forest playground that was paved with sand. Needless to say, they were a disaster afterwards. Thankfully there are showers and changing rooms available. Lastly, check the website for routine closures. The Children‚Äôs Garden was closed for maintenance during our first visit, necessitating a second (messy but worthwhile) trip to the Gardens. A must for every itinerary!

Very good place & a must visit for all tourists.Sound & light show at 6 p.m in the centre & direct access from marina bay sands shopping centre & direct metro access.
Avoid when raining.many eateries incl mc donalds.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you only visit one place, then go here!
REVIEW_BODY:
Fantastic gardens and wonderful light show. Unfortunatley the flower dome was closed for planned maintenance the day that we went. The Cloud dome was amazing , the festival of flowers less so.
It's free to enter the gardens and watch the show, so if you're on a budget, no need to purchase ticket just to see the super trees.
We tried and failed to get a ticket when it was dark to walk up in the trees...they won't let you purchase timed tickets in advance,but they release tickets every 20 mins from 6.20
Great food hall in the park, also a bar ( the most reasonably priced wine that we had had all week!

The garden is cool, have 14 different gardens of different cultures. but the famous light show is just so so. Only Music+Lights. Skyway has a good view, 25 meters high, which is about 8th floors, but you are only allow to stay for 15 mins up there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to spend a couple hours out of the heat
REVIEW_BODY: Very busy but very nice to walk around. Satay by the bay, next door, is great for a cheap lunch. The kids really liked cloud forest. Reasonably priced.

This is truly a beautiful garden not to be missed if you are visiting Singapore. It is huge, cleaned and well maintained. And don't worry about mosquitoes in a hot place like Singapore, because there are no mosquitoes or bugs in the Gardens by the Bay. As a matter of fact, it is air-conditioned and a lot more comfortable than outside of the Gardens. Be sure to stay for the lighting up at night (I believe it was around 8:30pm). We went to the top of the Marina Sands Bay hotel to watch this. The Marina Sands Bay hotel is just adjacent to the Gardens.

ia a Singapura e nao ir neste jardim, √© o mesmo que nada! √â o local mais lindo que ja vi no mundo, de flores! O Jardim fica anexo ao Hotel Marina Bay Sands, por se tras, voc√™ pode caminhar pelo Garden Bay the bay, que √© o parque gratuitamente, e pagar para entrar no jardim e na floresta! √â paradis√≠aco

I would go to Singapore and not go to this garden, it's the same as nothing! It's the most beautiful place I've ever seen in the world, with flowers! The Garden is attached to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, however, you can walk through the Garden Bay the bay, which is the park for free, and pay to enter the garden and the forest! It's praised

This is a very relaxing experience. Lots of plants including trees divided into sections according to habitat. Wooden sculptures compliment the displays. However, it is extremely busy at the weekends though and there will be another long queue if you have decided to visit the cloud forest too.

We loved our time strolling round. It‚Äôs a beautiful place and I still can‚Äôt believe it is right in the middle of the city! The tickets are quite reasonably priced but you need to buy different tickets to get in different sections.
we had a nice time and enjoy it that place in real :) and i hope visit that place other time with my friends

We spent a wonderful Monday afternoon and night at Gardens by the Bay. There is so much to see. The free gardens, consisting of four heritage gardens and world of plants gardens (e.g. understory, world of palms, etc) are very pretty but the greenhouses of the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest are spectacular. We spent about an hour at the start in the free gardens, then about four hours in the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest (which were a cool escape in the middle of the afternoon) before heading for the Supertree Grove where we bought the OCBC walkway tickets. We ended the day picking up some food from the food court and sitting in the meadow enjoying the night-time Supertree grove light show. I think we were lucky with our timing as while there were lots of people and some queuing it wasn‚Äôt too crowded.

This garden is my favourite in Singapore. I love the man made super trees, especially the free nightly light and musical show at the super Grove trees. The garden has interesting and educational areas featuring vegetation of our region. The flower domes are beautiful and have plants and flowers of different regions of the world. Also this garden is even more special because it is build from reclaimed land. Moreover, from the garden, you can see Singapore beautiful skyline, especially the iconic Marina Bay Sands.

Amazing gardens. The price for Cloud dome and flour dome are little bit expensive. But you can visit the gardens without this ones.
Great moment with our daughter

REVIEW_TITLE: GBTB ‚Äì Astounding park that human being can make
REVIEW_BODY:
It is truly an astounding attraction spans over 101 hectares of reclaimed land and consists of world famous Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. Flower Dome housed thousands of plant species, cactus, Singaporean Orchids, and colorful flowers. It‚Äôs really amazing to see how all these plants are well maintained under a huge glass structure and in a controlled temperature and overall environment. It‚Äôs equally enchanting to people of any age.

Cloud Forest, next stop is another man-made marvel. Cloud, artificial waterfall and mist, green and crystal garden will take any person to a different world at least for the time being.

Last but not the least there is SuperTree Grove light up. 18 supertrees of 25 to 50 meter heights give shade during the day and uses solar energy for the spectacular 15 minutes light show that starts after dawn and creates a ecstatic view of trees with lights on those. This is included in the ticket.

Going there is pretty easy as most of the tourists takes few minutes walk from the Bayfront MRT or walk over from the Marina Bay. I would recommend going there in the afternoon to take the opportunity to watch the spectacular light up. Besides, visitors can take internal trains to Flower Dome from the entry point if you prefer to avoid some early walk. Eventually, one has to prepare for lots of walk.

If you visit Singapore these gardens are a must, but go at night, the masive trees light up and there is a magnificent display to music, would have taken the skywalk while the display was on but we were still queing. Good evening out.
Well worth a visit, beautiful gardens, night time light show was amazing! Very busy though so please get there early!

This is my favourite place to visit whenever I am down in Singapore. One can alight at the BAYFRONT MRT and it's just a short walk to the entrance where you purchase your ticket. I would recommend starting with the gardens first then only the cloud forest.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must see when visiting Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Gardens by the Bay are a must on your visit to Singapore and also for children of all ages. Totally fascinating seeing the types of trees and plants plus the display of flowers especially the Singapore Orchards in the flower section. They have a small train that takes you to view the tall trees and plants and the flower display so if you do not wish to walk to the pavilions you can view some of the other areas of the Gardens from there. Give yourself plenty of time there is so much to see and you will be left with a feeling of complete exhilaration with all of it it is simply a more than fabulous experience
You must visit these amazing gardens. Beautifully structured and so gorgeous the Orchid Display was featured when we were there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful place. Do not miss the domes!
REVIEW_BODY: The Cloud and Flower domes were a highlight for me at Gardens by the Bay. The atmosphere in these gardens is wonderful. I also stayed in the evening for the light show which was a nice end to the day.

We visited and found the new experience the most impressive. Combined ticket was good value and the AC in the Conservatories was a welcome respite from the heat/humidity. The 4D immersive cinema experience was absolutely fantastic.

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit if you are in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I was amazed by the sheer number of flowers at display. Also the place is well maintained. Needs at least 3 to 4 hours if you want to enjoy it.

REVIEW_TITLE: Was a relaxing and amazing experience
REVIEW_BODY: The cloud dome and light show both were amazing , the flower dome was so colourful, kids enjoyed this place alot , the only pinch was the waiting time for going to the top of the waterfall in cloud dome but it was worth waiting , walking down the beautiful waterfall is worth it . And after long walk around the garden and in the domes, I grabbed corner in the garden and enjoyed the night show which was very relaxing and amazing.

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the best man-made attractions in the world
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited the two biospheres and walked through the Supertree Garden - put aside a day to do this. Note - for a great view of the area head to LAVO restaurant at the top of Marina Bay Hotel (s$32 for a pizza).

The Flower Dome is incredible in size, content, variety and design. It takes your breath away when you walk in. I'm not sure how horticulturally pure it is, but the Baobab trees, cactus, orchids - I could go on - where amazing (the driftwood sculptures are a highlight). Whilst there is a main route there are corners to explore and the fact that there are multiple (but flowing) levels make it a unique space. Unlike many places in Singapore - no queueing (although MANY pictures being taken = congestion).

The Cloud Forest is almost as impressive, with a single focal point of an amazing 'mountain' with a waterfall cascading to the entrance (note - best waterfall experience in Singapore is at Jewel (Changi Airport)). Quite a bit less diverse than flower dome and use of stalagmites/stalactites jarred a little but the cloud walkway is amazing.

Supertree Garden. Recommend you do this at night. We didn't do the OCBC skyway (huge queue) but didn't feel like we missed out. We just lay on our backs under the trees and watched the whole area change colours with the trees and soaked up the atmosphere.

This place is HUGE. My partner and I visited the Gardens and more specifically the top attractions such as the Sky Walk and Cloud Dome which both have an entrance fee (Sky Walk $8 per adult SGD and Cloud Dome $20 per adult SGD). You could spend hours here but the heat and humidity made it hard to explore the whole Gardens. The Cloud Dome provided relief as this attraction was airconditioned and we spent about 2 hours there alone.

REVIEW_TITLE: How to make the visit more visitor-friendly
REVIEW_BODY: Most of the people who come to this place are first time visitors, and many have limited time. The signages to the various sites need to be more numerous and prominently visible.
The tree structures are fascinating. The light show was a bit too twee. There was a queue to get up to the walk way.

Gardens by the Bay is a toursity spot, yet a must see. Most of the exhibit is inside and the air conditioning was MUCH appreciated. There is an extreme variety of plants including orchids, roses, and cacti. If you can get past the lines, it will blow your mind.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful by day! Sensational by night
REVIEW_BODY: We visited Gardens by the bay and added on the all the extras to visit both domes, tree walk and flower extravaganza (or something like that) it was all beautiful. We went back the following night to watch the light show. We lay on the grass and wow it was stunning. A relaxing evening in beautiful Singapore. This has to be on your to do list for Singapore.
It was a good place to spend our anniversary and it is more beautiful at night. The lights and the giant trees are amazing

We went in the evening. One can spend the whole day here. The light and sound show in the supertree area is really breath taking. We did not visit the domes as the environment there attracted us more.
A truly wonderful experience looking at all the different plants and flowers. They have done a great job here, so many different species. The laser light show was good as well in the evening

Absolutely wonderful experience. The Cloud Forrest was amazing. The plants were divine particularly the perfumed orchid display.....glorious colours. We enjoyed the Cloud Walk and Treetop Walk. The gardens are free to enter and stroll around but there is an entrance fee for the attractions. Highly recommended
How amazing they are. The videos are a bit dumbed down but lover the cloud garden ... wow. Definitely recommended ... the gardens outside are pretty spectacular too

We went here as soon as we arrived in Singapore while waiting for friends to finish work... we went into both the domes and did the OCBC skyway which was fantastic (not if you‚Äôre scared of heights though as it does wobble!)... the cloud forest dome was just beautiful, they spray the forest must through the day and it adds another level of beauty (and coolness) and the orchid exhibition that is on currently was fun to smell and see all the unusual varieties. You can walk through the park gardens and under the super trees for free and if you want to be on the skyway for the light show (7.45 and 8.45pm) you have to get the right spot as it‚Äôs done in time allocations... either way great views! The domes are both air conditioned therefore a nice way to cool down for an afternoon or keep out if the rain!
For nature lovers, definitely a must see attraction in Singapore. The display was meticulously arranged in a way that spectators will be amazed...
Its a must when in Singapore, and the night show is a must.. do yourself a favour and go to the landings so you can see without having to crane your neck.

We loved the gardens and recommend visiting at night as the lights are fabulous.
The Cloud Forest is great and the indoor waterfall is a must-see.
The view from the Skyway is great and even though the line was long, it moved quickly.
We'd definitely go there again to see the exhibits that were closed.
An absolute must see when in Singapore especially the night light show. The domes are really great. Don't miss out on this amazing place.

Gardens by the Bay is a must-see. Nothing like it anywhere. Beautiful display of flowers and plants in extensive indoor and outdoor settings. Easy to get to, particularly from Marina Bay Hotel complex. Free admission. Payment required for domes, shuttles, and other extras. Allow at least a few hours, but can easily take longer if you have the time and can take heat. To help with the heat, go early in morning or evening. Good to take a break for a meal in the middle of your experience to cool down and rest some - plenty of dining opps. The shuttle also helps as the breeze generated is very pleasant.

REVIEW_TITLE: For people who like flowers and the nature
REVIEW_BODY: Good for families and people who like the nature but indoor with wood art and human works to do such a beautifull Garden

Gardens by the Bay are beautiful by day and especially at night, but we were very disappointed when we were given wrong information about what time to arrive to book a time slot for the skywalk at dusk. We were told to get there for 6 pm which we did but then found out that all the time slots had gone. Conservatories and gift shop closed early too. We feel the organisation and signage were non-existent. In fact, there is no real need to buy tickets - just turn up and walk round.

Gardens By The Bay is the reason we decided to spend our Honeymoon in the beautiful Singapore, we watched a movie 'Hitman Agent 47', and there was a scene when they were on the Skyway, which is a walkway high up in the Supertrees, and we weren't sure if it was an actual place at first or just a movie set, when we found out that it was an actual place, we decided that Singapore would be the destination for our Honeymoon, and we weren't disappointed at all, to actually be there in person at Gardens By The Bay after waiting for so long to get here, Was Awesome!!! The Supertrees are an amazing sight, you dont get a true sense of how big they are until you're actually there, a fantastic sight, man made trees with plants and foliage interweaving and climbing up the structures until eventually they will reach the top, Beautiful, we also visited The Flower Dome & The Cloud Forest which is part of Gardens By The Bay, I think we were told they were among the biggest Greenhouses in the world, if not The biggest, but a brilliant place to experience, We Loved It!! Thank You.

One can spend hours here. What a delightful garden it is. The variety of flora is amazing. The towers with their vertical gardens are a work of art. IN the evenings , the light and sound show should be enjoyed by lying down on the lawns . The food court has great food and good service.
The weather was threatening, but these gardens were worth the risk. Three distinct locations, each with a different focus and feeling, but all amazing and a delight to visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Must see once in your life
REVIEW_BODY: Eye openers for all about floral, one must see to enjoy such a magnificent garden contains so many thousand species of flower and plants,as well the energy saving, usage of natural resources to activate all the facilities of the entire garden. Only believe after seeing by your own eyes and feel by your body.

Nature (man made) at its best. Kingdom of garden artistry that educate visitors of the various plants. U'll love the scenery especially at night. Enjoy the view as you stroll along or just sit back and enjoy . A fee is require in some of the sight seeing in the area.
Must visit attraction in Singapore. Well maintained and have all varieties of flowers and plants from different parts of world

We were there for the Orchid Festival in August 2019 and were amazed at the variety of colour, size, scent, shape and abundance of a single orchid; let alone how many were there! Other flowers also beautiful; even the least flower-lover of your group will appreciate, if not love, this place.
Lovely views and every plant you can imagine just be prepared for walking soo much, I recommend you go here at least once.
The First Time i go to this place at afternoon, but this time i get best view from this place because i go at night and if you go around 7.00 PM - 09.00 PM you can enjoy music show at Giant Tree

What a beautiful place, make sure you get there early in the morning, it gets very hot.

We spent over four hours visiting the gardens, this is one of the things you must visit in Singapore also make sure you came back in the evening to see the lights concert show, when we arrived there around 7:30pm everyone was sitting or lying on the floor (bring a blanket), what a incredible show, it lasts 15 minutes, well worth the second visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great attraction for who loves flowers and nature
REVIEW_BODY:
Bought the pass for Flower Dome and Cloud Forest.

Flower Dome. Orchid extravaganza was on display. It was okay as I come from a city where orchids are aplenty. Concept of the exhibit was greatly executed.

Cloud Forest. Cool and misty inside. It would have been better if the floor is not too wet. Kids can loose their bearing and slip. But overall, nice and mezmerizing.

Price. A bit steep. Expected it to be less than $20.

Staff. One staff was annoying. Unwilling to help as we were asking which is the best way to get a bus/mrt.
Beautiful place, not to miss if you ever visit Singapore. Great place for families with young children as well! Do check out the Children water play area which is free!
Its really great to have a visit here surrounded by the nature! Visit in the evening to have a really amazing view of gardens and the light show!

REVIEW_TITLE: Trees worth it, conservatories not so much
REVIEW_BODY: Going to see the trees is free (definitely do it) and we paid to go up on the skyway (8 SIN--also totally worth it). We also paid to go in both of the conservatories (cloud forest and flower garden or something) which was about 28 SIN together. Those were nice because they were air conditioned, but I wouldn't do it again, and wouldn't recommend paying for them. The waterfall in the cloud forest is pretty, but not worth the price. I'm not amazed by flowers so that conservatory also didn't do much for me. If that does interest you a ton, though, maybe it is worth it for you. We went to the trees, skyway, and conservatories first thing in the morning (9am) and then returned at night for the light show (7:45pm i believe). Definitely do both. Worth it to go there twice. Also close to several subway stops.
Cloud Forest the best if only visiting one venue in our opinion. Our 8yr old grandson loved it. Worth the fee for entry - allow a couple of hours.
A sight not to be missed. The domes are totally mesmerising.... so very very beautiful. It‚Äôs spectacular. So family friendly.... A great couple of hours.
Best time for photograph is around 5 to 6pm, you can go for the light show at Super Tree after the photo shoot.

REVIEW_TITLE: If you can only do one thing in Singapore---this is it!
REVIEW_BODY: We had read about this, looked it up on TripAdvisor and Lonely Planet along with some of the other Go To resources. It was even better than they said. It was amazing! Both the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest were just extraordinary. The exhibits are perfection. You never felt crowded even with all the people going thru. There was so much to look at.....you just cannot take in all the detail. You have to experience this--Singapore likes to say: anything you can do, we can do better. Well, indeed they did it here!

REVIEW_TITLE: A must visit for garden lovers
REVIEW_BODY:
A must visit for garden lovers, all gardens were very neat, was really a safe haven in the heat of singapore
Kl**k had made it easy for us to get there
Need to put more signage for directions in the venues

This is a stunningly strange thing to have in a city - but the climate of the gardens is an absolute delight to and UK resident- I was hot and bothered so only got a ticket to cloud forest - stunning inside - loved the walk through- and enjoyed being a little cool for an hour & a half - very interesting & unexpected video at the end of the walk about climate change -

Never seen anything like this. Must must visit for everyone. You have to be there in evening around 7pm to see the awesome light show that happens each evening. It's unique, magical and a thing that you will never forget.

Huge array of plants, flowers and trees.. The domes are nice but very crowded and I found that quite trying especially the number of people blocking walkways taking forever to take photos. The wooden sculptures inside were amazing. The outside part (which is free) is actually nicer (although v humid with some wierd sculptures).. It is worth a visit and does have some amazing views of the bay.

This place is indeed magical! The pictures online do not do it justice. We visited on an evening and bought tickets for the flower dome and cloud forest. We came back again during the day to experience the walkway. It was fun reading up about all the different flowers and their origins. This place is so colourful and is the true definition of heaven if you like flowers. Plenty of opportunities to take the most beautiful pictures. I would recommend spending about 4 hours in this place and making sure you witness the transition from day to night which can be magical. The supertree experience at night is one thing I'll never forget.

There is a food court so it it quite easy to relax.

Free WiFi as well!!!

Fabulous, lots to see. Cloud forest was amazing. Easy to walk around with good signposting. Domes were well co-ordinated. Only fault was the Aster cafe where we were told they didn‚Äôt open for another 3 minutes!

We visited 5 years ago and thought it was amazing then, it has only got better!!

Definitely a place to have on your to-do list.

Got to see orchids! Amazing sight...
The light show in the night is not to be missed. They have a buggy incase you cant walk.
Must see Gardens by the Bay, indoor plants of thousands of varieties when in Singapore, Both flowers , bonsai and full grown trees best time to visit at dawn
The gardens are subdivided into zones each with great features accessible services and fully air conditioned. They are one of the best I have ever seen.

REVIEW_TITLE: It's ok for me...... partner and partner's parents and extended family loved it
REVIEW_BODY:
Technically it was not a "couples" visit. There was no "family without kids" option to select. Went with partner, partners ' parents and extended family, all in their 50s and 60s so couldn't select "family with teenagers".

It's ok for me...... partner and partner's parents and extended family loved it so that was all that mattered. Otherwise it looks like a bunch of artificial structures to me.

REVIEW_TITLE: Couldn't wipe the smile off my face..
REVIEW_BODY: What a joyous day (and night) out! Gardens by the Bay was an utter delight. The Flower Dome was a treat for the senses and not to be missed. I swear I have new smile lines across my face as I devoured the spectacular riot of colour on show. I also appreciated the whimsical sculptures strategically placed throughout. Thankfully, their own outdoor satay stalls sustained me so that I could enjoy the evening light and music show - which was well worth waiting for. A highly recommended inclusion for your trip to Singapore.

REVIEW_TITLE: The feeling of the future world
REVIEW_BODY: This is a very wounded place. The design of the park has a feeling of the future world. Two giant greenhouses put the whole forest into it, as if it were human habitation on Mars.

We went to se the gardens by the bay show and it was amazing. I absolutely recommend to do this while in Singapore. So get the absolutely best view, you should lay down on the ground in middle of the threes. It gets very crowded at the end of the show so you should wait 10minuts after to show before you leave. A must-do in Singapore

I guess one of the places to visit in the city during evenings/late evenings. It is just beautiful with the lights and the buzz around. You can see a lot of tourist and joggers around the area. Food options are a plenty and the place is alive. Would recommend it for sure.

We visited the gardens again after last being there in 2017.

it still amazed us how they manage to sustain such a wide variety of plant life in the one dome eco system.

The main point of difference this time is the amount of people that were present. Even though we last travelled during school holidays, the amount of people visiting the gardens was much, much more.

As such you should allow more time to ensure you are able to properly see the entire domes. For instance, our last visit we walked straight into the elevator for the rain forest dome, but this time was a 25 minute wait.

I was told this was too touristy, but of course tourists go and the reason is that it's beautiful. The flowers and gardens are stunning, there is a very important environmental message and it's a cool places to escape the heat.
Amazing must-do place to visit when in Singapore. We visited in the day as you can get a better view of the night time light display from the viewing floor in the Marina Sands Park

REVIEW_TITLE: Crowded, artificial, and a bit IKEA-like
REVIEW_BODY: We didn‚Äôt spend much time in the outdoor portions, so perhaps that might be better. But the two pay-for-access gardens (flowers and cloud forest) are not worth your time or money. Incredibly crowded with essentially a one-way path through, particularly in the cloud forest. Too many people, and the plants are all rather jumbled with no sense of scientific order allowing for a true learning experience. Suggest (weather permitting) you head to the free Bontanical Gardens...

Went in the evening as the crowds were leaving. Lovely light shows in the cooler part of the day. Well worth visiting with beautiful plantings. A gem for local families. We timed it to walk over to see the Marina Bay Sands light show daily at 8or 9pm.

An amazing place, lots to see. Both the flower dome and cloud forest are a must see. The super trees look wonderful and the light show, if a bit Disney, are lovely to watch. If you are going to view the lights from atop the Skyway make sure you get your time slot booked, we booked our tickets on line and failed to get our slot allocated and nearly missed out on the chance to be up there.

I just walking around to the garden after walking at Marina Bay Sands. The distance is about 800 metres from Marina Bay Sands. Amazing light show at 8 pm and nice for relaxing your feet after walking around the city,

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful gardens, lovely place to visit
REVIEW_BODY:
We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Gardens by the Bay. We entered from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel entrance and down an escalator however you can cross under the road bridge next to the hotel and enter the gardens from the side road.
The view from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel entrance is spectacular, it has a really good vantage point to take photos of the tree walkway.
You have to buy tickets to up the walkway or enter the flower dome or cloud dome however all were worth it. The view from the walkway is amazing and good for photo opportunities. Not really for those who suffer from vertigo however I do but was still able to enjoy the walkway. We went up during daylight however on returning another evening we noticed that some people timed their trip up to coincide with the evenig 7:45 light show in the trees there. We viewed that light show from the ground but it was still excellent.
The flower dome is laid out in different counties eg Australia, South Africa, China, beautiful flowers and you the dome is air conditioned so you get a respite from the searing heat outside. The flower dome loos also have a water fountain. We were advised by the staff to fill our water bottles from the fountain towards the back of the dome as the water is chilled there. Water fountains elsewhere were luke warmish and not so good.
Enjoyed the cloud dome also. There is a lift up to the higher level and from there several walkways and escalators bring you back down where you can see crystals etc and stop at variation photo opportunity platforms.
We also ended up walking out to Satay by the Bay to finish with a meal at the hawker food market out that way. Excellent. Woudl recommend a visit and the food.

The evening light and music show is fantastic - find a spot and just lie down on the spotless floor. Quite busy around the show times. For a wider look around early morning before it gets too hot is perfect.

The gardens are stunning and magically lit at night. As with all of Singapore, the grounds are spotless and beautifully maintained. The supertrees are magical especially at night. We were in the park at 11pm at night and felt very safe.
Amazed by the architecture and presentation of plants, clean well kept - a must to visit when in Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice play to enjoy beauty of Singapore and gardens
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful gardens to enjoy with children , spend the day and learn flowers, plants and most amazing natural trees. A must cost please when in Singapore. Dress for extremely warm environment and humid

We first took the audio tour around the Gardens...highly recommended as even if you think you can walk the whole gardens...you may find you run out of time...we also bought tickets to both domes...money well spent...It was the orchid festival and the blooms were magnificent! Cannot say enough about this place...do not miss when coming to Singapore....spent the whole day and could have stayed longer....It is also magnificent at night but as we could see the laser light show from our hotel room balcony we did not stay...everyone told us Gardens by the Bay was not to be missed and they were right!
Quite amazing man made domed garden. A good idea in very hot and humid days... enjoy th√© M√©diterran√©e or rainforest fresher climate!

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth spending much of a day there
REVIEW_BODY: We had a great day at Gardens by the Bay. It is worth sending some hours in both of the huge greenhouses - "Flower Dome" and "Cloud forest" which have an amazing variety of plants and are also air-conditioned. We went at at ime of an orchid festival which had amazing displays. There is much else to explore and it is essential to be there in the evening for the light and sound display in Supertree Grove. There are good restaurants although we found the outdoor food-court style of Satay by the Bay humid and with noisy music. We enjoyed a morning coffee in the Fennel cafe but it was closed when we went to get some tea in the afternoon. One disappointment for New Zealanders was that, despite attempts to represent most world environments, there appeared to be no acknowledgement of NZ's unique flora and several presentations of world maps even left off NZ completely.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place, one of the must see in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: This is a top destination like no other, a must see in Singapore and the entire family had a good time.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth the walk and the wait
REVIEW_BODY: Truly beautiful, the super trees are impressive and the cloud dome is fantastic. The flower dome is also amazing but if you only have time for 1 go the cloud dome

REVIEW_TITLE: Trees are impressive, lightshow shouldn't be missed
REVIEW_BODY: Go to the first skytrees in the beginning for some close up foto's, but make sure to proceed to the park of trees for the lighshow. That is fun to see and witness. Stay on the ground to see most of it. If on the skybridge you risk the possibility to be herded like cattle by the staff...
A nice place to bring family for a leisurely walk and be impressed by the display and the vision of the engineers who created this visual spectacle.
Definitely enjoyed this. I thought the Cloud Forest was more interesting for the average person. But those who really know their plants would get a lot out of the Flowerdome too
Bought our tickets online so stright to the turnstile and in, the flowers were spectacular vibrant colors and the scented orchides were very nice an enjoyable half a day.

I had an amazing time! Everything I expected. Definitely recommendable to family and friends.
I will surely come back!
This was such a cool place to visit. Figuratively and literally ... but go in the heat of the day to cool off or in the morning if you want less crowds or wait times.
The Flower Dome was beautiful. Cloud Dome amazing. Light and Sound show a cant miss. Expect to wait a while for a taxi if leaving straight after as its so popular. Totally worth it though

Best to visit the outdoor areas and tree walk earlier rather than later as it gets hot, then go to the air conditioned bio-domes for a cooling, spectacular treat for the eyes. Go there, it's wonderful...but give yourself plenty of time. We spent the day there.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best way to Relax after 5 pm
REVIEW_BODY:
Best view on the Bay, the Gardens, the famous boat building . You can‚Äôt not be impressed by the magnificence of the Site . And the music and light show at 7:45 pm is worth the wait . Plenty of things to do there . I choose to cross the platform .
You can cross to Marina Bay and enjoy view on the City.

I consider myself to be a competent gardener, at least I did until I visited Gardens by the Bay. This is what you get when you have an uber-landscape architect combined with infinite amounts of money. I have visited lots of gardens but this one is not to be believed. The orchid displays alone justified the price of admission. It was a bit crowded but not unbearably so. The conservation/eco-awareness message was part of every exhibit. If you visit one tourist attraction make it this one.
Gardens by the sea is a very impressive place with so many things to see and to do. The first place to visit in Singapore!

We went there in the night and it was absolutely beautiful. Plenty to see and do and a nice walk on the water. We found it very crowded though especially when people were going to the light show at the end of the night.

The most beautiful gardens I have ever visited. I just kept saying wow. Before we went into the conservatories we did the 20 minute tour which gave us a good idea of what we wanted to see. To see everything would take a full day. We just did the two main features and then went back to the hotel to cool off. Had I had more time in Singapore I would have gone back a second time. If I get to Singapore again I will definitely pay another visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful gardens, with the night light show worth staying for!!
REVIEW_BODY: On a whistle stop tour, you must go see the Waterfall and the orchids in the two domes, make time though. At night stay around for the 7.45pm light and music show. stunning. We watched it from the Skypark on the Marina Bay Sands hotel one evening, but being under the trees the following evening was just amazing,

Gardens by the Bay-Singapore:
- Worth to see, especially OCBC Garden Rhapsody and super trees
- Some places are free to visit, some you must pay

I do not usually like these artificial environments, but Gardens by the Bay has pleasantly surprised me. The gardens are perfectly laid out, the information given is excellent and educational and the upkeep is simply impeccable. Fantastic activity for a couple of hours
It was overall a great experience and everyone was quite considerate when we entering to visit. Would definitely recommend it for a day‚Äôs visit!

Visited here in August 2019 and although hot, the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest are air conditioned so can get some relief from the humidity. The outside gardens are lovely however the flower dome is amazing and at the time they had a special floristry expedition on that ended with a 4D flight of the dragonfly ride which was awesome. This and the Dome and Forest all cost extra however can get a 3 activity ticket for cheaper than buying all individually. Would highly recommend going, the light show at night was amazing and worth the wait - get there early to secure a seat.
Excellent family fun. This is so pretty and educational. The outside gardens are free. It costs extra for the inside gardens and skywalk. This is worth a trip on a long layover.
Really nice place to spend time with loved ones, highly recommended for families who are looking for a good time!

We only went to the super trees (limited by money) but they were incredible! We would definitely recommend paying and waiting to get up one of the super trees around the time of sunset, as the view is stunning. Loads of different species of plant growing along the super trees. Lights make gardens by the Bay look even better at night. A must-do in Singapore!

Flower dome is beautifull. Rain forest dome is very impressive. Every hour they vaporize water so you feel like in a rainforest with mist like effect. Supertree grove is beautifull day and night. 2 night shows with light and music aroud 19.45h and 20.45h. The skywalk is a must-do.

I was really impressed by the lights and music show here. There were lots of people and it's a bit crowded but worth it. Some are lying on the benches while watching the lights dance in the music and if I would return here again I would do the same. It just feels like watching the stars from above.

Must visit. It‚Äôs big beautiful and futuristic. Afternoon is a good time to go, chose weekdays. Wear comfortable shoe or sandal. No matter you take buggy you have to walk a lot. Kids and elderly people friendly but still it‚Äôs difficult to see whole garden with them. Evening light show is worth watching. You can buy tickets on the spot. Singapore flyer and marina bay sends hotel is near by so you plan everything in one day.

If you are into gardens and flowers it is a must see in Singapore.
Loads of varieties of tropical plans are on display in both of the domes. The walk around the waterfalls in nice and this place offers too many opportunities for photoshoots.
Snap trap plants were exciting to see.

I really wanted to see the tree structures. Entry is free although you have to pay to go on the trees walkway. Its really worth visiting - great views. There is also a light show at 7.45pm, just sit by the trees and enjoy!
Loved my time there.. absolutely stunning light show. Loved the. Loud dome and plant dome.. well worth it.
You need plenty of time to see everything here and include the night light show, would recommend doing the skywalk during the light show
It was like nothing we have ever seen before! It was really lovely! Singapore has been very beautiful. Don‚Äôt wish to leave this country

I and my parents are disappointed because of the crowds..and we can't enjoy both the flower dome and cloud forest..ppl pushing and just can't get good pictures.Just too crowded.Even in the queue to get in ppl just cant wait to get in and cut my family's queue.Overall we love the landscape .
The flowers were exquisite; the Landscaping was out of this world. The collection of Orchids was amazing. I rate it better than the Miracle Garden Dubai. The Gardens by the Bay look more natural.
A must see for anyone visiting Singapore - easily accessible by MRT system. Loads of different options to visit or just walk round and enjoy

We toured the gardens by shuttle first then walked around them. We were here for about 6 hours which included a visit to the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest Dome but we could have certainly stay longer. The gardens are beautifully kept and well set out, we loved every minute of our visit. The Super trees were amazing, we can‚Äôt wait to see them at night.
Enjoyed the close up contact with animals in an open environment. A must for any one visiting Singapore

REVIEW_TITLE: Day or Night the garden is a must
REVIEW_BODY: Day or night a walk around the gardens is a must. To see the light show get there about 45 mins beforehand you can also sit on the grass or benches at the base of the super trees. During the weekday the lines ups to get up the super trees are good but for the evening sunset, it starts to get busy and weekends are super busy.
You must going to it if you are in singapore in my opinion 1st attraction in singapore must doing it it free and there was cloud and flower tickets price 21$

The reviews are true! This place is wonderful to visit. Such beautiful flowers and plants. The way the whole area is landscaped to perfection. This is an icon of Singapore. It is worth paying entry to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest. Pricing is very reasonable. Make sure you add this to your list of places to visit.

It is at its best in the evening: the light of the trees and of Marina bay creates a fantastic picture.
But we had lots of fun also in the afternoon in the sprinkler plaza... my son was having such a good time and it was so hot that I went in alsoüòÄ. I dried up in minutes after

REVIEW_TITLE: Did not find it worth visiting
REVIEW_BODY: Garden by the way has some of the best plants covered across and give an experience of sky walk... people who loves to see different plans would like this and definitely not every one will like l. Has the water fall which is an attraction and you can click pictures. I personally did not like this as had to wait for almost 1 hours to get the lift to claim up.... neither me nor my kids find this place to be.

REVIEW_TITLE: A good way to escape the heat
REVIEW_BODY:
We visited here on our first day as it was a "must see" attraction of Singapore.

The area and the building are quite impressive and it is amazing to see what they have been able to achieve inside and out. After a long hit walk it was great to be able to enjoy such a beautiful place indoors in the AC.

Beautiful collection of flowers and displayed very well. Also, the staff are friendly and cooperate in taking photos.
A must visit during a trip to the Lion City. Kudos to the Singapore Government!!!

We went to visit the flower and cloud domes. The flower dome was nice enough nothing spectacular, but the cloud dome was awesome !! Loved the different platforms and giant waterfall! Kids enjoyed it too! Very education as well- especially the short film on global warming at the end. We had brunch at the cafe before heading to the domes. we can back the next night for the night light show - which was fantastic! It was beyond my expectations! Loved it !

This place is amazing. Cloud Forest and Flower Dome are a little crowded at the entrance but worth the wait (15mins to 30mins) wait time for the lift in Cloud Forest. Do the Flower Dome on Dusk as the lighting is fantastic. Light Show on the Giant Trees was also amazing. Easy access to cabs from car park however no hop on bus after 8.00pm.
A must see.

The place can be packed so go in early.

I love how well the place is maintained! The flowers were so beautiful! Thank God there were no bees inside.

Best to go in the afternoon to night so that it isn‚Äôt too warm to walk around. Prepare your eyes to feast on the beauty of so many flowers!

REVIEW_TITLE: One of the Best Things For Kids and nature Lovers
REVIEW_BODY: This is an amazing indoor Garden with World's tallest indoor waterfall, vast variety of plants , flowers , succulents , cactus and some amazing flowers we could see. Our Daughter enjoyed her day here , Must Visit

A must place to visit in Singapore Largest Man Made Gardens with beautiful plants and flowers everywhere. Do not forget to take ticket for Flower dome and Cloud Forest which is the must visit place in Gardens By the Bay. Best time to visit is at 5 PM so that you can enjoy Light and sound show at 7.45 PM. Must go

Another place I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd have any interest of going to but it was very well laid out. I don‚Äôt know if the audio guides are of any benefit but the few different info boards give you a different insights to the various gardens. Worth the money I paid

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by the Bay is a must see while in Singapore!
REVIEW_BODY:
Gardens by the Bay is one of the top attractions while in Singapore. You must understand that there are many very different parts of this and can best be understood by going into their website and seeing the 10 different attractions that are all part of the Gardens by the Bay. Just click "attractions" on the website.

Perhaps the main attraction is the Supertree Grove. This can be seen during the day but it is absolutely wonderful at night during one of the two daily light shows which are free! It's a 15 minute show that should not be missed and make sure you bring the kids along if they are with you. Personally its best to visit during the day AND during the show at night and you will see two very different perspectives.

If you are visiting in the hot humid summer, plan on visiting the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest, also part of Gardens by the Bay. I say especially in the summer because these are both indoor and the temperature is cool, in fact I suggest bringing a light jacket or sweater. There is a charge for both of these attractions.

As you will see from the website, there are many more attractions to visit, some of the others are also free.

Suggestion: Although it's pricy, the Sands Marina Hotel is right next to Gardens by the Bay. Stay here at this wonderful hotel and you will have easy access to the Gardens, day and night instead of taking taxi's, like we did, visiting the Gardens a number of times.

Spent most of the day there today. It was perfect in all respects. Cloud Forrest and Flower Dome were spectacular. The super tree grove and sky walk were amazing. Pricing was reasonable. Lots of staff around who were friendly and helpful.

Can't recommend this place highly enough......fantastic place and so worth it.
A colourful garden of trees and flowers all over the world that can offer visitors wonderful pictures!

Make sure you include this park in your visit! We saw the orchard festival and the sky tree grove is the best! Sensational, exciting and beautiful! Light show from 7.45am that turns this beautiful space into a dynamic end of the day!! So beautiful!

Excellant place to visit when visiting Singapore would recommend to visit
Gardens by the bay no problems

Just shows what humans can build if they want. Hats off to people behind this. We enjoyed cloud forest, the flower dome also was amazing and kids loved the variety shown there. The light show was a little dampner and was just ok

After a decade, I came to Singapore.

I have not know that Singapore developed such a place like Gardens by the sea.

It is a fantastic place where anyone regardless ages, can enjoy on their own ways.

Lots of green, space and some splash of waters.
Unreal attractions and for an extremely reasonable price. Would highly recommend all of the chargeable events and the free light show is a must see. Simply stunning.
This is a must. We spent nearly a whole day here, just a wonderful display and so interesting well worth the visit.
this is the place to visit, as by visiting the gardens you will be able to visit tree grove, skyway, the dome, etc. Therefore will be able to tick a lot of must see boxes in Singapore.
Just incredible. Th flower dome was out of this world!! Thank you to all responsible for bringing this vision to reality
Absolutely beautiful walking around these green masterpieces especially at night with perfect photo opportunities.
Fantastic day, well worth a visit, even if haven‚Äôt got long in Singapore, try to fit this in.We spent most of the day wondering around, we were picked up at hotel,by Tour East.

Very cool place to visit.
Lots of flowers from around the world.
Take your camera with you.
A must see.

The flower dome and night time light show were the absolute highlight of Singapore for me. Loved every minute and would recommend this is not to be missed . Worth the time to visit both day and night .
It is a must see attraction and to go back at night and see the trees lit up and music show is amazing and so beautiful.

If you're a plant lover, it is a must see. We preferred the Botanical Gardens to this one however, I would just visit both! The people who work to keep this place in order should be proud of themselves! If you do go, stop by and greet the hard working gardeners who are working away in the scorching heat.

Absolutely worth the trip and the heat to see the SuperTree Grove and Cloud section, the Children‚Äôs Garden and Silver Garden were beautiful! Great views of the marina Bay Sands and the Marina skyline of the Singapore Flyer

These are great to see, we spend hours there during the day and went back in the evening after dinner, the night lights are beautiful. The gardens are clean and the 2 domes are worth a visit. It's a short walk from Marina Sands hotel

This is a big call but I‚Äôm prepared to say Gardens by the Bay is the only reason you need to visit to Singapore. Anything else is a bonus. It is that good - an utterly astonishing achievement. A wonderland of delight. An incredible feast for the senses in every way.

These gardens are nothing short of amazing. We spent several hours here today just gasping at the size and scale of the place and the beauty everywhere. I have never taken so many photos. Every part of these gardens is utterly magnificent. I would not know where to begin describing them as there is so much to see. They are superbly and thrillingly designed. They are beautifully and meticulously maintained. It is a truly wondrous place. We spent four hours here. I‚Äôd really like to spend many many times more. Entrance to everything is not cheap. But gosh, is it worth it. It is worth every cent and more. It is an essential thing for everyone.

We went to an alleged botanic gardens in the great city of Rome last week. It was a once great space that is now sad and neglected. A shadow of a decent gardens due to inadequate resources and presumably lack of interest. The Singaporeans are doing the exact opposite. Their achievement with Gardens by the Bay says so much about their intelligence, energy, confidence and competence.

Do not miss this place.

We spent 5 hours here and could easily have spent another 5 hours !
We arrived early in the day to avoid the heat - a good plan. There is so much to see - in addition to the two fabulous glass domes. Plenty of places to stop for refreshments we ate a late lunch at Satay by the Bay - a food court with very reasonably priced local dishes. The shuttle buses run regularly- very handy for tired legs at the end of the day.
You can re-enter if you get a hand stamp - we ran out of tome to do this but with better planning would have done so.
Well worth a visit

Exceeded our expectations. Spectacular a must see for all visitors. Informative staff. Easy access to all areas.
Plant life well displayed with good information on types & locations.

Visited here after reading about it and some reviews.

The gardens are free to enter however you have to pay 8S$ to the Skywalk and a further 28S$ for the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome. We got a 10% reduction on the later price by presenting our Singapore Airlines Boarding card.

The whole park are is very large with plenty to see, eating places etc.

The Skywalk is approached by a lift which takes you up look out over the tops of the ‚Äòtrees‚Äô and gives you a walk in the sky to be able to appreciate these structures, the plants growing on them and wider views of the park.

The Flower Dome was quite busy as they had a special exhibition of orchids which showed their colours, scent and how spectacular they look en mass. The cloud Forest was interesting in that entered at the bottom of a 7+ storey waterfall.
From here you could walk around seeing the huge variety of plants before taking a lift to the top from you walked gently down to bottom seeing different plants, their environments etc.

Overall a very special place to visit.

We Visited in August with a 17 year old boy so didn‚Äôt expect his interest to be held for long BUT to our surprise we were there for hours.
The Gardens by the bay are so beautiful, we purchased tickets for the two Domes which were so cool a welcome break to the humidity outdoors.
The only disappointment was we purchased tickets to go up the Supertrees which didn‚Äôt seem very good value for money and you get moved on very quickly.
Gardens by the bays are a must do

I attended the ND concert this year on Saturday which was located in Gardens By the Bay. The venue was busy and free to enter with some local singers and comedians on the stage. The food stalls were goo too. The Gardens themselves are great to walk in when it is not too hot or humid.

REVIEW_TITLE: You've got to do this if in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: What a wonderful amenity for the residents and visitors to Singapore. The gardens has two main exhibits‚Ä¶ the Flower Dome and the Cloud Forest. It costs S$ 28 to see both of them and it is well worth the price of admission. Start with the Cloud Forest‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a much more expansive display and will take you more time to explore. It‚Äôs also busier so starting there earlier is always a good idea. The layout ingeniously takes you back to the same gift shop from both exhibits. Gardens by the Bay also has a wonderfully diverse food court to grab an inexpensive but good meal.
The garden is large, the super trees nice to see. But the two domes make this day great. In the domes you find mysterious beautiful plants and flowers. A must for Singapore visitors.

REVIEW_TITLE: Gardens by The Bay - Must See
REVIEW_BODY: This is a must see when visiting Singapore. Even for the non gardeners this is well worth a visit. Combined with a visit to the Cloud Forest this was one of the highlights of our recent visit to Singapore

As other reviews have said this should not be missed. We tend to like natural settings more but this has been done in a thoughtful way that captures that feeling. The two dome are fantastic, especially the cloud forest. Make sure that you go to the top and slowly make your way down. We were there when it was very busy but as my partner has a slight hip disability the lovely staff allowed us to bypass the long line waiting to go up the lift. Go right to level 7 which I think is as far as you can go. We both love orchids and there is certainly plenty of them.
Would have like to have seen the night display but were unable to fit that in. All in all a great experience. Well done Singapore.

When visited the gardens we pre booked our tickets to save the hassle of lining up to get in.The cloud garden was our favourite but all round it‚Äôs an amazing place.We visited late afternoon when it was cooler.
Very crowded though,the line for the sky walk was 5 deep and Long so we gave that a miss .
The day we went was Thursday,our taxi driver said it would be twice as crowded on Friday,Sat and Sunday.
Hard to imagine but certainly worth visiting .

I go without any expectation and thought it‚Äôs the other giant green house only but in fact, it‚Äôs different from other theme park, it‚Äôs amazing! There is a tall artificial waterfall with hundreds botanic kinds with educational advocates. It‚Äôs good to bring children to visit. Better buy ticket of the whole set including cloudy forest abs flowers dome, cost S$28 only.

The Gardens by the bay is considered to be one of the worlds best indoor garden. Huge collection of flowers, I have even seen such a great collection. The indoor waterfall is best for photography. Can spend 3 hours easily here.
One of the best indoor gardens I have been to in the world they had every thing there form most of Asia it was amazing and laid out perfect..
Visited the Gardens by the bay at night to watch the light show, so worth it, everyone sat around the trees on the floor, very pretty and did not cost a thing. Worth a visit.
Visit the garden by the bay it is one of the best gardens.You cold take snaps with flower dome and could see a cloud dome it is a good place to watch and children like it very much
Don't get me wrong gardens by the bay is beautiful but they want so much money to go in and have a look it was a joke the botanical gardens are so much better

REVIEW_TITLE: Great light show in the evening after sunset.
REVIEW_BODY: This was a new addition to Singapore since my last visit. Their daily evening light show was very enjoyable, with superb backdrop of the Marina Bay Sands. The only thing they could do with improving on is the music that accompanies the show.
This is truly the brainchild of exceptional architecture, and a botanical marvel. Just being able to experience the indoor space with such biodiversity of plant was wonderful. I highly recommend it.
One of a kind dome garden. I think it's only one in the world. The garden is divided into different sections contingent wise. I think you can find all the flowers of the world in one place.

Nice tourist spot with beautiful displays of nature. Several portions are included for a days visit; you should set aside one day to visit the main attractions. During my visit, there was an additional flower attraction which was not really worth the extra money to visit. Do see the night show if you have the time.
A very well organised event. Unfortunately the sihnage wasn;t cear. we went a big round, just to know that we had passed the place long ago. we need to walk back to get into the flora fantay.

For all the nature lovers and whi simply adore the various kinds of flowers etc , this is the place to be !
Visited the cloud forest and the flower dome.
They flower is simply beautiful. Its divided into different types of forests like Mediterranean, South America , Australian etc. Its simply beautiful and the real beauty appears when the sunsets and the lights are turned on. U can go with kids of any age
Also saw some people on wheel chairs. It's very soothing and nice.

Our experience of gardens by the bay was awsome. My family and myself was especially thrilled by the ‚ÄúFloral fantasy‚Äù show and the ‚Äúflight of the dragonfly‚Äù was, for us adults, the return to innocence. The cloud forest and flower done was nothing short of enchanting.

For lovers of flowers, the outdoors and nature, this is a must destination.

With an area of 100 hectares of park and a lot of attractions for the whole family.

This park consists of three gardens in front of the water:

Bay Central garden which joins the other two gardens, a great place to enjoy panoramic views.

Bay South Garden is the largest of the three with 53 hectares, and here there are the most important attractions of this park:

Flower dome: It is a dome 38 meters high heated, where flowers from other climates are exhibited, such as Mediterranean, parts of Australia, South America and South Africa.
Cloud Forest is also another heated dome, higher and there it replicates the subtropical mountain climate.
The main attraction is the Cold Montain of 42 meters high, and the waterfall of 35 meters. All decorated with magnificent flowers and plants that grow in these conditions.
Supertree Grove, these super trees, are the stars of this park, are between 25 and 50 meters high and are vertical gardens, with technology that mimics the ecological function of natural trees.
Children's Gardens, a magnificent space for the little ones, can be enjoyed playing with water, in an area of dancing waters and there are also spaces with slides, sandboxes and more fun places to discover
Bay East Garden, quieter, 2 km next to the water, where you can enjoy some of the most spectacular views of Singapore.

If you are hungry, visit Satay By The Bay, a great place to enjoy satay and other delicious local food, while enjoying the views of the waterfront. Food Stalls open from 11am to 10pm daily, drinks stall open 24 hours.
An absolute must. I‚Äôve never been interested in gardens but this was place something else - exceptional.
Park was so beautiful and light show was also very nice . Must visit place in Singapore.....you can take great pictures for your next Dp

The gardens are gorgeous and a must visit when in Singapore. Be sure to queue early if you plan on walking the skywalk in the evening. You must buy a ticket and also get a time slot when visiting after 5.30pm. There is an amazing light show in the evening which we were lucky enough to see from the skywalk!

Singapore during the day is very hot, can reach 32-36 degrees Celsius. But here, you get the coolness. The scenery here is very beautiful, many beautiful and rare flowers. Kids love it here. We recommend that you avoid weekends so as not to get caught in a queue that is very long and long.

It was an overall nice experience. Visited on spore‚Äôs independence day, was so crowded especially during the light show at night. Better to come earlier or pick other dates to enjoy night show but not as crowded as it was before.

REVIEW_TITLE: Weekday Visit to Gardens by the Bay
REVIEW_BODY: My wife and I and 3 of our friends visited Gardens by the Bay on 13 Aug under the free entry scheme for senior citizens. We could only enter the Flower Dome free of charge. The flora and fauna were refreshing to the eyes but there could have been more flowers from other lands shown. I loved especially the orchids, especially the many local hybrids, on display. Overall, it was quite enjoyable to be among the greenery and flowers.
Amazed by the interior flower arrangement in Flora Fantasy. Good for phototaking. It will be even better if the site is larger.

We loved our visit to Gardens by the Bay. First thing we did was pay $8 to catch the small train which takes you around all of the different gardens. Since the humidity was high we didnt have to walk all around to see the sights. The two domes were amazing. Fantastic to walk inside and see all the amazing plants/flowers. Well worth a visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good place to visit with kids
REVIEW_BODY: Has lot to offer for both adults and kids. Specially for nature lovers - so many different types of vegetation, flowers and gardens. Country specific gardens are also there.

REVIEW_TITLE: The most beautiful place to visit
REVIEW_BODY: We arrived in Singapore early afternoon .We were advised to visit the gardens by our hotel concierge. We bought our tickets and headed there directly .It was an amazing experience .Beautiful flowers and trees presented in the most advanced and organized way .We couldn't get enough of everything .And the light and music show topped it all .It is a must see .
Good exposure to different species of orchids and their origins. If there are more flowers to be exhibited, that will make the trip more enriching.

I began in the floral fantasy dome, and I wish the stunning photos I took could also capture the amazing smell of this place too. The 4D dragonfly adventure was an added bonus.
The flower dome and cloud forest were both extremely busy but I was still able to see the beauty within both conservatories and couldn‚Äôt pick a favourite between the two since they are both completely different.
The OSBC skywalk was a great addition to my trip, as while I was up there the 7:45pm sound and light show commenced. The line was extremely long to get on the skywalk and I was lucky to experience the sound and light show at the same time which added to my experience. Super tree Grove is absolutely iconic, and time it right around sunset allows so stunning scenery.
Gardens by the Bay was my top highlight of my holiday and was worth every entry fee which I bought as a combo ticket at the destination.
An absolute must see in Singapore and I hope to go back one day.
Beautiful place to visit in the afternoon with kids! There are a lot of kinds of trees and flowers which wow the kids and very good spot for photos!
Well Maintained & Fun outing. Floral Fantasy was very nice. Crowded but still well organized. Will go again .
Lots to do/see! An impressive collection of orchids and other pretty flowers. Also very educational for children.
Gardens fee and ok but focus on greenhouses as these are the main attraction. Nice escape from city. Food court very poor (Satay by sea). Eat elsewhere. Pay extra for tree walk - worth it
Well worth the visit and dood value for money. A truley amaxing place with such a variety of attractions on show.

Definitely one of the sights that one will need to visit when in Singapore. This attraction simply one of the best SG offerings have to offer and certainly the place to visit. Tip of the Day,.. visit this place in the evening and partake in the great musical with special lightings effects show...

REVIEW_TITLE: A nice place and very beautiful
REVIEW_BODY:
On a hot humid day the Cloud Forest, Floral Fantasy and the Flower Dome are welcome relief-as well as seeing beautiful sculptures, plants and flowers.
Would highly recommend and will go back at night to see the OCBC Skyway
It was beautiful! I‚Äôm amazed with how tedious it is to maintain such a wonderful place. The flowers and leaves were all fresh.

Lovely place to visit if you love plants. A bit overcrowded. Be prepared to walk a lot if you wanna visit cloud forest, floral fantasy and flower dome plus other free gardens. I preferred the orchid garden held at Singapore botanic gardens. I did the night show with hop on hop off night city tour - bring a mat along so that you can lie down and see the night show... it‚Äôs magical. Same can also be viewed from the bridge connecting marina bay sands to gardens by the bay... free.

Had a chance to visit Cloud forest. This place give s me the feel of a new realm of mountains. There are lot of attractions in the Gardens By the Bay. There is a Dragon and Kingfisher Lakes. It‚Äôs so lovely that will leave you amazed. Also the OCBC Skyway and the Supertree Grove not to leave out the Flower Dome which will thrill you stay there feeling great and leaving you with deep impression after you step out of the Garden. Simply a place not to be missed üëçüëçüëç

Recomended place if you appreciate nature and forrest and photography enthusiast. You can enjoy tropical forrest and flora from around the world in air con domes. There is also new area exebition called Floral Fantasy.

How to get GBTB :
* taxi (very convinience)
* MRT (Bayfront mrt - prepare yourself for walking)

Facilities :
* wheelchair (rent available)
* restaurants

Time to spend :
It is a huge area! Download their map and they provide time estimation to visit some area there. I spent time at least 3 hours only to visit Flower Dome & Cloud Dome. Day and night would bring you difference experience.

Ticketing :
If you are in budget, walking around the area is actually free. Tickets sold separtely and bundling for Flower Dome, Clound Dome, and Floral Fantasy. Frequent visit ticket "Friends of GBTB" also available.

I always looking forward for the special flowers exebition as GBTB will show special collection 3-4 times a year (e.g Sakura, Dahlia, Tulip, and now Orchids). I enjoy the beauty of each plantation and flowers also the tranquil. However, don't go during peak season (weekend, holiday) as it would be too crowded. I annoyed with foreigner tourists who touch/pick the flowers or ruin the display only for selfie purpose, they also don't respect other guests. Better keep distance from them.
